histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosAlwaysShowA11yMenu
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Accessibility Menu is set to be shown regardless of the state of a11y features.(checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosAutoclick
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Autoclick feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosAutoclickDelay
histogram.summary: If the user has enabled Autoclick, this is the delay set by the user for autoclicks to occur, in milliseconds.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosHighContrast
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS High Contrast mode feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosLargeCursor
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Large Cursor feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosScreenMagnifier
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Screen Magnifier feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSpokenFeedback
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Spoken Feedback feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosStickyKeys
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Sticky Keys feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosVirtualKeyboard
histogram.summary: Whether the Chrome OS Virtual Keyboard feature is on (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.InvertedColors
histogram.summary: Whether Windows system settings show that high-contrast mode is enabled and the user has selected a light-on-dark color scheme (checked once 45 secs after startup). This causes Chrome to prompt the user with a bubble to optionally install a High Contrast extension and theme.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ManuallyEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether Chrome has enabled accessibility support because the user passed the --force-renderer-accessibility flag on the command-line (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.State
histogram.summary: Whether Chrome has enabled accessibility support because it detects supported assistive technology running, or due to being manually enabled via a command-line flag (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinAudioDescription
histogram.summary: Whether Windows system settings show that audio descriptions are enabled (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinJAWS
histogram.summary: Whether the third-party JAWS screen reader is running (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinNVDA
histogram.summary: Whether the third-party NVDA screen reader is running (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinSAToGo
histogram.summary: Whether the third-party System Access To Go screen reader is running (checked once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinScreenReader
histogram.summary: Whether Windows system settings show that a screen reader is running (checked once 45 secs after startup). Note that this does not necessarily mean that Chrome has detected a supported screen reader and has enabled its accessibility mode.

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinStickyKeys
histogram.summary: Whether Windows system settings show that Sticky Keys are enabled.

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinZoomText
histogram.summary: Whether the third-party ZoomText screen magnifier is running.

histogram.name: AndroidTabCloseUndo.Toast
histogram.summary: When a user closes a tab an undo toast will popup on certain devices giving the user the chance to undo closing that tab. This stat tracks how the user interacts with that UI and what actions they take. A cold start means that the undo bar wasn't showing when it was triggered to show again. A warm start means that it was. Warm starts can happen when the user closes multiple tabs close together. When the undo bar is dismissed, all closes that were queued up to be undone are committed. This can happen either by a timeout or by an action by the user to move to another part of the UI.

histogram.name: AppBanners.DismissEvent
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks the different ways that an app banner left the screen, e.g. through an automatic dismissal after navigation or an explicit user action.

histogram.name: AppBanners.DisplayEvent
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks when an app banner was requested and how the request was handled, e.g. the user blocked its appearance or the banner was ultimately created.

histogram.name: AppBanners.InstallEvent
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks when a user triggers an install dialog for the app promoted by the banner, as well as whether or not the user ultimately decided to install the app.

histogram.name: appcache.CheckResponseResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: AppCache check response result code.

histogram.name: appcache.CompletionQueueTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between a completion task being queued and run.

histogram.name: appcache.CompletionRunTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to run a completion task on the IO thread.

histogram.name: appcache.CorruptionDetected
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times corruption is detected in the sql database.

histogram.name: appcache.InitResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: AppCache initialization result code.

histogram.name: appcache.JobStartDelay.AppCache
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: How long URLRequests to be retrieved from the appcache are delayed.

histogram.name: appcache.JobStartDelay.Error
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: How long URLRequests that result in a synthesized error are delayed.

histogram.name: appcache.JobStartDelay.Network
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: How long URLRequests to be retrieved over the network are delayed.

histogram.name: appcache.MainResourceResponseRetrieval
histogram.summary: Tracks the success rate of retrieving a main resource from the appcache.

histogram.name: appcache.MissingManifestDetectedAtCallsite
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Identifies where a missing manifest was detected occured.

histogram.name: appcache.MissingManifestEntry
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Logged on each occurrence of there being no record for the manifest file in the entries table.

histogram.name: appcache.ReinitAttempt
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times the appcache reinit process occurs. The boolean value indicates whether it was a repeated attempt to reinitialize during a browsing session.

histogram.name: appcache.SubResourceResponseRetrieval
histogram.summary: Tracks the success rate of retrieving a sub resource from the appcache.

histogram.name: appcache.TaskQueueTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between a background task being queued and run.

histogram.name: appcache.TaskRunTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to run a background task.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateJobResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: AppCache update job result code.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateProgressAtPointOfFaliure
histogram.summary: Percent completion at point of failure of an update job.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateWasOffOriginAtPointOfFailure
histogram.summary: Whether the resource causing the failure was from a different origin.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateWasStalledAtPointOfFailure
histogram.summary: Whether any progresss had been made in the 5 minutes preceeding failure.

histogram.name: Apps.AppLaunch
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times v2 packaged apps are launched grouped by extension_misc::AppLaunchBuckets. See also Extensions.AppLaunch.

histogram.name: Apps.AppLauncherPromo
histogram.summary: Interactions with the App Launcher promo dialog.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListHowEnabled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The trigger that caused the app list to be enabled. Recorded when the user first shows the app list. If not shown after one hour, will be recorded then. If Chrome was not running at the one-hour mark, will be recorded during the next Chrome startup.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchCommenced
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of searches that are started in the app list. This is gathered each time the app list search box transitions from empty to non-empty.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchResultOpenType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The type of app list search result that was opened by the user. This is gathered per click of a search result.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListTimeToDiscover
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time between enabling the app list, and a user explicitly choosing to show it. If the app list is not shown after one hour, an entry in the last bucket is recorded. If the user installs a second packaged app within one hour, or if the app list was not enabled by installing a packaged app from the Web Store, no time value is recorded - only Apps.AppListHowEnabled.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListWarmupDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in warmup (in WarmupForProfile call). This will tell us how long warmup blocks the UI.

histogram.name: Apps.AppShimErrorVersion
histogram.summary: Counts which major milestone versions of app_mode_loader are sending --app-shim-error. --app-shim-error is sent as a command line argument to Chrome when app_mode_loader was unable to dyload the Chrome Framework and call ChromeAppModeMain. For example, when Chrome updates from 32-bit to 64-bit, an older shim will find the new framework version but fail to dyload it.

histogram.name: Ash.ActiveTouchPoints
histogram.summary: Number of active touch-points when a new touch-point is added.

histogram.name: Ash.ActiveWindowShowTypeOverTime
histogram.summary: The show type of the active window tracked over time by logging on a regular basis (30 minutes).

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.Action
histogram.summary: User-initiated action taken that affects docked windows such as docking, undocking, minimizing, restoring, closing or just dragging a docked window.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ActionSource
histogram.summary: Source (mouse, touch or unknown) of the user-initiated action for docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ItemsAll
histogram.summary: Number of all docked windows or panels including hidden or minimized. Recorded on every user action that interacts with docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ItemsLarge
histogram.summary: Number of large (wider than dock maximum width) windows that had to be shrunk to get docked among the visible docked windows. Recorded on every user action that interacts with docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ItemsPanels
histogram.summary: Number of docked visible panels. Recorded on every user action that interacts with docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ItemsVisible
histogram.summary: Number of visible docked windows or panels. Recorded on every user action that interacts with docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.TimeBetweenUse
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between instances of docking, undocking or any other action affecting docked state of a window.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.Width
histogram.summary: Width of the docked area in pixels. Recorded every time it changes after a user window resize operation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.GestureCreated
histogram.summary: The gesture-events recognized and dispatched by the browser gesture recognizer.

histogram.name: Ash.GestureTarget
histogram.summary: The gesture-events recognized and dispatched by the browser gesture recognizer for various UI components.

histogram.name: Ash.ImmersiveFullscreen.WindowType
histogram.summary: The type of the window which is put into immersive fullscreen. Immersive fullscreen is entered via the F4 key.

histogram.name: Ash.ShelfAlignmentOverTime
histogram.summary: The current state of the shelf (alignment) tracked over time by logging on a regular basis (30 minutes), this is used instead of log in or shelf usage to track users that do not lock/unlock or log in frequently and use a small number of browser instances or otherwise infrequently interact with the shelf launcher.

histogram.name: Ash.ShelfAlignmentUsage
histogram.summary: The current state of the shelf (alignment) when the shelf launcher is used to launch an app/window/etc, this is used instead of log in to give data on users that do not lock/unlock or log in frequently.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchDuration
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 12/2013 in r239809, and replaced by Ash.TouchDuration2.
histogram.summary: The duration of a touch-sequence.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchDuration2
histogram.summary: The duration of a touch-sequence.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchMaxDistance
histogram.summary: The maximum euclidean distance in dips which a touch point has travelled away from its starting point. Only measured for single finger gestures.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchMoveInterval
histogram.summary: The interval between touch-move events.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchMoveSteps
histogram.summary: The distance between touch-move events.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchPositionX
histogram.summary: The position of the touch-events along the X axis.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchPositionY
histogram.summary: The position of the touch-events along the Y axis.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchRadius
histogram.summary: The radius of a touch event.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchStartAfterEnd
histogram.summary: The interval between the end of a touch-sequence and the start of the next touch-sequence.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchStartBurst
histogram.summary: The number of rapid touch-starts that happened within a short interval. Logged once for each such burst group.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActive
histogram.summary: The length of time that TouchView is active, for each activation.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActivePercentage
histogram.summary: The proportion of time spent in TouchView during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActiveTotal
histogram.summary: The total time that TouchView is active during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewInactive
histogram.summary: The length of time between TouchView activations.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewInactiveTotal
histogram.summary: The total time that TouchView is not active during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.DefaultIndex
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 11/2012. Use of indices has been removed.
histogram.summary: The wallpaper index if one of the default wallpapers has been selected. Recorded at user login. Currently only for the old wallpaper picker UI.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Type
histogram.summary: The wallpaper type. Recorded at user login.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.CycleTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time the Alt key is held after pressing Alt+Tab to begin cycling through windows.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.ArrowKeyPresses
histogram.summary: The number of times the arrow keys are pressed in overview mode per session, i.e. between bringing up overview mode and ending it. This is only measured for the sessions that end by selecting a window with the enter key.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.CycleTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 06/2014. No longer relevant since alt-tab switching was separated from WindowSelector.
histogram.summary: The amount of time the Alt key is held after pressing Alt+Tab to begin cycling through windows.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.Items
histogram.summary: The number of items (single windows or groups of windows such as panels) in the overview mode, present at the start of each session.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.ItemsWhenTextFilteringUsed
histogram.summary: The number of items showing in overview mode at the moment when an item is selected or when selection is canceled. Only recorded if the text filtering textfield contains a non-empty string.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.KeyPressesOverItemsRatio
histogram.summary: The ratio between the arrow key presses and the number of overview items, expressed as a percentage for a single session.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.OverviewClosedItems
histogram.summary: The number of items closed from the window overview for a single session.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TextFilteringStringLength
histogram.summary: The length of the string entered into the text filtering textfield at the moment when an item is selected or when selection is canceled.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TextFilteringTextfieldCleared
histogram.summary: The number of times the text filtering textfield has had all of its text removed within a single overview mode session. Measured from the time overview mode is invoked to when an item is selected or when selection is canceled.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TimeBetweenUse
histogram.summary: The amount of time between uses of overview mode to switch between windows.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TimeInOverview
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in overview mode. Overview mode is engaged by pressing the overview button. The time is measured from the moment the windows begin animating to a thumbnail size preview to when a window is selected or selection is canceled.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TimeInOverviewWithTextFiltering
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in overview mode when text filtering is used. The time is measured from the moment the windows begin animating to a thumbnail size preview to when a window is selected or selection is canceled. Only recorded if the text filtering textfield contains a non-empty string.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.AttemptCountFail
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of DnsAttempts before DnsTransaction completes with failure.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.AttemptCountSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of DnsAttempts before DnsTransaction completes successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigChange
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether DnsConfigService::OnConfigChange actually corresponded to a change in DnsConfig.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigNotifyInterval
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time between calls to DnsConfigService::InvalidateConfig.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParseDuration
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent parsing DnsConfig.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParsePosix
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing DnsConfig in DnsConfigServicePosix.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParseResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether DnsConfig was parsed successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParseWin
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing DnsConfig in DnsConfigServiceWin.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.DNSChangerDetected
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether the first valid DnsConfig included a rogue nameserver.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.DnsClientDisabledReason
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned by DnsTask if a subsequent ProcTask succeeded, at the end of a streak of failures after which the DnsClient was disabled.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.DnsClientEnabled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TRUE counts the events when a valid DnsConfig is received and used to enable DnsClient, while FALSE counts the events when DnsClient is disabled after a series of successful fallbacks from DnsTask to ProcTask.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.FallbackFail
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent by ProcTask in failing fallback resolutions.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.FallbackSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent by ProcTask in successful fallback resolutions.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HaveDnsConfig
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether there was a valid DNS configuration at the start of a job which eventually completed successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostParseResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether DnsHosts were parsed successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsChange
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether DnsConfigService::OnHostsChange actually corresponded to a change in DnsHosts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsNotifyInterval
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time between calls to DnsConfigService::InvalidateHosts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsParseDuration
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent parsing DnsHosts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsParseWin
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing DnsHosts in DnsConfigServiceWin.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The size of the HOSTS file observed before each attempt to parse it.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_HIGHEST
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority HIGHEST when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_IDLE
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority IDLE when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_LOW
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOW when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_LOWEST
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOWEST when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_MEDIUM
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority MEDIUM when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_HIGHEST
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority HIGHEST when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_IDLE
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority IDLE when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_LOW
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOW when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_LOWEST
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOWEST when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_MEDIUM
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority MEDIUM when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.NameServersType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Type of nameservers in the DNS config, recorded each time the config is read by the DNSConfigService.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ParseToAddressList
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing addresses out of DNS responses in successful DnsTransactions.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveError
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned by DnsTask if a subsequent ProcTask succeeded.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveFail
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsTask in resolutions that failed. Excludes time spent in the subsequent fallback.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveStatus
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts of the overall results of using asynchronous DNS in HostResolverImpl. This only includes jobs started with valid DNS configuration and excludes synchronous resolutions (as IP literals, from cache, and from HOSTS).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsTask in resolutions that succeeded.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_IPV4
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to pure IPv4 lookups.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_IPV6
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to pure IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_UNSPEC
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to IPv4/IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerCount
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of servers in DnsConfig. Recorded on every new DnsSession, which is created on DNS change.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailureIndex
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Index in DnsConfig of the failing server, recorded at the time of failure.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailuresAfterNetworkChange
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of server failures after network change before first success in the DnsSession. Recorded at the time of first success.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailuresAfterSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of server failures after success until the end of the session. Server has reported success at some point during the session. Recorded at the end of the DnsSession.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailuresBeforeSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of server failures before success. This is NOT the first success in the DnsSession. Recorded at the time of success.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailuresWithoutSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of server failures without success until the end of the session. Server has never reported success during the DnsSession. Recorded at the end of the DnsSession.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerIsGood
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The current server is "good" and does not have to be skipped.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SortFailure
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SortSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in successful calls to AddressSorter in dual-stack resolutions using DnsTask.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SuffixSearchDone
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SuffixSearchRemain

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SuffixSearchStart
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TCPAttemptSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutErrorHistogram
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Difference between RTT and timeout calculated using Histogram algorithm.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutErrorHistogramUnder
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutErrorJacobson
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutErrorJacobsonUnder
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Difference between timeout calculated using Jacobson algorithm and RTT.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutSpentHistogram
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutSpentJacobson
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time that would be spent waiting for lost request using Jacobson algorithm.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TotalTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time since a HostResolverImpl::Resolve request to the time a result is posted. Excludes canceled, evicted, and aborted requests. Includes cache hits (recorded as 0). Excludes speculative requests.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TotalTime_speculative
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time since a HostResolverImpl::Resolve request to the time a result is posted. Excludes canceled, evicted, and aborted requests. Includes cache hits (recorded as 0). Speculative requests only.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TransactionFailure
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in failing DnsTransactions. This includes server failures, timeouts and NXDOMAIN results.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in successful DnsTransactions. This includes all NOERROR answers, even if they indicate the name has no addresses or they cannot be parsed.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess_A
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess but limited to A query type.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess_AAAA
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess but limited to AAAA query type.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TTL
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TTL of the resolved addresses, as in the response received from the server. For results served from local cache, the TTL is from the original response.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UDPAttemptFail
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UDPAttemptSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UnchangedConfigInterval

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.WatchStatus

histogram.name: Aura.CreatedGpuBrowserCompositor

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressBook.AccessSkipped
histogram.summary: Whether an attempt to access the Mac AddressBook was skipped because doing so would incorrectly cause the appearance of the permissions dialog. This happens when Chrome auto-update changes the binary on disk before the first AddressBook access attempt.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressBookAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Mac AddressBook was available on an attempt to read data from it.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressBookAvailableOnFirstAttempt
histogram.summary: Whether the Mac AddressBook was available on the *first* attempt to read data from it. This is only recorded once per Chrome profile.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressSuggestionsCount
histogram.summary: The number of address suggestions shown in the Autofill popup.

histogram.name: AutoFill.CCInfoBarAccepted
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.CreditCardInfoBar.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The Autofill credit card info bar was accepted.

histogram.name: AutoFill.CCInfoBarDenied
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.CreditCardInfoBar.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The Autofill credit card info bar was denied.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardInfoBar
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which users accept, deny, or ignore the Autofill credit card info bar prompt.

histogram.name: Autofill.DeveloperEngagement
histogram.summary: Measures the adoption of the HTML autocomplete type hint specification (see http://is.gd/whatwg_autocomplete for more details). For each fillable form detected, logs whether that form includes author-specified type hints.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromInteraction.WithAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the user's first interaction with a form and the form's submission, for an autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromInteraction.WithoutAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the user's first interaction with a form and the form's submission, for a non-autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromLoad.WithAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between form load and form submission, for an autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromLoad.WithoutAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between form load and form submission, for a non-autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.IsEnabled.PageLoad
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Autofill is enabled on page load for a page containing forms.

histogram.name: Autofill.IsEnabled.Startup
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Autofill is enabled when Chrome launches.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook
histogram.summary: When Chrome tries to access the user's Address Book, OSX presents a blocking dialog which disrupts the user experience. A new Chrome feature has been introduced wherein Chrome only shows this blocking dialog if the user explicitly asked Chrome to access the user's Address Book. If a form's field looks like it might support Autofill suggestions from the user's Address Book and there are no other suggestions, Chrome shows an Autofill entry that prompts the user to give Chrome access to the user's Address Book. This histogram tracks the frequency that this Autofill entry is presented, and the frequency that this Autofill entry is selected.

histogram.name: AutoFill.ProfileCount
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.StoredProfileCount.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill address profiles a user has.

histogram.name: AutoFill.Quality
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.Quality.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The quality of the AutoFill implementation.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 2/2014 (M35), replaced by Autofill.UserHappiness.
histogram.summary: The quality of the Autofill implementation.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.HeuristicType
histogram.summary: The quality of Autofill's heuristic field type detection.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.HeuristicType.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: The quality of Autofill's heuristic field type detection, broken down by the specific field type. Fields with multiple possible types (based on the stored Autofill data) are logged as having ambiguous type.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.PredictedType
histogram.summary: The overall quality of the Autofill field type predictions.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.PredictedType.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: The overall quality of the Autofill field type predictions, broken down by the specific field type. Fields with multiple possible types (based on the stored Autofill data) are logged as having ambiguous type.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.ServerType
histogram.summary: The quality of the Autofill server's field type detection.

histogram.name: Autofill.Quality.ServerType.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: The quality of the Autofill server's field type detection, broken down by the specific field type. Fields with multiple possible types (based on the stored Autofill data) are logged as having ambiguous type.

histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2011, replaced by Autofill.ServerExperimentId.Query.
histogram.summary: The experiment ID received in response to an Autofill server query.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerExperimentId.Query
histogram.summary: The experiment ID received in response to an Autofill server query.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerExperimentId.Upload
histogram.summary: The experiment ID received at the time of an Autofill upload.

histogram.name: AutoFill.ServerQueryResponse
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.ServerQueryResponse.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The usefulness of AutoFill server information.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerQueryResponse
histogram.summary: The usefulness of Autofill server information.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredProfileCount
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill addresses a user has stored, measured at launch time.

histogram.name: Autofill.UserHappiness
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of various events in the Autofill user interaction flow. By comparing frequencies, we can compute several interesting "user happiness" metrics.

histogram.name: BatteryStatus.StartAndroid
histogram.summary: Whether the Battery Status API was successfully started up on Android.

histogram.name: Blacklist.Blocked
histogram.summary: Records the name hashes of all the dlls that are blocked from the browser process.

histogram.name: Blacklist.PatchedInRenderer
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times a renderer process is started with the browser blacklist patch. This should never be hit.

histogram.name: Blacklist.RetryAttempts.Success
histogram.summary: Records the number of attempts needed before the blacklist is properly set up. This is logged immediately after a successful setup.

histogram.name: Blacklist.Setup
histogram.summary: Records the successes and failures when running the browser blacklist setup code. Used to determine if the blacklist is working as intended during startup (since the blacklist runs before crash reporting is set up). This only occurs on Windows.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.CollectGarbage
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to run Heap::collectGarbage().

histogram.name: BlinkGC.PerformPendingSweep
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to run ThreadState::performPendingSweep().

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TotalAllocatedSpace
histogram.summary: The total size of allocated space in OS when a Blink GC is triggered.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TotalObjectSpace
histogram.summary: The total size of object space in all threads when a Blink GC is triggered.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.ConnectedDeviceCount
histogram.summary: Counts the number of simulataneously connected Bluetooth devices. Used to direct testing efforts, and by our UI team to determine appropriate UI sizes.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.PairingMethod
histogram.summary: Records the method used to pair each Bluetooth Device. Used to direct our testing efforts.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.PairingResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of pairing each Bluetooth Device. Used to understand whether we are having significant problems with Bluetooth pairing and seeing errors more commonly than we should.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.LaunchDepth
histogram.summary: Logs the depth of the bookmark in the bookmark tree hiearchy every time a bookmark is launched. Depth indicates how many levels below a permanent bookmark folder the bookmark was found in (e.g. a bookmark immediately in the bookmark bar has depth 1).

histogram.name: Canvas.ContextType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the context type names used to create canvas rendering contexts.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.DetectResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of a captive portal probe.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Notification.Status
histogram.summary: Count of displayed and not displayed due to errors notifications about captive portal.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Notification.UserAction
histogram.summary: Count of clicked, closed and ignored captive portal notifications.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.OOBE.DetectionDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of the captive portal detection process for a particular network at OOBE. Detection duration is recorded each time portal detection is completed for an active network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.OOBE.DetectionResult
histogram.summary: The result of captive portal detection attempts performed at OOBE. Detection result is recorded when portal detection is completed for an active network and when it differs from the previous result for the same network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.OOBE.DiscrepancyWithShill
histogram.summary: The result of captive portal detection attempts at OOBE if it diverges from network manager results. Detection result is recorded each time portal detection is completed for an active network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.OOBE.PortalToOnlineTransition
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds passed between consecutive reports for the same network about portal and online states.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Session.DetectionDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of the captive portal detection process for a particular network in user session. Detection duration is recorded each time portal detection is completed for an active network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Session.DetectionResult
histogram.summary: The result of captive portal detection attempts performed in user session. Detection result is recorded when portal detection is completed for an active network and when it differs from the previous result for the same network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Session.DiscrepancyWithShill
histogram.summary: The result of captive portal detection attempts in session if it diverges from network manager results. Detection result is recorded each time portal detection is completed for an active network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Session.PortalToOnlineTransition
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds passed between consecutive reports for the same network about portal and online states.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastButtonShown
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the number of times the cast button was shown to the user. The value will be true if the button is enabled, and false if the button is disabled. Note that depending on the current UX, it's possible that we hide the button entirely if it's disabled, so it's possible for the false values to be 0.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastButtonShownInitialFullscreen
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the number of times the cast button was shown to the user when the video is fullscreened. The value will only be recorded on entering fullscreen. The value will be true if the button is enabled, and false if the button is disabled. Note that depending on the current UX,it's possible that we hide the button entirely if it's disabled, so it's possible for the false values to be 0.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastMediaType
histogram.summary: Records the media type of every video being cast.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastPlayerResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of a request to play remotely on a per player app basis within Chrome for Android.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastPlaySuccess
histogram.summary: Records the result of a request to play remotely. The value will be true if the playback succeeded, and false if there was an error.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastTimeRemainingPercentage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the percentage of the video left at the time the remote playback is stopped. This will be recorded when the playback is stopped by the user, or when it's stopped by the cast device.

histogram.name: CertificateType
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 8/2013. This histogram only considered the leaf certificate expiry date as a proxy for whether a certificate was in-scope for the BRs, but did not consider the issuance date. As some CAs have issued long-lived certs prior to the BRs, this disproportionately reported those certs as being subject to the BRs, but non-compliant, when in reality they're not subject.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Information about the certificate algorithms and sizes in use on the web, to examine compliance with the CA/Browser Forum requirements and security best practice.

histogram.name: CertificateType2
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Information about the certificate algorithms and sizes in use on the web, to examine compliance with the CA/Browser Forum requirements and security best practice. This histogram considers the notBefore as the issuance date, for purposes of what requirements apply.

histogram.name: Compositing.CopyFromSurfaceTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The turn around time taken for the async readback of pixels is measured here.

histogram.name: Compositing.CopyFromSurfaceTimeSynchronous
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time taken for the sync readback of pixels is measured here.

histogram.name: Compositing.NumActiveLayers
histogram.summary: The number of layers in the active tree for each compositor frame. This is logged once per frame, before the frame is drawn.

histogram.name: Compositing.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.NumIncompleteTiles
histogram.summary: Keeps track of number of incomplete tiles in a drawn compositor frame while scrolling. This is a rough measurement of ugliness during user interaction. Incomplete tiles are non ideal scaled. A sample is recorded everytime a frame is drawn while a scroll is in progress. Tracking bug 381695.

histogram.name: Compositing.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.NumMissingTiles
histogram.summary: Keeps track of number of missing tiles in a drawn compositor frame while scrolling. This is a rough measurement of ugliness during user interaction. Incomplete tiles are checkerboard or solid color. A sample is recorded everytime a frame is drawn while a scroll is in progress. Tracking bug 381695.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.ChromeOsSignalStrength
histogram.summary: Connectivity Diagnostics App: WiFi signal strength recorded during NIC_SIGNAL_STRENGTH test.
histogram.details: The "Strength" property of a WiFi signal is a partially-reversible function that linearly maps the RSSI range -120dBm to -20dBm to Strength values from 0 to 100.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.HTTP_LATENCY
histogram.summary: HTTP latency seen by the Connectivity Diagnostics.
histogram.details: HTTP latency is computed using the chrome.socket API to make an HTTP GET request to the /generate_204 page of three randomly generated Google hostnames (*-ccd-testing-v4.metric.gstatic.com). The time taken from issuing the HTTP request to receiving a response is clocked in JavaScript and the arithmetic mean of the three times is used as the HTTP latency.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.RESOLVER_LATENCY
histogram.summary: Resolution latency seen by the Connectivity Diagnostics.
histogram.details: Resolver latency is computed by using the chrome.dns API to query three randomly generated Google hostnames (*-ccd-testing-v4.metric.gstatic.com). The random hostnames guarantees that there will be no caching of DNS hostnames. The time taken from issuing the DNS request to receiving a response is clocked in JavaScript and the arithmetic mean of the three times is used as the resolver latency.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.TestVerdict
histogram.summary: Connectivity Diagnostics App: Outcome of the connectivity tests.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.TimeTaken
histogram.summary: Connectivity Diagnostics App: Amount of time taken to run each of the connectivity tests.

histogram.name: Cookie.DeletionCause

histogram.name: Cookie.Etldp1Count
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For every top level domain, number of cookies in that domain (recorded every 10 minutes of active browsing time).

histogram.name: Cookie.EvictedLastAccessMinutes
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For each evicted (not expired) cookie, the amount of time since it was last used

histogram.name: Cookie.ExpirationDurationMinutes
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of minutes until cookie expires when set.

histogram.name: Cookie.KillDatabaseResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether killing the database because it was corrupted beyond repair succeeded.

histogram.name: Cookie.NumberOfLoadedCookies
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This histogram records the total number of cookies loaded from disk, including any cookies that are discarded during loading (for whatever reason).

histogram.name: Cookie.ParsedCookieStatus
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 9/2013. Experiment to measure control characters in cookies is finished.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When parsing a cookie, indicates if control characters were present in any of the cookie values and if any of the cookie values were invalid. Specifically, checks that all of the parsed values are valid according to the valid token definition in Section 2.2 of RFC2616 which specifies a token must have no separators (i.e. no characters from the following string, ignoring the starting and ending single quote: '()<>@,;:\"/[]?={} \t') and no control characters.

histogram.name: Cookie.PriorityBlockingTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This histogram records the total duration of time during which at least one web request was blocked waiting for the cookie store to load. If no requests were affected, the value is 0. If two requests are simultaneously blocked for 1 second, the value is 1 second. If two requests are consecutively blocked for 1 second each, the value is two seconds.

histogram.name: Cookie.PriorityLoadCount
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of distinct Effective Top-Level Domains Plus One (ETLD+1, i.e., google.com, bbc.co.uk) for which a priority cookie load occurred.

histogram.name: Cookie.ReinstatedCookies
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The duration in seconds between a cookie getting evicted (due to the number of cookies exceeding a domain limit), and subsequently reinstated.

histogram.name: Cookie.SetAttributePairCharsValidity
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 9/2013. Experiment to measure control characters in cookies is finished.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a cookie attribute pair was set with both a valid key and a valid attribute value or not. For the key, this implies that it was a valid token as defined in Section 2.2 of RFC2616 which specifies a token must have no separators (i.e. no characters from the following string, ignoring the starting and ending single quote: '()<>@,;:\"/[]?={} \t') and no control characters. For the value, this implies that it contained no control characters and no semicolon.

histogram.name: Cookie.SetNameValidity
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 9/2013. Experiment to measure control characters in cookies is finished.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a cookie name was set with a valid token. A valid token is defined in Section 2.2 of RFC2616 which specifies a token must have no separators (i.e. no characters from the following string, ignoring the starting and ending single quote: '()<>@,;:\"/[]?={} \t') and no control characters.

histogram.name: Cookie.SetValueCookieValueValidity
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 9/2013. Experiment to measure control characters in cookies is finished.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a cookie value was valid or invalid when there was an attempt to set it, where a valid value is defined in RFC 6265 as ASCII characters excluding controls, whitspace, comma, semicolon, and backslash.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeBlockedOnLoad
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) between the cookie store load starting and completing.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeGet

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeInitializeDB

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeLoad

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeLoadDBQueueWait

histogram.summary: This histogram records the wall-clock delay between the Load task being posted to the DB-thread and its execution.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeLoadDomains
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeParseDomains

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BlockTypeFallback
histogram.summary: Counts various events that trigger Chrome to block the fallback configuration of the data reduction proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BlockTypePrimary
histogram.summary: Counts various events that trigger Chrome to block the primary configuration of the data reduction proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BypassedBytes
histogram.summary: Counts the response bytes that did not go through the data reduction proxy as the result of a bypass event.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BypassedBytes.NotBypassed
histogram.summary: Counts the response bytes that went through the data reduction proxy and were not bypassed.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BypassInfoFallback
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2014, replaced by DataReductionProxy.BypassTypeFallback.
histogram.summary: Counts various events that trigger Chrome to bypass the fallback configuration of the data reduction proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BypassInfoPrimary
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2014, replaced by DataReductionProxy.BypassTypePrimary.
histogram.summary: Counts various events that trigger Chrome to bypass the primary configuration of the data reduction proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BypassOnNetworkErrorFallback
histogram.summary: Positive net error code that caused the fallback data reduction proxy to be bypassed and put on the proxy retry list. Called after a failure to connect or resolve a host name.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BypassOnNetworkErrorPrimary
histogram.summary: Positive net error code that caused the primary data reduction proxy to be bypassed and put on the proxy retry list. Called after a failure to connect or resolve a host name.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BypassTypeFallback
histogram.summary: Counts various events that trigger Chrome to bypass the fallback configuration of the data reduction proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.BypassTypePrimary
histogram.summary: Counts various events that trigger Chrome to bypass the primary configuration of the data reduction proxy.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.HeaderTamperDetectionHTTP
histogram.summary: For each carrier, the total number of HTTP responses that have been checked for tampering. This assumes the data reduction proxy injected fingerprints have not been tampered with. Only the data reduction proxy responses with 200 OK response code are checked.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.HeaderTamperDetectionHTTPS
histogram.summary: For each carrier, the total number of HTTPS responses that have been checked for tampering. This assumes the data reduction proxy injected fingerprints have not been tampered with. Only the data reduction proxy responses with 200 OK response code are checked.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.HeaderTamperDetectionPassHTTP
histogram.summary: For each carrier, the total number of HTTP responses that passed the tamper detection. This assumes the data reduction proxy injected fingerprints have not been tampered with. Only the data reduction proxy responses with 200 OK response code are checked.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.HeaderTamperDetectionPassHTTPS
histogram.summary: For each carrier, the total number of HTTPs responses that passed the tamper detection. This assumes the data reduction proxy injected fingerprints have not been tampered with. Only the data reduction proxy responses with 200 OK response code are checked.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.HeaderTamperedHTTP
histogram.summary: The total number of HTTP responses that some part (specified by suffix name) have been tampered with. This assumes the data reduction proxy injected fingerprints have not been tampered with. Only the data reduction proxy responses with 200 OK response code are checked.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.HeaderTamperedHTTPS
histogram.summary: The total number of HTTPS responses that some part (specified by suffix name) have been tampered with. This assumes the data reduction proxy injected fingerprints have not been tampered with. Only the data reduction proxy responses with 200 OK response code are checked.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.NetworkChangeEvents
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times various events occur when the data reduction proxy is enabled and the IP address of the client changes.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ProbeURL
histogram.summary: Counts various outcomes of requesting the data reduction proxy's probe URL.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.ProbeURLNetError
histogram.summary: Reports the type of network error when the data reduction proxy probe fails due to a network error.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.PromoAction
histogram.summary: Samples which method was used by the user to dismiss the proxy promo. This is sampled when the promo leaves view, with the sampled value depending on which of four possible controls the user used.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.SettingsConversion
histogram.summary: Samples of user interactions with the ON/OFF switch in the settings menu for reducing data usage. Only the setting changes between entering the reducing data usage setting menu and leaving the menu will be sampled. So if a user enters the menu with OFF and leaves it with OFF, it is counted as one OFF to OFF conversion regardless of how many times he or she toggles the ON/OFF switch.

histogram.name: DataReductionProxy.StartupState
histogram.summary: Samples of the state of the data reduction proxy on Chrome startup. The proxy will either be unavailable (the feature hasn't been rolled out to this user yet), not enabled (the feature is available but the user doesn't have it turned on), or enabled (the feature is enabled and turned on).

histogram.name: Diagnostics.Recovery.DiskSpace
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Shows the success and failure rates of the DiskSpace recovery step that runs on recovery startups. The recovery step attempts to guarantee the DiskSpace test, which checks that the disk space in the volume where the user data directory normally lives is not dangerously low, would pass on the next startup.

histogram.name: DiskBasedCertCache.CertIo
histogram.summary: Records information about DiskBasedCertCache operations with respect to certificate chain positions. Zero indicates that a certificate is root, one indicates that it is the first intermediate certificate, etc.

histogram.name: DiskBasedCertCache.CertIoCacheResult
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of requests to retrieve certificates from the disk cache.

histogram.name: DiskBasedCertCache.CertIoReadSuccessLeaf
histogram.summary: Whether or not the leaf certificate of a certificate chain was successfuly read from the disk cache.

histogram.name: DiskBasedCertCache.CertIoWriteSuccessLeaf
histogram.summary: Whether or not the leaf certificate of a certificate chain was successfully written to the disk cache.

histogram.name: DiskBasedCertCache.ChainReadTime
histogram.summary: Measures the wall clock time spent reading a certificate chain. The starting time is when the read command is issued, and the ending time is when all of the certificates in the chain have been read into memory.

histogram.name: DiskBasedCertCache.ChainWriteTime
histogram.summary: Measures the wall clock time spent writing a certificate chain to disk. The starting time is when the write command is issued, and the ending time is when all the certificates in the chain have been written to disk.

histogram.name: DiskCache.0.FilesAge
histogram.summary: The age of the cache's files (wall time).

histogram.name: DiskCache.2.FilesAge
histogram.summary: The age of the cache's files (wall time). Media-specific cache.

histogram.name: DiskCache.3.FilesAge
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The age of the cache's files (wall time). AppCache.

histogram.name: DiskCache.4.FilesAge
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The age of the cache's files (wall time). ShaderCache.

histogram.name: DiskCache.SizeStats2
histogram.summary: The size distribution of data stored in the HTTP cache.

histogram.name: DiskCache.TotalIOTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total time it takes to perform a payload IO operation, for the regular disk cache.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptCancelled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The attempt which completed after the job was already cancelled.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptDiscarded
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The attempt which completed after the job was already cancelled OR the attempt that has finished after host resolution was already completed by an earlier attempt.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptFailDuration
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in OS resolutions for actual navigations. These attempts which completed after the job was already canceled OR after the job was already completed by an earlier attempt. Note that cached resolutions may provide low (0ms?) resolution times.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptFailure
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The attempt that has not resolved the host successfully.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptFirstFailure
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The attempt that resolved the host first and the resolution was not successful.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptFirstSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The attempt that resolved the host first and the resolution was successful.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The attempt that has resolved the host successfully.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptSuccessDuration
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in OS resolutions that succeeded and were requested for actual navigations. These attempts which completed after the job was already canceled OR after the job was already completed by an earlier attempt. Note that cached resolutions may provide low (0ms?) resolution times.

histogram.name: DNS.AttemptTimeSavedByRetry
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This histogram shows the time saved by having spawned an extra attempt, when the first attempt didn't finish before retry attempt.

histogram.name: DNS.CacheEvicted
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time left to expiration of an entry when it is removed while compacting the HostCache.

histogram.name: DNS.CacheExpired
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time since expiration of an entry when it is removed while compacting the HostCache.

histogram.name: DNS.CacheExpiredOnGet
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time since expiration of an entry when it is removed on lookup.

histogram.name: DNS.EmptyAddressListAndNoError
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Error status when an empty address list was found in OnLookupComplete().

histogram.name: DNS.IndependentFailedNavigation
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When either a pre-resolution was not done recently enough to provide benefit, or the corresponding pre-resolution is still pending, this histogram shows the duration of time used to resolve a hostname as not existing during a failed attempt to navigate to (GET) a URL. In newer versions, if the hostname has never been found as a link during a page scan, and it has a referring URL, then it is added to referrer list data structure (hoping we'll do better next time).

histogram.name: DNS.IndependentNavigation
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When either a pre-resolution was not done recently enough to provide benefit, or the corresponding pre-resolution is still pending, this histogram shows the duration of the duration of time used to resolve a hostname to navigate to (GET) a URL. In newer versions, if the hostname has never been found as a link during a page scan, and it has a referring URL, then it is added to referrer list data structure (hoping we'll do better next time).

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool).

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime_HIGHEST
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority HIGHEST when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime_IDLE
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority IDLE when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime_LOW
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOW when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime_LOWEST
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOWEST when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTime_MEDIUM
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority MEDIUM when started.
