histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool).

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_HIGHEST
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority HIGHEST when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_IDLE
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority IDLE when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_LOW
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOW when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_LOWEST
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOWEST when started.

histogram.name: DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_MEDIUM
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (a getaddrinfo call was dispatched to the thread pool). Includes only Jobs which had priority MEDIUM when started.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchCacheEviction
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The duration of time used (most recently) to pre-resolve a hostname, when the prefetched resolution was apparently evicted from the cache. The included samples only list pre-resolution times when the later navigations/fetches took in excess of 15ms.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchCacheEvictionL
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The duration of time used (most recently) to pre-resolve a hostname, when the prefetched resolution was apparently evicted from the cache. The included samples only list pre-resolution times when the later navigations/fetches took in excess of 15ms.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchFoundName
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Replaced by DNS.PrefetchFoundNameL.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchFoundNameL
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The duration of time used by the DNS pre-resolving threads to resolve a host name via the network. Any resolutions that are faster than 15ms are considered to be local cache hits, not requiring network access, and are not included in this histogram. This histogram is most useful for estimating the typical cost of a name resolution, but it also estimates the total number of network-based resolutions induced by this feature. Not all these resolutions prove helpful (i.e., the user does not always actually visit the resolved hostnames).

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchNegativeHit
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Replaced by DNS.PrefetchNegativeHitL.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchNegativeHitL
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The duration of time saved due to DNS pre-resolving in the "name not found" case. Time "savings" shown in the histogram are defined to be the difference between the DNS pre-resolution duration, and the DNS resolution duration seen during a navigation. These cache hits only list events where the DNS pre-resolve duration for a host was in excess of 15ms (i.e., the network was consulted), and the actual DNS resolution (when a user attempted to navigate to a link with the same host name) took less than 15ms (i.e., the network was not consulted), which means the gain was a result of a "cache hit" in the OS cache. For some users with LANs, all negative results (even when the DNS cache might otherwise help) take about 2.5 seconds (due to timeouts for netbios broadcasts), and hence no savings are possible (or shown) for such users in this category.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchPositiveHit
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Replaced by DNS.PrefetchPositiveHitL.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchPositiveHitL
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The duration of time saved due to DNS pre-resolving in the "name was found" case, and induced by either a page scan for a link or an omnibox entry by the user. Time "savings" shown in the histogram are defined to be the difference between the DNS pre-resolution duration, and the DNS resolution duration seen during a navigation. These cache hits only list events where the DNS pre-resolve duration for a host was in excess of 15ms (i.e., the network was consulted), and the actual DNS resolution (when a user attempted to navigate to a link with the same host name) took less than 15ms (i.e., the network was not consulted), which means the gain was a result of a "cache hit" in the OS cache.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchQueue
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The duration of time spent by a proposed resolution waiting in the queue to be resolved. This number is in addition to any DNS resolution time that may come later.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchReferredPositiveHit
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The duration of time saved due to DNS pre-resolving in the "name was found" case, and induced by predicting (using referrer lists) that a resolution was needed. Time "savings" shown in the histogram are defined to be the difference between the DNS pre-resolution duration, and the DNS resolution duration seen during a navigation. These cache hits only list events where the DNS pre-resolve duration for a host was in excess of 15ms (i.e., the network was consulted), and the actual DNS resolution (when a user attempted to navigate to a link with the same host name) took less than 15ms (i.e., the network was not consulted), which means the gain was a result of a "cache hit" in the OS cache.

histogram.name: DNS.PrefetchResolution
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The duration of time used by the DNS pre-resolving threads to resolve a host name via the network. Any resolutions that are faster than 15ms are considered to be local cache hits, not requiring network access, and are not included in this histogram. This histogram is most useful for estimating the typical cost of a name resolution, but it also estimates the total number of network-based resolutions induced by this feature. Not all these resolutions prove helpful (i.e., the user does not always actually visit the resolved hostnames).

histogram.name: DNS.QueueRecycledDeltaOver2
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When, due to congestion avoidance, a queued pre-resolution is abandoned (recycled) without actually being resolved, this histograms records the age in the queue of that entry. Only times over 2 seconds are recorded in this histogram.

histogram.name: DNS.QueueRecycledUnder2
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When, due to congestion avoidance, a queued pre-resolution is abandoned (recycled) without actually being resolved, this histograms records the age in the queue of that entry. Only times less than or equal to 2 seconds are recorded in this histogram.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveCategory
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts of successes and failures of OS resolutions in various categories.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveFail
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in OS resolutions for actual navigations. Note that cached OS resolutions may provide low (0ms?) resolution times.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveFail_FAMILY_IPV4
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveFail, but limited to pure IPv4 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveFail_FAMILY_IPV6
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveFail, but limited to pure IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveFail_FAMILY_UNSPEC
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveFail, but limited to IPv4/IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveSpeculativeFail
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in speculative OS resolutions. Note that cached OS resolutions may provide low (0ms?) resolution times.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveSpeculativeSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in speculative OS resolution that succeeded. Note that cached resolutions may provide low (0ms?) resolution times.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_IPV4
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to pure IPv4 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_IPV6
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to pure IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_UNSPEC
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Same as DNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to IPv4/IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: DNS.ResolveUnspecWaste
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts of hits and misses in the DNS cache and DNS jobs pool of wasted HostResolverImpl::Jobs that could be avoided by always resolving using AF_UNSPEC.

histogram.name: DNS.TotalTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time since a HostResolverImpl::Resolve request to the time a result is posted. Excludes canceled, evicted, and aborted requests. Includes cache hits (recorded as 0). Excludes speculative requests.

histogram.name: DNS.TotalTime_speculative
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time since a HostResolverImpl::Resolve request to the time a result is posted. Excludes canceled, evicted, and aborted requests. Includes cache hits (recorded as 0). Speculative requests only.

histogram.name: DNS.UnexpectedResolution
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: In some cases, such as when content arrives with embedded references to other servers, the prefetch system can't (or doesn't) attempt to pre-resolve the hostnames. As an example, a visit to www.cnn.com will fetch content with references to about 12 additional hostnames, none of which are currently anticipated. Such resolutions are termed "Unexpected Resolutions," and the durations associated with those DNS resolutions are shown below. Future features may attempt to learn (from prior experience locally, or from server provided hints), what secondary hostname resolutions should be done when a primary resolution (or navigation) takes place. This histogram shows what the potential savings are that "remain on the table" until we employ some of these more advanced features.

histogram.name: DNS.UnexpectedResolutionL
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: In some cases, such as when content arrives with embedded references to other servers, or when a page (such as one in SSL) preclude scanning and prefetching, the prefetch system can't (or doesn't) attempt to pre-resolve the hostnames. As an example, a visit to www.cnn.com will fetch content with references to about 12 additional hostnames, none of which might be anticipated. Similarly, clicking on a link in an SSL page won't be anticipated (since scanning in not allowed by default). Such resolutions are termed "Unexpected Resolutions," and the durations associated with those navigation induced DNS resolutions are shown below. If a referring URL is available for the navigation, the relationship to the referring URL was recorded, and future navigations to the referring hostname would have induced a pre-resolution of hostname that caused an entry below. Such any entry may facilitate future listing in the ReferredPositiveHit histogram.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.ErrorPageUpdateStatus
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Status of DNS probe updates sent to a DNS error page.

histogram.name: DnsProbe.Probe.NcnOnline.Result

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.DBLoadedCount
histogram.summary: Number of certs loaded from domain bound cert database.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.DBLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time spent loading domain bound cert database.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.DBSizeInKB
histogram.summary: The size, on disk, of the domain bound cert database as it is being loaded.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GenerateCertTime
histogram.summary: Time spent generating a domain bound cert.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GetCertTime
histogram.summary: Combined time for GetDomainBoundCert retrieval (both synchronous and asynchronous).

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GetCertTimeAsync
histogram.summary: Time for asynchronous retrieval (from the GetDomainBoundCert call until completion callback is called).

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GetCertTimeSync
histogram.summary: Time for synchronous GetDomainBoundCert cert retrieval.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.GetDomainBoundCertResult
histogram.summary: Result of GetDomainBoundCert function.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.KillDatabaseResult
histogram.summary: Whether the domain-bound certs sqlite database was killed succesfully when an unrecoverable error was detected.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.Support
histogram.summary: Counts of SSL client sockets broken down by support for Domain Bound Certificates TLS extension. Counts only connections with full handshakes, resumed sessions are not counted.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.TaskMaxWaitTime
histogram.summary: Longest time spent by requests waiting for load of domain bound cert database.

histogram.name: DomainBoundCerts.TaskWaitCount
histogram.summary: Number of requests that waited for load of domain bound cert database.

histogram.name: DomainReliability.AddBeaconDidEvict
histogram.summary: Whether adding a beacon to a Domain Reliability context caused it to evict an older beacon to stay within memory limits.

histogram.name: DomainReliability.BeaconReported
histogram.summary: Whether a beacon added to a Domain Reliability context was saved to be uploaded to the collector.

histogram.name: DomainReliability.ReportedBeaconError
histogram.summary: The Chrome error code included in a beacon saved to be uploaded to the collector.

histogram.name: DomainReliability.UploadDuration
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between starting and finishing a Domain Reliability upload.

histogram.name: DomainReliability.UploadFailover
histogram.summary: Whether a Domain Reliability upload was sent to a collector other than the first one listed in the config. (This only happens when an upload to the first collector fails.)

histogram.name: DomainReliability.UploadInterval
DomainReliability.UploadResponseCode
histogram.summary: The response code returned by the Domain Reliability collector when a report is uploaded.

histogram.name: DomainReliability.UploadSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether a Domain Reliability upload succeeded.

histogram.name: DomDistiller.DistillationQuality
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether the perceived quality of the distillation of a web page was good.

histogram.name: Download.AcceptRangesBytes.KBytes
histogram.summary: The length of downloads for serves that accept byte ranges.

histogram.name: Download.AcceptRangesMissingOrInvalid.KBytes
histogram.summary: The length of downloads for serves that do not specify whether the accept ranges, or have invalid ranges specified.

histogram.name: Download.AcceptRangesNone.KBytes
histogram.summary: The length of downloads for serves that do not accept ranges.

histogram.name: Download.ActualBandwidth
histogram.summary: The actual bandwidth (per read) of a download.

histogram.name: Download.ApiFunctions
histogram.summary: Downloads extension API function calls.

histogram.name: Download.BandwidthDiskBytesPerSecond
histogram.summary: Disk bandwidth (defined as total bytes divided by the amount of time blocked on write or close on the file descriptor) seen for a single download.

histogram.name: Download.BandwidthOverallBytesPerSecond
histogram.summary: Overall bandwidth seen for the download. Note that this is measured at the point at which the file is written, and so will not take into account the time costs of activities that occur after file write is completed (e.g. safe browsing scanning).

histogram.name: Download.BandwidthUsed
histogram.summary: The percentage of the potential bandwidth actually used (per read) of a download. An entry of 100% implies that Chrome was the limiting factor in download speed.

histogram.name: Download.ClearAllSize
histogram.summary: The number of downloads in history at the time it is cleared.

histogram.name: Download.ContentDisposition
histogram.summary: Content-Disposition header features. The presence of a Content-Disposition header, use of 'name', 'filename' and 'filename*' parameters, and string encoding schemes are counted for each unthrottled download. The total number downloads is Download.Counts[5] (Initiated and Unthrottled).

histogram.name: Download.ContentImageType
histogram.summary: Types of images that are downloaded.

histogram.name: Download.ContentType
histogram.summary: Content types that are downloaded.

histogram.name: Download.Counts
histogram.summary: Various individual counts in the download system; see DownloadCountType for details.

histogram.name: Download.CountsChrome
histogram.summary: Various individual counts in the download system, for example the number of downloads blocked by throttling from the DownloadRequestLimiter.

histogram.name: Download.DangerousDownloadValidated
histogram.summary: User chose to save a download which was marked dangerous. Grouped by the type of danger.

histogram.name: Download.DangerousFile.DangerousDownloadValidated
histogram.summary: User chose to save a download which was marked DANGEROUS_FILE. Grouped by the type of file.

histogram.name: Download.DangerousFile.Discard
histogram.summary: A download which was marked DANGEROUS_FILE was discarded without the user directly choosing, because the browser was closed. Grouped by the file extension.

histogram.name: Download.DangerousFile.UserDiscard
histogram.summary: User chose to discard a download which was marked DANGEROUS_FILE. Grouped by the file extension.

histogram.name: Download.DatabaseRecordDropped
histogram.summary: Reason for dropping a record read in from the DB.

histogram.name: Download.DatabaseRemoveDownloadsCount
histogram.summary: Number of downloads removed from the history at once.

histogram.name: Download.DatabaseRemoveDownloadsTime
histogram.summary: How long it took to delete some downloads from history.

histogram.name: Download.DatabaseRemoveDownloadsTimePerRecord
histogram.summary: How long it took to delete some downloads from history, per download.

histogram.name: Download.Discard
histogram.summary: A download which was marked dangerous was discarded without the user directly choosing, because the browser was closed. Grouped by the type of danger.

histogram.name: Download.DiskBandwidthUsedPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of the available disk bandwidth that was used by the download. 100% indicates that the disk bandwidth was the limiting factor for the download.

histogram.name: Download.DOMEvent
histogram.summary: User actions in chrome://downloads

histogram.name: Download.DownloadSize
histogram.summary: The size of successfully completed downloads.

histogram.name: Download.DownloadWarningShownOnShelf
histogram.summary: A download warning was shown in the shelf. Note that some downloads may not be shown on the shelf, e.g., if chrome://downloads is already open when the download completes, or if an extension is using the downloads API. Grouped by the type of danger.

histogram.name: Download.FeedbackDialogEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether the user enables dangerous download feedback reporting after viewing the opt-in dialog.

histogram.name: Download.FilePickerResult
histogram.summary: How the user interacts with the file chooser when doing a "Save As" for non-full-page saves.

histogram.name: Download.FileThreadBlockedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time in milliseconds the file thread blocks for each set of buffers drained from the incoming pipe (ms).

histogram.name: Download.FileThreadReceiveBuffers
histogram.summary: The number of buffers in a call to DownloadManager::UpdateDownload.

histogram.name: Download.FirstOpenTime
histogram.summary: The time between a download completing and the file being opened for the first time.

histogram.name: Download.HistorySize
histogram.summary: The number of items in the History database, at the time a new download is recorded.

histogram.name: Download.HistorySize2
histogram.summary: The number of items in the History database, at the time a new download is recorded. Higher maximum, more buckets than Download.HistorySize.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedAtEndError
histogram.summary: Positive net error code that caused a download to be interrupted at the *end* of a download (when the number of bytes is known). This is only triggered when the total content size is known before any bytes are transferred, such as when a Content-Length header is supplied.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedAtEndReason
histogram.summary: The reason that a download was interrupted at the *end* of a download (when the number of bytes is known). This is only triggered when the total content size is known before any bytes are transferred, such as when a Content-Length header is supplied.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedError
histogram.summary: Positive net error code that caused a download to be interrupted.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedOverrunBytes
histogram.summary: The excessive number of bytes which have been received at the time that a download is interrupted. This is only triggered when the total content size is known before any bytes are transferred, such as when a Content-Length header is supplied.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedReason
histogram.summary: The reason that a download was interrupted.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedReceivedSizeK
histogram.summary: The number of kilobytes received for a download at the time it is interrupted.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedTotalSizeK
histogram.summary: The reported total size in kilobytes for a download at the time it is interrupted. This is essentially the size reported by the Content-Length header. If no size is specified up-front, it is not recorded in the histogram. For example, a download transferred with chunked encoding will not be recorded.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedUnderrunBytes
histogram.summary: The total number of bytes minus the received number of bytes at the time that a download is interrupted. This is only triggered when the total content size is known before any bytes are transferred, such as when a Content-Length header is supplied.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedUnknownSize
histogram.summary: True if the size of an interrupted download is unknown, false if it is known.

histogram.name: Download.MaliciousDownloadClassified
histogram.summary: A download has been marked as malicious. Grouped by the type of danger. Each download can only be recorded once; it will be labeled with the first type of danger spotted.

histogram.name: Download.MapErrorNetworkFailed
histogram.summary: Network error that produced a DOWNLOAD_INTERRUPT_REASON_NETWORK_FAILED result in DownloadResourceHandler::OnResponseCompleted().

histogram.name: Download.MapWinShErrorAccessDenied
histogram.summary: Windows error that produced a DOWNLOAD_INTERRUPT_REASON_ACCESS_DENIED result in MapShFileOperationCodes().

histogram.name: Download.MapWinShErrorFileFailed
histogram.summary: Windows error that produced a DOWNLOAD_INTERRUPT_REASON_FILE_FAILED result in MapShFileOperationCodes().

histogram.name: Download.OnChanged
histogram.summary: Percentage of DownloadItem::Observer::OnDownloadUpdated events that signified a change in the extension API representation of the download.

histogram.name: Download.OpenMethod
histogram.summary: Invocation count for methods of opening a download. For some file types, Chrome defaults to opening the file in the browser instead of invoking the system handler. The user has the option of overriding this behavior.

histogram.name: Download.OpensOutstanding
histogram.summary: The number of unopened downloads, when one is opened.

histogram.name: Download.OpenTime
histogram.summary: The time between a download completing and the file being opened.

histogram.name: Download.OriginStateOnFullResumption
histogram.summary: Changes observed when a response is received for a full download resumption request.

histogram.name: Download.OriginStateOnPartialResumption
histogram.summary: Changes observed when a response is received for a partial (byte-range) download resumption request.

histogram.name: Download.PotentialBandwidth
histogram.summary: The maximum bandwidth (per read) that Chrome could have provided for the download. If the actual bandwidth equals the potential bandwidth, that means that Chrome was the limiting factor for download bandwidth.

histogram.name: Download.ResourceHandlerBlockedPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of the lifetime of the DownloadResourceHandler for which it was blocked by downstream flow control. 0% indicates that the network bandwidth was the limiting factor for the download.

histogram.name: Download.SavePackage
histogram.summary: Events (e.g. Started, Cancelled, Finished, Write to Completed file, Write to Failed file) occuring within the state machine of a SavePackage operation.

histogram.name: Download.ShelfInProgressSizeOnAutoClose
histogram.summary: The number of download items in progress on the shelf when it closes automatically.

histogram.name: Download.ShelfInProgressSizeOnUserClose
histogram.summary: The number of download items in progress on the shelf when the user closes it.

histogram.name: Download.ShelfSizeOnAutoClose
histogram.summary: The number of download items on the shelf when it closes automatically.

histogram.name: Download.ShelfSizeOnUserClose
histogram.summary: The number of download items on the shelf when the user closes it.

histogram.name: Download.ShowDangerousDownloadConfirmationPrompt
histogram.summary: User saw the confirm prompt to save a download which was marked dangerous. Grouped by the type of danger.

histogram.name: Download.Sources
histogram.summary: The initiation source (if initiated within the content layer of chrome) for a download.

histogram.name: Download.SourcesChrome
histogram.summary: The initiation source (if initiated within the above-content layer of chrome) for a download.

histogram.name: Download.Time
histogram.summary: Time between the start of a download and its completion.

histogram.name: Download.UserDiscard
histogram.summary: User chose to discard a download which was marked dangerous. Grouped by the type of danger.

histogram.name: Download.WriteLoopCount
histogram.summary: The number of iterations for the write loop in BaseFile::AppendDataTofile().

histogram.name: Download.WriteSize

histogram.name: Drive.CacheDBOpenStatus

histogram.name: Drive.FileFormat

histogram.name: Drive.MetadataDBInitResult

histogram.name: Drive.MetadataDBOpenExistingResult

histogram.name: Drive.MetadataDBValidityCheckFailureReason
histogram.summary: Reason of drive resource metadata database validity check failure. Recorded when the validity check fails during Drive metadata initialization triggered by profile initialization.

histogram.name: Drive.MetadataDBVersionBeforeUpgradeCheck

histogram.name: Drive.NumberOfCacheFilesRecoveredAfterDBCorruption

histogram.name: Drive.NumberOfRegularFiles
histogram.summary: Number of regualr files on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: Drive.NumberOfTotalFiles

histogram.name: Drive.PushNotificationInitiallyEnabled
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the push notification is initially enabled for Drive. Recorded when the first notification is processed. Notification is emulated by polling if the push notication is disabled.

histogram.name: Drive.PushNotificationRegistered
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the push notification request is registered correctly for Drive. Recorded when the push notification manager is initialized.

histogram.name: Drive.SearchMetadataTime
histogram.summary: Time spent to perform an incremental search for auto completion of files on Drive. This time is collected for every partial query the user types for auto completion. For instance, if the user types "faq", incremental searches are performed for "f", "fa", and "faq" respectively.

histogram.name: DriveOffline.CrosAutoEnableOutcome
histogram.summary: Outcome of enabling Google Drive offline mode automatically when a user first logs into a Chrome OS device. This process involves opening a hidden web page in the context of the Google Drive hosted app to perform the initialization of offline mode.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.ClickedButton
histogram.summary: Button clicked in EasyUnlock app during setup process.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.NotificationEvent
histogram.summary: Tracks events related to notifications used by EasyUnlock feature. For example a specific EasyUnlock notification being shown or clicked.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.SetupStateOnClose
histogram.summary: The state of EasyUnlock setup when the app window was closed by user.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.StartupTimeFromSuspend
histogram.summary: The time it takes after resuming from a suspended state (ie. opening the Chromebook lid) to when a remote device is connected and a request is made. Note that it is possible for the remote device not to be present when resuming from suspend, and the device may be connected at a later time. Therefore, large values for this metric may not be too meaningful due to meddling users.

histogram.name: EasyUnlock.UnlockEvent
histogram.summary: Screen unlock events detected while EasyUnlock was enabled.

histogram.name: EnhancedBookmarks.SyncExperimentState
histogram.summary: Captures the state the enhanced bookmark experiment is in. Recorded on startup. To be removed once the enhanced bookmark experiment is finished. see crbug/323423.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentExtraTime
histogram.summary: Time since the user logged in until the auto-enrollment protocol completed. 0 is sampled when the protocol is done by the time the user logs in.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentProtocolTime
histogram.summary: Total duration time of the auto-enrollment protocol.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentRequestNetworkErrorCode
histogram.summary: Network error code (if applicable) for auto-enrollment requests.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentRequestStatus
histogram.summary: URL fetcher status for auto-enrollment requests.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DMToken
histogram.summary: Events related to fetching, saving and loading DM server tokens. These are used to retrieve cloud policies.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DomainWhitelistRegexFailure
histogram.summary: Temporary metric tracking which regex caused an icu::RegexMatcher initialization failure, to help figure out the cause of http://crbug.com/365351 which we can't repro locally.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DomainWhitelistRegexFailureStatus
histogram.summary: Temporary metric tracking the type of an icu::RegexMatcher initialization failure, to help figure out the cause of http://crbug.com/365351 which we can't repro locally.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DomainWhitelistRegexSuccess
histogram.summary: Temporary metric tracking the success of icu::RegexMatcher IcuMatcher initialization, to help figure out the cause of http://crbug.com/365351.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrolledPolicyHasDMToken
histogram.summary: Whether loading of device policy from file on an enterprise-enrolled (checked against install_attributes.pb) Chrome OS device yields an enterprise policy with a DM token. Filled once during session startup, after first successful device policy read.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Enrollment
histogram.summary: Events related to device enrollment on new installs of Chrome OS devices.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentRecovery
histogram.summary: Events related to Chrome OS enterprise enrollment recovery.

histogram.name: Enterprise.IOSPolicies
histogram.summary: Number of policies loaded at startup on iOS, and when a change is detected at runtime.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ONC.PolicyValidation
histogram.summary: Result of the OpenNetworkConfiguration policy validation.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Policies
histogram.summary: A set of enterprise policy rules that are in use. This is recorded every 24 hours and at startup, if the last recording was earlier than a day before.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Policy
histogram.summary: Events related to fetching, saving and loading user policies, and also device policies on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyHasVerifiedCachedKey
histogram.summary: Boolean tracking whether there is a valid policy signing key on disk.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyInvalidations
histogram.summary: Events for counting policy invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that a policy has been updated and should be refreshed. Payloads provide context about the policy update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyInvalidationsStartupTime
histogram.summary: Time since startup of the cloud policy code until the policy invalidation service first reported its online status.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyLoadStatus
histogram.summary: Load status from the policy loaders which pull policy settings from the underlying platform, such as Windows Group Policy.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyRefresh
histogram.summary: Events measuring effectiveness of refreshing policy when invalidations are received from a service. For each refresh, indicates whether the policy changed, and whether the policy was invalidated at the time of the refresh.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserCloudPolicyStore.LoadStatus
histogram.summary: Result of the attempted policy load during profile initialization.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserCloudPolicyStore.LoadValidationStatus
histogram.summary: Result of validating the policy that has just been loaded from disk.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserCloudPolicyStore.StoreValidationStatus
histogram.summary: Result of validating the policy sent down from the server, before writing to disk.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.DelayInitialization
histogram.summary: Initialization delay due to loading the user policy cache.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.ClientError
histogram.summary: Policy client error during initial policy fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.DelayClientRegister
histogram.summary: Delay for registering the client with the policy server.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.DelayOAuth2Token
histogram.summary: Delay for minting an OAuth2 acccess token.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.DelayPolicyFetch
histogram.summary: Delay for fetching policy from the policy server.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.DelayTotal
histogram.summary: Total delay for the initial policy fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.OAuth2Error
histogram.summary: Service error during OAuth2 access token fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.OAuth2NetworkError
histogram.summary: Network error during OAuth2 access token fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyValidationFailure
histogram.summary: Source of policy validation errors on ChromeOS.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyValidationLoadStatus
histogram.summary: Validation result when loading user policy from the policy store.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyValidationStoreStatus
histogram.summary: Validation result when writing user policy to the policy store.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserSigninChoice
histogram.summary: Choice the user made when presented with enterprise signin dialog.

histogram.name: Enterprise.WildcardLoginCheck.DelayPolicyTokenFetch
histogram.summary: Delay incurred by the token fetching step of the wildcard login check.

histogram.name: Enterprise.WildcardLoginCheck.DelayTotal
histogram.summary: Total delay incurred by the wildcard login check.

histogram.name: Enterprise.WildcardLoginCheck.DelayUserInfoFetch
histogram.summary: Delay incurred by the user info fetching step of the wildcard login check.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.DomainBindSucceeded
histogram.summary: Whether we were able to contact the AD Domain Controller. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.DomainCheckFailed
histogram.summary: Enum of possible things that can fail while checking for enterprise env. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.InDomain
histogram.summary: Whether the machine is part of an AD domain. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.InvalidPolicies
histogram.summary: A set of policy rules that were ignored due to integrity violations while parsing the policy data which happens on start-up and when the policy has changed.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.InvalidPoliciesDetected
histogram.summary: The number of disabled policy entries on Windows due to integrity violations while parsing the policy data which happens on start-up and when the policy has changed.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.OSType
histogram.summary: The rough Windows suite we are runnnig on. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: Event.ActionAfterDoubleTapNoDelay
histogram.summary: On non-mobile sites, gesture taps are delayed to prevent double taps from sending a click event. This stat tracks the user's first action within 5 seconds after a double tap gesture when the gesture tap delay is disabled.

histogram.name: Event.ActionAfterDoubleTapWithDelay
histogram.summary: On non-mobile sites, gesture taps are delayed to prevent double taps from sending a click event. This stat tracks the user's first action within 5 seconds after a double tap gesture when gesture tap events are delayed.

histogram.name: Event.AggregatedLatency.Renderer2
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of any input event and the renderer receiving and starting to process it.

histogram.name: Event.CoalescedCount.Mouse
histogram.summary: Number of Mouse events coalesced.

histogram.name: Event.CoalescedCount.Touch
histogram.summary: Number of Touch events coalesced.

histogram.name: Event.CoalescedLatency.Mouse
histogram.summary: Time between the first and last events in a coalesced mouse events group.

histogram.name: Event.CoalescedLatency.Touch
histogram.summary: Time between the first and last events in a coalesced touch events group.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of all input events and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_DROP_TARGET_EVENT
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_GESTURE_BEGIN
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_GESTURE_DOUBLE_TAP
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_GESTURE_END
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_GESTURE_LONG_PRESS
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_GESTURE_LONG_TAP
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_GESTURE_MULTIFINGER_SWIPE
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_GESTURE_PINCH_BEGIN
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_GESTURE_PINCH_END
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_GESTURE_PINCH_UPDATE
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_GESTURE_SCROLL_BEGIN
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_GESTURE_SCROLL_END
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_GESTURE_SCROLL_UPDATE
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_GESTURE_TAP
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_GESTURE_TAP_CANCEL
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_GESTURE_TAP_DOWN
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_GESTURE_TWO_FINGER_TAP
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_KEY_PRESSED
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_KEY_RELEASED
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_MOUSE_CAPTURE_CHANGED
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_MOUSE_DRAGGED
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_MOUSE_ENTERED
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_MOUSE_EXITED
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_MOUSE_MOVED
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_MOUSE_RELEASED
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_MOUSEWHEEL
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_SCROLL
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_SCROLL_FLING_CANCEL
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_SCROLL_FLING_START
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_TOUCH_CANCELLED
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_TOUCH_MOVED
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_TOUCH_PRESSED
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_TOUCH_RELEASED
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_TOUCH_STATIONARY
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_TRANSLATED_KEY_PRESS
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_TRANSLATED_KEY_RELEASE
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.ET_UNKNOWN
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of input event and browser processing.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.TouchAcked
histogram.summary: Time between touch events sent from RWH to renderer and acked by renderer.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Browser.TouchUI
histogram.summary: Time between touch events received by Chrome and sent from RWH to renderer.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Renderer
histogram.summary: Time between initiation of all input events and renderer processing. This is soon to be replaced by Event.Latency.Renderer2.*

histogram.name: Event.Latency.Renderer2
histogram.summary: Time between input event creation and the renderer receiving and starting to process the event. For touch events on Windows, we measure from when the event reaches Chrome, whereas on other platforms we use the timestamp from the kernel. On Windows, this metric is only reported when |IsHighResNowFastAndReliable| is true, which will introduce some sampling bias.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.RendererImpl.GestureScroll
histogram.summary: Time between initial creation of touch event and when the resulting ScrollGesture reaches Impl thread. Maximum is 200ms.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.RendererImpl.GestureScroll2
histogram.summary: Time between touch event creation and when the resulting GestureScroll reaches the Impl thread. Maximum is 1000ms. On Windows, we measure from when the touch event reaches Chrome, whereas on other platforms we use the timestamp from the kernel. On Windows, this metric is only reported when |IsHighResNowFastAndReliable| is true, which will introduce some sampling bias. This supersedes the Event.Latency.RendererImpl.GestureScroll metric.

histogram.name: Event.Latency.TouchToScrollUpdateSwap
histogram.summary: Time between initial creation of touch event and the resulting frame from ScrollUpdate is swapped.

histogram.name: Event.SingleTapType
histogram.summary: On non-mobile sites, gesture taps are delayed to prevent double taps from sending a click event. This stat counts the number of taps that are delayed by the double-tap delay versus those that are sent immediately on mobile sites.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.AdInjected
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that inject at least one new ad.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.AdLikelyInjected
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that performed an action that heuristically looks like injecting an ad, but could not be confirmed.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.AdLikelyReplaced
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that performed an action that heuristically looks like replacing an ad, but could not be confirmed.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.AdRemoved
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that remove at least one ad.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.AdReplaced
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that replace at least one ad.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.ContentScript
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that inject a content script.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedDiv
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create divs to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedEmbed
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create 'embed' elements to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedIframe
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create iframes to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedInput
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create inputs to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedLink
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create links to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedObject
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create 'object' elements to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedScript
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create script tags to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.DocumentWrite
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that use document.write.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.ContentScript
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that inject a content script.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedDiv
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create divs to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedEmbed
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create 'embed' elements to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedIframe
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create iframes to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedInput
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create inputs to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedLink
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create links to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedObject
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create 'object' elements to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedScript
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create script tags to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.DocumentWrite
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that use document.write.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.InnerHtml
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that set innerHTML.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.InvokedDomMethod
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that invoke DOM methods.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.ModifiedDom
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that set the value of DOM properties via assignments.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.ReadDom
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that read from the DOM.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.InnerHtml
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that set innerHTML.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.InvokedDomMethod
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that invoke DOM methods.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.ModifiedDom
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that set the value of DOM properties via assignments.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.ReadDom
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that read from the DOM.

histogram.name: ExtensionBlacklist.BlacklistInstalled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that were blacklisted when already installed, grouped by Extension::Location. Logged when ExtensionService blackists and unloads an installed extension.

histogram.name: ExtensionBlacklist.BlockCRX
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that have been blocked from installing grouped by Extension::Location. Logged when ExtensionService refuses to install a blacklisted extension.

histogram.name: ExtensionBlacklist.SilentInstall
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that have been silently installed in a blacklisted state, grouped by Extension::Location. Logged when ExtensionService installs a blacklisted extension without blocking it (ExtensionBlacklist.BlockCRX would be logged otherwise). Typically this will be when a user has a blacklisted extension synced.

histogram.name: ExtensionBlacklist.UnblacklistInstalled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that were unblacklisted when installed, grouped by Extension::Location. Logged when ExtensionService unblacklists and loads a blacklisted extension.

histogram.name: ExtensionBubble.DevModeUserSelection
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user when seeing the bubble, logged right after the action is taken.

histogram.name: ExtensionBubble.ExtensionsInDevModeCount
histogram.summary: The total number of extensions found to be loaded under Developer Mode, logged when the devmode bubble is shown (once per startup per profile, if any devmode extension is found).

histogram.name: ExtensionBubble.ExtensionWipeoutCount
histogram.summary: The total number of extensions found to be wiped by SideloadWipeout, logged when the wipeout bubble is shown, which is once per startup per profile (as long as wiped extensions were found). Not logged if no extensions of that nature were found.

histogram.name: ExtensionBubble.WipeoutUserSelection
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user when seeing the bubble, logged right after the action is taken.

histogram.name: ExtensionContentHashFetcher.CreateHashesTime
histogram.summary: The time taken to create the computed_hashes.json file for an extension. This happens once for each extension after we get signed values of the expected root node of a tree hashes for each file from the webstore; we then compute the individual block level hashes of the actual files and cache them in computed_hashes.json (assuming we don't detect any mismatches).

histogram.name: ExtensionContentHashReader.InitLatency
histogram.summary: The time taken to initialize the ContentHashReader for an extension resource load. (The work done is to read in the verified contents and computed hashes data, and compare them to make sure they agree.)

histogram.name: ExtensionContentVerifyJob.TimeSpentUS
histogram.summary: The time taken in computation (hashing actual bytes read and comparing against expected computed hashes values) during an extension resource load.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstalledLoader.ForceDisabled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts whether we force-disabled an installed extension at startup because a policy provider indicated it must remain disabled.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.RequestCount
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: A count of the number of server requests since Chrome started running, recorded each time we do a request. NOTE: when interpreting these values, keep in mind that a user who did 5 server requests during one run of Chrome will log this histogram 5 times with values 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.ResultWasValid
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether the server result received by the extensions install signer was valid or invalid.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.SecondsSinceLastRequest
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This records the number of seconds since the last time we've done a request to the server (only during this run of the browser).

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.UptimeAtTimeOfRequest
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records how many seconds the browser has been running at the time a request to the server is made to get a new install signature.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallVerifier.ActualStatus
histogram.summary: Logged during InstallVerifier::Init, to indicate the actual enforcement status used (usually determined by the ExtensionInstallVerifier field trial experiment, but possibly modified by command line flags).

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallVerifier.ExperimentStatus
histogram.summary: Logged during InstallVerifier::Init to indicate the enforcement status as determined by the ExtensionInstallVerifier field trial experiment.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallVerifier.GetSignatureResult
histogram.summary: The result of the verifier trying to get a new signature.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallVerifier.InitResult
histogram.summary: The result of initialization for the extension install verifier.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallVerifier.MustRemainDisabled
histogram.summary: The outcome for each call to InstallVerifier::MustRemainDisabled.

histogram.name: ExtensionOverrideBubble.NtpOverriddenUserSelection
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user when seeing the bubble, notifing them of an extension overriding their new tab page. Logged right after the action is taken.

histogram.name: ExtensionOverrideBubble.SettingsApiUserSelectionHomePage
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user when seeing the bubble, notifing them of an extension overriding their homepage. Logged right after the action is taken.

histogram.name: ExtensionOverrideBubble.SettingsApiUserSelectionSearchEngine
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user when seeing the bubble, notifing them of an extension overriding their search engine. Logged right after the action is taken.

histogram.name: ExtensionOverrideBubble.SettingsApiUserSelectionStartupPage
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user when seeing the bubble, notifing them of an extension overriding their startup page. Logged right after the action is taken.

histogram.name: Extensions.ActiveScriptController.DeniedExtensions
histogram.summary: The number of extensions on a page that wanted to execute a script, required explicit user consent, and were denied permission.

histogram.name: Extensions.ActiveScriptController.PermittedExtensions
histogram.summary: The number of extensions on a page that wanted to execute a script, required explicit user consent, and were granted permission.

histogram.name: Extensions.ActiveScriptController.PreventableAdInjectors
histogram.summary: The number of extensions per page that injected an ad and could have been stopped if the user had declined script injection. This is related to the ActivityLog metrics, ExtensionActivity.Ad*. Recorded upon page close or navigation. Only recorded if there was at least one ad injection detected.

histogram.name: Extensions.ActiveScriptController.ShownActiveScriptsOnPage
histogram.summary: The number of extensions which would display an Active Script Running indiciation to the user. Recorded at page close.

histogram.name: Extensions.ActiveScriptController.UnpreventableAdInjectors
histogram.summary: The number of extensions per page that injected an ad and that could not have been stopped through script injection permission. This is related to the ActivityLog metrics, ExtensionActivity.Ad*. Recorded upon page close or navigation. Only recorded if there was at least one ad injection detected.

histogram.name: Extensions.AdInjection.AdType
histogram.summary: The type of ad that was injected.

histogram.name: Extensions.AdInjection.InstallLocation
histogram.summary: The install location of an ad-injecting extension. Recorded upon page close for any extension that injected ads on that page.

histogram.name: Extensions.AllocatePortIdPairOverflow
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records when the allocation of IDs for chrome.runtime.Port overflows.

histogram.name: Extensions.APIUse_RelativeURL
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Captures the results of URL resolution when relative urls are used in the tabs/windows api.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppLaunch
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times v1 apps are launched grouped by extension_misc::AppLaunchBuckets. See also Apps.AppLaunch for v2 apps.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppLaunchContainer
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times apps are launched grouped by extensions::LaunchContainer.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppLocation
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of apps loaded at startup time grouped by Extension::Location.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppsPromo
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The actions taken in the NTP apps promo grouped by extension_misc::AppsPromoBuckets.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppTabLaunchType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of apps launched grouped by extensions::LaunchType.

histogram.name: Extensions.BackgroundPageLoadTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time for an extension's background page to load.

histogram.name: Extensions.BackgroundPageType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The type (if any) of background page the extension has. Recorded for installed extensions on startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptExtensionBecameDisabled
histogram.summary: Fired each time an extension was detected to be corrupted (contents not matching an expected content hash from the webstore) and was disabled.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptExtensionTotalDisables
histogram.summary: Logged once at startup, this is the value of a counter that is incremented anytime we disable a corrupted extension because its content didn't match an expected content hash.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptExtensionWouldBeDisabled
histogram.summary: Simiar to Extensions.CorruptExtensionBecameDisabled, but fires when we're in a bootstrapping mode and would have disabled an extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchError
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Net error results from URLFetcher.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchFailureRetryCountGoogleUrl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension with a url on a google.com domain, before eventually giving up.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchFailureRetryCountOtherUrl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxInstallDirPathLength
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Length of the path to the directory under which an extension is installed. This directory is in the user's profile.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeRulesStorageInitialization
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Extensions.DepricatedExternalJsonCount

histogram.name: Extensions.DialogLoadTime

histogram.name: Extensions.Disabled

histogram.name: Extensions.DisabledForPermissions

histogram.name: Extensions.DisabledUIUserResponse
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: User response to the dialog shown when an extension is disabled due to an update requiring more permissions.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisabledUIUserResponseRemoteInstall
histogram.summary: User response to the dialog shown when an extension is disabled due to it having been installed remotely.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisableReason
histogram.summary: The count of disabled extensions at startup grouped by disble reason from Extension::DisableReason. When an extension is disabled, it can be for one or more reasons (although typically just one), so the sum of these may be greater than 'Extensions.Disabled' which is a count of the number of unique extensions that are disabled.

histogram.name: Extensions.ErrorCodeFromCrxOpen
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: If opening the CRX file for unpacking fails, this integer is the error code given by the OS.

histogram.name: Extensions.EventPageActiveTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Extensions.EventPageIdleTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Extensions.EventPageLoadTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionCacheCount
histogram.summary: Number of cached extensions on disk. Reported on Chrome OS during user session start.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionCacheSize
histogram.summary: Total size of .crx files in cache on disk. Reported on Chrome OS during user session start.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionInstalled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionRootPathLength

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionServiceInitTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionUninstalled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExternalExtensionEvent
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExternalItemState
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExternalJsonCount
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of extensions referenced in the external extensions source at path chrome::DIR_EXTERNAL_EXTENSIONS.

histogram.name: Extensions.FileAccessAllowed
histogram.summary: The number of extensions (and friends) that could have been given access to the file:// scheme, and were, for users that have at least one extension that could have been given access. This excludes anything that doesn't show up in chrome://extensions (platform apps, hosted apps, component extensions), policy-installed extensions, and unpacked extensions. See also Extensions.FileAccessNotAllowed.

histogram.name: Extensions.FileAccessNotAllowed
histogram.summary: The number of extensions (and friends) that could have been given access to the file:// scheme, but weren't, for users that have at least one extension that could have been given access. This excludes anything that doesn't show up in chrome://extensions (platform apps, hosted apps, component extensions), policy-installed extensions, and unpacked extensions. See also Extensions.FileAccessAllowed.

histogram.name: Extensions.FromWebstoreInconsistency
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of apps/extensions loaded on startup with an inconsistent "from webstore" state. This means an item that is flagged as from_webstore, but with either a non-webstore update_url or an external install location.

histogram.name: Extensions.FunctionCalls
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of calls to extension functions.

histogram.name: Extensions.GetUserDataTempDir
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: What happens when the extensions system tries to get a temp dir to unpack in?

histogram.name: Extensions.IncognitoAllowed
histogram.summary: The number of extensions (and friends) that could have been allowed in incognito, and were, for users that have at least one extension that could have been allowed. This excludes anything that doesn't show up in chrome://extensions (platform apps, hosted apps, component extensions), policy-installed extensions, and unpacked extensions. See also Extensions.IncognitoNotAllowed.

histogram.name: Extensions.IncognitoNotAllowed
histogram.summary: The number of extensions (and friends) that could have been allowed in incognito, but weren't, for users that have at least one extension that could have been allowed. This excludes anything that doesn't show up in chrome://extensions (platform apps, hosted apps, component extensions), policy-installed extensions, and unpacked extensions. See also Extensions.IncognitoAllowed.

histogram.name: Extensions.ResourceDirectoryTimestampQueryLatency
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The initialization latency (in milliseconds) introduced to each extension resource request by querying the directory timestamp.

histogram.name: Extensions.ResourceLastModifiedDelta
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The difference in seconds between an extension resource's last modification time and its extension base directory's creation time. Recorded on each extension resource request if the difference is non-negative (i.e., the resource's last modification time is more recent than the directory's creation time.) For cases where the directory creation date is more recent, see Extensions.ResourceLastModifiedNegativeDelta instead.

histogram.name: Extensions.ResourceLastModifiedNegativeDelta
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The absolute difference in seconds between an extension resource's last modification time and extension base directory's creation time. Recorded on each extension resource request if the difference is negative (i.e., the directory's creation time is more recent than the resource's last modification time.) For cases where the resource modification time is more recent, see Extensions.ResourceLastModifiedDelta instead.
