histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckPackagedApp
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of packaged apps that were checked during an update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckTheme
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of themes that were checked during an update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateOnLoad
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that were updated at browser startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdaterWriteCrx
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: What happened when the extension updater tried to write a file?

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateSource
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Updates grouped by the location property in prefs.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Updates grouped by Extension::HistogramType.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebstoreDownload.InterruptReason
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The reason a webstore download was interrupted.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebstoreDownload.InterruptReceivedKBytes
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of KBytes received for a webstore download before it was interrupted.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebstoreDownload.InterruptTotalKBytes
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total expected size in KBytes of an interrupted webstore download.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebstoreDownload.InterruptTotalSizeUnknown
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the total size of an interrupted webstore download was known.

histogram.name: ExtensionService.AddVerified
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records whether adding a new/updated extension to the install verifier succeeded.

histogram.name: ExtensionService.VerifyAllSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The outcome of a call to ExtensionService::VerifyAllExtensions, whether it was called for bootstrapping or another reason (extension installed/uninstalled, etc.).

histogram.name: ExtensionSettings.ShouldDoVerificationCheck
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When loading the chrome://extensions page, this records whether we decided to do a verification check against the server (because the user had one or more extensions disabled due to verification failure).

histogram.name: ExtensionToolbarModel.BrowserActionsCount
histogram.summary: The number of icons the Browser Actions Container knows about (visible or in the overflow bucket). Does not count icons that have been permanently hidden by the user. Measured once per startup per (non-incognito) profile.

histogram.name: ExtensionToolbarModel.BrowserActionsPermanentlyHidden
histogram.summary: The number of Browser Action icons the user has elected to permanently hide (as opposed to putting them in the overflow bucket). Measured once per startup per (non-incognito) profile.

histogram.name: ExtensionToolbarModel.BrowserActionsVisible
histogram.summary: The number of visible icons in the Browser Actions Container (visible as in number of icons not in the overflow bucket). 0 means all icons are in the overflow bucket. MAX_INT means the toolbar is always showing all icons. Measured once per startup per (non-incognito) profile but only for those profiles that have one or more browser actions showing in the toolbar.

histogram.name: ExtensionUrlRequest.Latency
histogram.summary: The time taken to complete an extension url request.

histogram.name: ExtensionUrlRequest.OnReadCompleteError
histogram.summary: The error code for failures of incremental reads of a file stream for a chrome-extension:// URL. (See also ExtensionUrlRequest.OnReadCompleteResult for the success case).

histogram.name: ExtensionUrlRequest.OnReadCompleteResult
histogram.summary: The result of an incremental read of a file stream for a chrome-extension:// URL, representing a byte count. Logged in success cases (see also ExtensionUrlRequest.OnReadCompleteError).

histogram.name: ExtensionUrlRequest.SeekPosition
histogram.summary: When fetching a chrome-extension:// URL, this indicates the first byte position we read from. This will be greater than 0 in cases such as XHR's with a Range header, but will normally be 0 in the typical case of reading the entire file. This helps identify how frequently partial file reads are taking place.

histogram.name: ExtensionUrlRequest.TotalKbRead
histogram.summary: The total number of bytes read for a chrome-extension:// URL, logged when the job is finished (either successfully or not).

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Create
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser opening mode.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DirectoryScan
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: time to scan a directory. Measured on every File Browser directory change.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DownloadDestination.IsGoogleDrive.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks whether download destination is set to a Google Drive folder when the download destination is changed by the user in the settings page.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DownloadDestination.IsGoogleDrive.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks whether download destination is set to a Google Drive folder on startup.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DownloadsCount
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: number of files and directories in the Downloads directory (not including the contents of nested directories). Computed every time the File Browser current directory changes to Downloads.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FolderShortcut.Add
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: this is recorded when the user adds a folder shortcut.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FolderShortcut.Count
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: number of saved folder shorcuts. This is recorded when Files.app is launched.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FolderShortcut.Navigate
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: this is recorded when the user clicks or selects a folder shortcut and is navigated to the target folder.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FolderShortcut.Remove
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: this is recorded when the user removes a folder shortcut.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Load
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser is an built-in extension without a background page. Its main.html file is loaded every time the user opens a File Browser tab or a file chooser dialog. The file is fairly large and the initialization is pretty expensive.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OpeningFileType
histogram.summary: File types that were tried to be opened through browser.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.DisplayTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: time to display an image. Measured from the moment the user selected the image till the moment it is displayed (not counting the low resolution preview).

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.FileType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: the type of the file opened.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.LoadMode
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: the way the image has been loaded.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.LoadTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: time to load an image from a file.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.SaveResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: the result of a file save operation.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.SaveTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: time to save an image to a file.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.Size.MB
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: size of an image file in megabytes. Measured on every image load.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.Size.MPix
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: size of an image in megapixels. Measured on every image load.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoEditor.Tool
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Editor: the button which the user clicked.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.Action
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: action chosen in the Action Choice dialog for the external device.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.ImportCount
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: the number of photos imported. Measured on every successfull import operation.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.ImportPercentage
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: the percent of photos imported among all the photos on the device. Measured on every successfull import operation.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.Load
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: time to load the action dialog. Measured between the moment window appears and the moment user see all available actions for the device.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.Scan
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: time to scan the external device.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.SuggestApps.Close
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: the reason why the suggest apps dialog was closed.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.SuggestApps.Install
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: whether the Webstore item user selected was successfully installed or not.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.SuggestApps.Load
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: whether the initialization of the dialog succeeded or not.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.SuggestApps.LoadTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: time to load the suggest apps dialog. Measured between the moment window appears and the moment all the contants in the dialog including the Chrome Webstore widget are ready.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ViewingFileType
histogram.summary: File types that were tried to be viewed through browser. This is recorded when the user tries to view a file from Files.app.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.VolumeType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: counts the number of times volumes are mounted for each volume type.

histogram.name: FileSystem.DirectoryDatabaseInit
histogram.summary: The result of FileSystemDirectoryDatabase initialization.

histogram.name: FileSystem.OpenFileSystem
histogram.summary: The success or the cause of failure for each call to OpenFileSystem().

histogram.name: FileSystem.OriginDatabaseInit
histogram.summary: The result of FileSystemOriginDatabase initialization.

histogram.name: FileSystem.PersistentOriginsCount
histogram.summary: Number of origins that have persistent filesystem. Measured when the Quota system queries the filesystem subsystem about its entire usage, which usually happens when one of the storage subsystem methods is called for the first time.

histogram.name: FileSystem.TemporaryOriginsCount
histogram.summary: Number of origins that have temporary filesystem. Measured when the Quota system queries the filesystem subsystem about its entire usage, which usually happens when one of the storage subsystem methods is called for the first time.

histogram.name: GCM.APICallUnregister
histogram.summary: Number of times when gcm.unregister API is called.

histogram.name: GCM.CheckinCompleteTime
histogram.summary: Length of time taken to complete a GCM checkin request successfully. If the checkin is retried multiple times, the length of time is counted for the last successful retry.

histogram.name: GCM.CheckinRequestStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of the outcome of a GCM checkin request.

histogram.name: GCM.CheckinRetryCount
histogram.summary: Number of retries before a GCM checkin succeeds.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectedViaProxy
histogram.summary: Whether the GCM connection was made via a proxy or not.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectionDisconnectErrorCode
histogram.summary: Net error results from GCM disconnect events.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectionEndpoint
histogram.summary: Number of connections made to each specific MCS endpoint.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectionFailureErrorCode
histogram.summary: Net error results from GCM connection attempts.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectionLatency
histogram.summary: The time between the initiation of a connection and the successful completion of it.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectionResetReason
histogram.summary: Reasons for GCM connection resets.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectionSuccessRate
histogram.summary: GCM connection success rate. Does not take into account login success. See GCM.ConnectionFailureErrorCode for a breakdown of connection failure reasons.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectionUpTime
histogram.summary: Time (from login until reset) that a GCM connection was active.

histogram.name: GCM.DataMessageBurstReceivedInterval
histogram.summary: Interval between two successive received data message bursts.

histogram.name: GCM.FirstReceivedDataMessageLatencyAfterConnection
histogram.summary: The time between the successful completion of the connection and the arrival of the first data message.

histogram.name: GCM.LoadSucceeded
histogram.summary: Success indicates successfully loading an initialized persistent GCM store at startup time. Failure indicates a failure loading the store.

histogram.name: GCM.NumThrottledApps
histogram.summary: Number of applications hitting GCM per-app outstanding message limits at startup time.

histogram.name: GCM.NumUsers
histogram.summary: Number of GCM users associated with this client at startup time.

histogram.name: GCM.OutgoingMessageTTL
histogram.summary: Category of TTL specified in the outgoing message: 0, less than or equal to 1 minute, less than or equal to 1 hour and etc.

histogram.name: GCM.ReceivedDataMessageBurstSize
histogram.summary: Number of messages in a received GCM data message burst.

histogram.name: GCM.ReceivedDataMessageIntervalWithinBurstMs
histogram.summary: Interval between messages within a received GCM data message burst.

histogram.name: GCM.RegistrationCompleteTime
histogram.summary: Length of time taken to complete a GCM registration request successfully. If the registration is retried multiple times, the length of time is counted for the last successful retry.

histogram.name: GCM.RegistrationRequestStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of the outcome of a GCM registration request.

histogram.name: GCM.RegistrationRetryCount
histogram.summary: Number of retries before a GCM registration succeeds.

histogram.name: GCM.RegistrationSenderIdCount
histogram.summary: Number of sender IDs specified in a registration request.

histogram.name: GCM.RestoredIncomingMessages
histogram.summary: Number of unacknowledged incoming messages restored from the persistent store at startup.

histogram.name: GCM.RestoredOutgoingMessages
histogram.summary: Number of pending outgoing messages restored from the persistent store at startup.

histogram.name: GCM.RestoredRegistrations
histogram.summary: Number of registrations restored from the persistent store at startup.

histogram.name: GCM.StoreDestroySucceeded
histogram.summary: Success indicates successfully destroying the GCM persistent store. Failure indicates a failure destroying the persistence store. GCM store will be destroyed when the profile has been signed out.

histogram.name: GCM.StoreSizeKB
histogram.summary: Size of the GCM persistent store in kilobytes at startup.

histogram.name: GCM.StoreUpdateSucceeded
histogram.summary: Success indicates successfully updating the GCM persistent store on message update. Failure indicates a failure updating the persistence store.

histogram.name: GCM.UnregistrationCompleteTime
histogram.summary: Length of time taken to complete a GCM unregistration request successfully. If the unregistration is retried multiple times, the length of time is counted for the last successful retry.

histogram.name: GCM.UnregistrationRequestStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of the outcome of a GCM unregistration request.

histogram.name: GCM.UnregistrationRetryCount
histogram.summary: Number of retries before a GCM unregistration succeeds.

histogram.name: GCMInvalidations.IncomingMessageStatus
histogram.summary: Status of parsing incoming invalidations message from GCM channel.

histogram.name: GCMInvalidations.OutgoingMessageStatus
histogram.summary: Status of sending outgoing invalidations message through GCM.

histogram.name: GData.AuthSuccess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Result of the authentication for Drive.

histogram.name: GData.EntireFeedLoadTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent to load the entire file system information from the server

histogram.name: GData.EntryKind
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Provides breakdown of specific formats for hosted documents. Recorded when feed is loaded from the server.

histogram.name: GData.InitialFeedLoadTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent to load the initial part of the file system information from the server

histogram.name: GData.NumberOfHostedDocuments
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of hosted documents (spreadsheets etc.) on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: GData.NumberOfRegularFiles
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of regualr files on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: GData.NumberOfTotalFiles
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of total files (regualr files + hosted documents) on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: Geolocation.GeolocationDispatcherHostImpl.EnableHighAccuracy
histogram.summary: Whether high accuracy geolocation information was requested.

histogram.name: Geolocation.InfoBarDelegate.Event
histogram.summary: Events in GeolocationInfoBarDelegate.

histogram.name: Geolocation.InfoBarDelegateAndroid.Event
histogram.summary: Events in GeolocationInfoBarDelegateAndroid.

histogram.name: Geolocation.LocationUpdate.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: Error code for the geoposition sent to the renderers.

histogram.name: Geolocation.NetworkLocationRequest.AccessPoints
histogram.summary: The number of WiFi access points used to determine geolocation.

histogram.name: Geolocation.NetworkLocationRequest.Event
histogram.summary: Events in NetworkLocationRequest.

histogram.name: Geolocation.NetworkLocationRequest.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: Http response codes in NetworkLocationRequest.

histogram.name: GoogleNow.Card.Button.Clicked0
histogram.summary: Types of cards which received an index 0 button click.

histogram.name: GoogleNow.Card.Button.Clicked1
histogram.summary: Types of cards which received an index 1 button click.

histogram.name: GoogleNow.Card.Clicked
histogram.summary: Types of cards which received a notification click.

histogram.name: GoogleNow.Event
histogram.summary: Events in Google Now component extension.

histogram.name: GoogleNow.MessageCenter.Displayed.NotificationsVisible
histogram.summary: Count of the number of Google Now notifications visible when the message center/notification center is shown.

histogram.name: GoogleSearch.AccessPoint
histogram.summary: Counts number of Google searches from various access points in the browser.

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.EffectivePolicy
histogram.summary: The effective update policy for Chrome on Windows. Recorded once per startup (following a 45 seconds delay).

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.UpdatePolicyIsOverridden
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: True if the effective update policy for Chrome on Windows is the result of an app-specific override; false if it is the default for all apps. Recorded once per startup (following a 45 seconds delay).

histogram.name: GPU.AcceleratedSurfaceRefreshRate
histogram.summary: Refresh rate of the display in Hz. This is recorded every time we present a frame.

histogram.name: GPU.CollectContextGraphicsInfo
histogram.summary: The time that the GPU process spends collecting driver information during startup.

histogram.name: GPU.CreateBrowserCompositor
histogram.summary: The time that the browser process takes to create the compositor from its point of view. One of these is created for each top-level window (browser frame, menus, etc.).

histogram.name: GPU.InitializeOneOffTime
histogram.summary: The time that the GPU process spends in initializing the GL surface, and collecting graphics information.

histogram.name: HIDDetection.OOBEDevicesDetectedOnContinuePressed
histogram.summary: Which HID were detected when user pressed Continue on OOBE dialog. This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: HIDDetection.OOBEDialogShown
histogram.summary: Whether HID detection dialog was shown on OOBE. Logged on screen show or on screen skip respectively. This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: HIDDetection.TimesDialogShownPerOOBECompleted
histogram.summary: Records number of times the dialog was shown by the time OOBE is completed. This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: History.DeleteFTSIndexDatabases
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of "History Index *" databases deleted. These databases stored the full-text-search data for history, which was removed at r213442, this histogram tracks cleanup.

histogram.name: History.FaviconsRecoveredPercentage
histogram.summary: Size of the recovered Favicons database relative to the original corrupt database. Recovery is VACUUM-like, so the resulting database should always be smaller. Substantial 100% results would indicate empty databases being recovered, substantial low% results would indicate very little data being recovered.

histogram.name: History.FaviconsRecoveredRowsFaviconBitmaps
histogram.summary: Rows recovered from [favicon_bitmaps] table in Favicons recovery.

histogram.name: History.FaviconsRecoveredRowsFavicons
histogram.summary: Rows recovered from [favicons] table in Favicons recovery.

histogram.name: History.FaviconsRecoveredRowsIconMapping
histogram.summary: Rows recovered from [icon_mapping] table in Favicons recovery.

histogram.name: History.FaviconsRecovery
histogram.summary: Track results of SQLite database recovery code in thumbnail_database.cc.

histogram.name: History.TopSitesRecoveredPercentage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of the recovered TopSites database relative to the original corrupt database. Recovery is VACUUM-like, so the resulting database should always be smaller. Substantial 100% results would indicate empty databases being recovered, substantial low% results would indicate very little data being recovered.

histogram.name: History.TopSitesRecoveredRowsThumbnails
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Rows recovered from [thumbnails] table in TopSites recovery.

histogram.name: History.TopSitesRecovery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The TopSites recovery code is written conservatively, with successful recovery committed and any failure leading to rollback. This tracks the outcomes to determine which cases are high-frequency enough to warrant adding additional code to handle them (versus simply deleting the data).

histogram.name: History.TopSitesVisitsByRank
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Page visits to each of a user's top 50 sites. Visits to all other sites go into the 51st bucket. Only count the page visit if it came from user browsing and only count it once when cycling through a redirect chain.

histogram.name: HistoryPage.ClickPosition
histogram.summary: Number of entries that the clicked entry is older than in History page. Last bucket is any entry of that value or higher.

histogram.name: HistoryPage.ClickPositionSubset
histogram.summary: Subset of the Click Position histogram. Contains only the first smaller subset of entries on the page. Number of entries that the clicked entry is older than in History page. Last bucket is entries of that value or higher.

histogram.name: HistoryPage.OtherDevicesMenu
histogram.summary: Histogram for usage of the section in the history page that allows the user to access tabs from other devices.

histogram.name: HistoryPage.RemoveEntryPosition
histogram.summary: Number of entries that the deleted entry is older than in History page. Last bucket is any entry of that value or higher. Confirmed removal is not guaranteed, just an initiation of 'Remove selected items'.

histogram.name: HistoryPage.RemoveEntryPositionSubset
histogram.summary: Subset of Remove Entry Position histogram. Contains only the first smaller subset of entries on the page. Number of entries that the deleted entry is older than in History page. Last bucket is any entry of that value or higher. Confirmed removal is not guaranteed, just an initiation of 'Remove selected items'.

histogram.name: Hotword.AudioLoggingEnabled
histogram.summary: The state of the hotword audio logging preference. This value is emitted each time the hotword availability is requested by the extension if the user is also opted in to hotword voice search. This check typically happens each time a hotword search is initiated.

histogram.name: Hotword.Enabled
histogram.summary: The state of the hotword preference. This value is emitted during HotwordService initialization which happens during Profile initialization.

histogram.name: Hotword.ExtensionAvailability
histogram.summary: Whether the external component hotword extension exists (i.e., not pending download, disabled, etc.). This value is emitted each time the hotword availability is requested by the extension which typically happens each time a hotword search is initiated.

histogram.name: Hotword.HotwordError
histogram.summary: Errors reported by the hotword service when determining if hotwording is available. Non-errors are also reported so that errors can be seen as a percentage of total requests.

histogram.name: HttpCache.EntryLockWait
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time spent waiting for write lock on a disk cache entry.

histogram.name: HttpCache.OfflineStatus
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Result of a main page HttpCacheTransaction if offline mode had been enabled.

histogram.name: HttpCache.ReadErrorNonRestartable
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Net error results from non-restartable cache read errors.

histogram.name: HttpCache.ReadErrorRestartable
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Net error results from restartable cache read errors.

histogram.name: HttpCache.Vary
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The type of Vary header for a given GET response.

histogram.name: Import.ImporterType.AutoImport
histogram.summary: The importer used on first run Auto Import.

histogram.name: Import.ImporterType.BookmarksAPI
histogram.summary: The importer used on import from the bookmarks file API.

histogram.name: Import.ImporterType.ImportDataHandler
histogram.summary: The importer used on import from the chrome://settings/importData UI.

histogram.name: Import.ShowDialog.FromBookmarkBarView
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time from install time to time that user opens import dialog from BookmarkBarView.

histogram.name: Import.ShowDialog.FromFloatingBookmarkBarView
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time from install time to time that user opens import dialog from NTP floating BookmarkBarView.

histogram.name: Import_ShowDlg.FromBookmarkBarView
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time from install time to time that user opens import dialog from BookmarkBarView.

histogram.name: Import_ShowDlg.FromFloatingBookmarkBarView
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time from install time to time that user opens import dialog from NTP floating BookmarkBarView.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.AccelerometerAndroidAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Sensor.TYPE_LINEAR_ACCELERATION was available at the start of Device Motion.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.AccelerometerIncGravityAndroidAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Sensor.TYPE_ACCELEROMETER was available at the start of Device Motion.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.AccelerometerWindowsAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the SENSOR_TYPE_ACCELEROMETER_3D was available at the start of Device Motion on the Windows platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.GyrometerWindowsAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the SENSOR_TYPE_GYROMETER_3D was available at the start of Device Motion on the Windows platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.GyroscopeAndroidAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Sensor.TYPE_GYROSCOPE was available at the start of Device Motion.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.InclinometerWindowsAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the SENSOR_TYPE_INCLINOMETER_3D was available at the start of Device Orientation on the Windows platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.MotionDefaultAvailable
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of Device Motion API invocations in the default implementation (Linux and CrOS). The default implementation does not provide any sensors so the result is always false.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.MotionMacAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the sudden motion sensor was available at the start of Device Motion on the MacOS platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.OrientationDefaultAvailable
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of Device Orientation API invocations in the default implementation (Linux and CrOS). The default implementation does not provide any sensors so the result is always false.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.OrientationMacAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the sudden motion sensor was available at the start of Device Orientation on the MacOS platform.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.RotationVectorAndroidAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Sensor.TYPE_ROTATION_VECTOR was available at the start of Device Orientation.

histogram.name: Installer.AttemptsCount.Total
histogram.summary: The number of update attempts until the update has been applied. This is reported every time the device has completed an update.

histogram.name: Installer.DevModeErrorCodes
histogram.summary: Errors from update_engine process when running in dev mode.

histogram.name: Installer.DownloadOverheadPercentage
histogram.summary: The overhead in downloading extra bytes due to errors/interruptions. Expressed as a percentage of the bytes that are actually needed to be downloaded for the update to be successful.

histogram.name: Installer.DownloadSourcesUsed
histogram.summary: The combinations of protocol and source server that were used to complete a successful update.

histogram.name: Installer.FullPayloadAttemptNumber
histogram.summary: The number of update attempts with a full update payload until the update has been applied. This is reported on every update attempt.

histogram.name: Installer.InstallDateProvisioningSource
histogram.summary: The source used to provision the install-date-days value sent to Omaha with every request. This is reported when OOBE completes (M34 or later) or when upgrading to a version with install-date-days support.

histogram.name: Installer.NormalErrorCodes
histogram.summary: Errors from update_engine process when running in normal mode.

histogram.name: Installer.OSAgeDays
histogram.summary: The age of the OS, defined as the age of the /etc/lsb-release file. This is reported on every update check but at most once a day.

histogram.name: Installer.PayloadAttemptNumber
histogram.summary: The number of update attempts until the update has been applied. This is reported on every update attempt.

histogram.name: Installer.PayloadFormat
histogram.summary: The type of update payload used to update the device. The difference between "Full" and "Forced Full" is that in the latter, the request sent to Omaha included a directive saying that a delta payload wasn't accepted. A "Full" payload is one where a delta payload was accepted but Omaha provided a full payload. This is reported every time the device has completed an update.

histogram.name: Installer.RebootToNewPartitionAttempt
histogram.summary: The number of consecutive times a device has failed to boot an update that successfully applied. This metric is reported every time the firmware fails to boot the slot with the update and fell back to the slot it originally updated from.

histogram.name: Installer.SuccessfulMBsDownloadedFrom
histogram.summary: Number of MBs downloaded from during an update that completed successfully.

histogram.name: Installer.TimeToRebootMinutes
histogram.summary: Wall-clock duration between when an update has successfully completed (and the user is presented with the "reboot arrow") and when the system has booted into the new update. This is reported every time the device is rebooted after an update has been applied.

histogram.name: Installer.TotalMBsDownloadedFrom
histogram.summary: Total number of MBs downloaded since the last successful update. This also includes all the bytes downloaded during any prior failed attempts.

histogram.name: Installer.UpdateDurationMinutes
histogram.summary: Absolute wall-clock time duration it took for the update to complete from the time an update first began. It includes not just the time the device was up, but also includes the time the device spent sleeping.

histogram.name: Installer.UpdateDurationUptimeMinutes
histogram.summary: Uptime duration it took for the update to complete from the time an update first began. It does not include the time the device spent sleeping, but it does include the uptime spent in waiting for the hourly update checks to happen.

histogram.name: Installer.UpdateNumReboots
histogram.summary: Number of times the device was rebooted by the user since an update began and until it completed successfully.

histogram.name: Installer.UpdatesAbandonedCount
histogram.summary: The number of update attempts that didn't complete because a newer update was detected during the update operation. This is reported every time the device has completed an update.

histogram.name: Installer.UpdatesAbandonedEventCount
histogram.summary: The number of consecutive different abandoned update payloads since the last successful update. This is reported every time an update payload is abandoned because a newer update payload is available.

histogram.name: Installer.UpdateURLSwitches
histogram.summary: Number of times the download URLs were switched due to failures.

histogram.name: InstallSigner.InvalidCount
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This is a count of the number of ids that we asked to be signed which the server response indicated were not in the webstore.

histogram.name: InstallSigner.InvalidSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extensions install signer got a well-formed result from the server but the signature check on it failed.

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.CallbackInvalidSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier tried to get a new signature and received a response but it wasn't properly signed.

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.CallbackNoSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier tried to get a new signature but was unable to (network error contacting the server, response from server was malformed, etc.).

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.CallbackValidSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier got a new signature from the server that was valid.

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.InitGoodSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier found a valid signature at startup, and this is a count of the number of signed ids it contained.

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.InitInvalidSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier found a signature in the prefs at startup, and it parsed properly, but it was invalid (some ids may have been added/removed, could not verify it was signed with the correct private key, etc.).

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.InitNoSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier did not find any signature in the prefs at startup.

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.InitUnparseablePref
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier found a signature in the prefs at startup, but it wasn't parseable (missing/wrong format of required keys, etc.).

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.SignatureFailedButNotEnforcing
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier would have disabled an extension but is not in enforcement mode.

histogram.name: Instant.InstantControllerEvent
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records various events of interest in the InstantController. E.g. When URLs are blacklisted.

histogram.name: Instant.SessionsStorageNamespace
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: How often an Instant preview is committed onto a different tab than it was created from.

histogram.name: Instant.TimeToFirstShow
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time between the first Omnibox interaction and when the Instant preview shows. If the instant preview was already showing when the user interacted with the omnibox, this histogram is not recorded.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.CacheableNTPLoad
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records a histogram for how often the Cacheable NTP fails to load.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.FallbackToLocalOverlay
histogram.obsolete: Depcreated as of 10/2013. No longer relevant since the HTML overlay was abandoned.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the cause for falling back to a local overlay at the time of fallback.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.InstantNavigation
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 10/2013. This histogram is no longer relevant since the HTML overlay went away.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records a histogram for instant extended (Local NTP and Online NTP) and non-extended navigations.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.NewOptInState
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records, on startup, whether the user has chosen to opt-in to or opt-out of InstantExtended via chrome://flags.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.OptInState
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2013-06. As of m30 use InstantExtended.NewOptInState.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records, on startup, whether the user has chosen to opt-in to or opt-out of InstantExtended via chrome://flags.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchQuerytoQuery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a search query to another search query.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchQuerytoURL
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a search query to a url. Example: Accidental search for google.con, then navigation to google.com.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchURLtoQuery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a url to a search query.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchURLtoURL
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a url to another url.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchV2_QuerytoQuery
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a search query to another search query.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchV2_QuerytoURL
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a search query to a url. Example: Accidental search for google.con, then navigation to google.com.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchV2_URLtoQuery
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a url to a search query.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchV2_URLtoURL
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a url to another url.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PrefValue
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2013-06. This preference has not been exposed or used for months, and we do not plan to use it in the future.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records, on startup, the value of the "Allow your search engine to provide Instant result" preference setting for the first profile loaded.

histogram.name: InstantSearchClicks.PreviewScrollState
histogram.summary: Records the scroll state on the preview page when instant search clicks feature is triggered.

histogram.name: InstantSearchClicks.ReasonForSwap
histogram.summary: Records the reason that triggered the page swap when instant search clicks feature is triggered.

histogram.name: InstantSearchClicks.TimeInPreview
histogram.summary: The time spent by the user in preview page before swapping to original or navigating out of preview page.

histogram.name: InstantSearchClicks.TimeToSwap
histogram.summary: The time it took for swap to trigger for all swaps. The is the time between preview page load start to preview page swap with the original page.

histogram.name: interstitial.authority_invalid_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, which may be either accept or deny. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings with a CERT_AUTHORITY_INVALID warning. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: interstitial.common_name_invalid_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, which may be either accept or deny. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings with a CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID warning. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: interstitial.date_invalid_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, which may be either accept or deny. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings with a CERT_DATE_INVALID warning. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl
histogram.summary: User action when the user is shown a SSL interstitial. SHOW_ALL and MORE refer to the total number of SSL errors; all of the other numbers pertain to the number of actions related to SSL errors that are overridable. The counts do not sum to 100%; SHOW_ALL is a superset of SHOW_OVERRIDABLE, which in turn will be a supserset of the PROCEED/DONT_PROCEED variables. SHOW_UNDERSTAND is only being used by an experimental field trial.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.cause.nonoverridable
histogram.summary: Possible non-attack causes of the non-overridable SSL interstitial. Many errors are not reported in this histogram and new errors may be added over time, therefore one should not look at the breakdown of this histogram (one bucket divided by the sum) because that will be inaccurate. Instead, one should look at each bucket count divided by the count of the ssl errors of that type. E.g. WWW mismatch is recorded only when the ssl error is CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID, so one should look at the bucket count of WWW mismatch divided by the bucket count of CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID in the histogram interstitial.ssl_error_type.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.cause.overridable
histogram.summary: Possible non-attack causes of the overridable SSL interstitial. Many errors are not reported in this histogram and new errors may be added over time, therefore one should not look at the breakdown of this histogram (one bucket divided by the sum) because that will be inaccurate. Instead, one should look at each bucket count divided by the count of the ssl errors of that type. E.g. WWW mismatch is recorded only when the ssl error is CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID, so one should look at the bucket count of WWW mismatch divided by the bucket count of CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID in the histogram interstitial.ssl_error_type.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl_accept_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, when the user accepts the SSL warning. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl_error_type
histogram.summary: The type of SSL error that the user encounters. This is recorded for all SSL warnings, regardless of whether they are overridable.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl_reject_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, when the user rejects the SSL warning. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: Invalidations.NetworkChannel
histogram.summary: Network channel used for invalidations.

histogram.name: Keyboard.KeystrokeDeltas
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time between keystrokes in Aura text fields. The only keystrokes that are measured are ones that produce a printable character and are not over 5 seconds apart.

histogram.name: LanguageUsage.AcceptLanguage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Accept languages.

histogram.name: LanguageUsage.ApplicationLanguage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Application languages used for UI.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.All.SafeThreadAccess
histogram.summary: Linux and CrOS use unlocked_stdio(3). If it is used unsafely, record it here. If there is no record of unsafety after chrome 29 has been in the stable channel for a few weeks then revert this change.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.IOError
histogram.summary: Methods where leveldb's Chromium environment has IO errors when being used by IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.IOError.
histogram.summary: PlatformFileErrors encountered by a single leveldb env method.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.IOError.NewLogger
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in NewLogger.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.IOError.NewSequentialFile
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in NewSequentialFile.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.IOError.RandomAccessFile
histogram.summary: File errors in leveldb IDBEnv's NewRandomAccessFile method.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.IOError.WritableFileAppend
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in WritableFileAppend.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.IOError.WritableFileFlush
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in WritableFileFlush.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.LockFileAncestorsNotFound
histogram.summary: Number of directories missing when IDB LevelDBEnv tries to create a Lock file.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.MaxFDs
histogram.summary: File descriptor limit recorded every time LevelDB calls NewRandomAccessFile for IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.MissingFiles
histogram.summary: Number of backup files found without corresponding ldb files. As measured by GetChildren when used in IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.RetryRecoveredFromErrorIn
histogram.summary: When IDB LevelDBEnv successfully retries an operation that had failed, record the error from the most recent failed attempt.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.Table
histogram.summary: Success indicates a successful backup or restore operation for .ldb table files when used in IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.TimeTo
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2013-04. As of m28 use LevelDBEnv.IDB.TimeUntilSuccessFor.
histogram.summary: Time IDB LevelDBEnv slept before successfully completing this operation. 0 means success on the first try.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IDB.TimeUntilSuccessFor
histogram.summary: Time IDB LevelDBEnv slept before successfully completing this operation. 0 means success on the first try.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError
histogram.summary: Methods where leveldb's Chromium environment has IO errors.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.
histogram.summary: PlatformFileErrors encountered by a single leveldb method.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.NewLogger
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in NewLogger.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.NewSequentialFile
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in NewSequentialFile.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.RandomAccessFile
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2013-04. As of m28 use LevelDBEnv.IOError.NewRandomAccessFile.
histogram.summary: File errors in leveldb ChromiumEnv's NewRandomAccessFile method.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.WritableFileAppend
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in WritableFileAppend.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.WritableFileFlush
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in WritableFileFlush.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.LockFileAncestorsNotFound
histogram.summary: Number of directories missing when Non-IDB LevelDBEnv tries to create a Lock file.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.MaxFDs
histogram.summary: File descriptor limit recorded every time LevelDB calls NewRandomAccessFile for clients other than IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.MissingFiles
histogram.summary: Number of backup files found without corresponding ldb files. As measured by GetChildren when used in LevelDB clients other than IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.RetryRecoveredFromErrorIn
histogram.summary: When Non-IDB LevelDBEnv successfully retries an operation that had failed, record the error from the most recent failed attempt.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.Table
histogram.summary: Success indicates a successful backup or restore operation for .ldb table files when used by LevelDB clients other than IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.TimeTo
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2013-04. As of m28 use LevelDBEnv.TimeUntilSuccessFor.
histogram.summary: Time Non-IDB LevelDBEnv slept before successfully completing this operation. 0 means success on the first try.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.TimeUntilSuccessFor
histogram.summary: Time Non-IDB LevelDBEnv slept before successfully completing this operation. 0 means success on the first try.

histogram.name: LevelDBPrefStore.ReadErrors

histogram.name: LibraryLoader.NativeLibraryHack

histogram.name: Linux.GlibcVersion
histogram.summary: The version of glibc used. (Linux only) Logged on each start up.

histogram.name: Linux.WindowManager
histogram.summary: The window manager used. (Linux only) Logged on each start up.

histogram.name: Memory.Extension
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each extension process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.GlyphPagesPerLoad
histogram.summary: The number of glyph pages present in the renderer when it commits a load. Since this is per-sub-process, you can get the average number of glyph pages in the system by multiplying this number with the average number of renderers. Note that this typically won't count the glyph pages added as a result of the load that just committed, since layout will happen after the commit. There are 512 bytes per glyph page, but this number also very closely approximates the number of glyph width map pages in the same renderer. The only difference is that if you have font fallback, it will make a new glyph page and no width page, but in most common cases there is no fallback). Width pages are 1K each (256 floats), so you could think of this value as being the number of "1.5K units related to glyphs per renderer per page load".

histogram.name: Memory.Gpu
histogram.summary: The private working set used by the GPU process. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Graphics
histogram.summary: System-wide graphics driver memory consumption. Recorded on Chrome OS for platforms where it is exposed by the kernel (for example, Intel i915 and Exynos Mali). Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Plugin
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each plugin process. Each plugin process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.PluginProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of active plugin processes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.ProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of all active processes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.ProcessLimit
histogram.summary: The current process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Renderer
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each renderer process. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.RendererGrowthIn30Min
histogram.summary: Growth speed of the private working set used by each renderer process per 30 minutes. The usage and growth speed is recorded at most every 30 minutes, not every exact 30 minutes. If the interval is longer than 30 minutes, it is normalized to a speed KB per 30 minutes. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA log unless this is the first time the UMA log is recorded after startup of the renderer, 30 minutes have not passed from the last recording of the renderer or the usage goes down. If the usage goes down, the amount of the shrink will be recorded in the Memory.RendererShrinkIn30Min histogram.

histogram.name: Memory.RendererProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of active renderer processes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.RendererShrinkIn30Min
histogram.summary: Shrink speed of the private working set used by each renderer process per 30 minutes. The usage and shrink speed is recorded at most every 30 minutes, not every exact 30 minutes. If the interval is longer than 30 minutes, it is normalized to a speed KB per 30 minutes. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA log unless this is the first time the UMA log is recorded after startup of the renderer, 30 minutes have not passed from the last recording of the renderer or the usage goes up. If the usage goes up, the amount of the growth will be recorded in the Memory.RendererGrowthIn30Min histogram.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.MobileMultiWindowInstances
histogram.summary:
Android: Number of instances of Chrome currently open during a MultiWindow session. Emitted every time Chrome is paused. Only emitted on Android MultiWindow devices.
A MultiWindow session is any period of time that Chrome was not used in a full screen mode but together with another Activity that is visible at the same time. This is only supported in a few Android models.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.MobileMultiWindowSession
histogram.summary:
Android: percent of the screen available for Chrome during a multi-window session. Emitted every time chrome is paused. Only emitted on Android MultiWindow devices.
A multiwindow session is any period of time that Chrome was not used in full screen mode but together with some other application that is visible at the same time. This is only supported in a few Android models.

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of gesturetapunconfirmed events detected at HTML anchor-tag links' default event handler.

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_TabSwitchPaintDuration
histogram.summary: Time from tab switch requested to tab appearing on screen (Aura and Mac only).

histogram.name: MultiProfile.DiscardedTabsPerUser
histogram.summary: The relation of discarded tabs vs. the amount of simultaneous users. The counts are the number of discards and the buckets are the number of users. Since the count values are absolute numbers, they need to be normalized before use - so divide the counts by the percentage of users per session found under 'MultiProfile.UsersPerSessionIncremental'.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.SessionMode
histogram.summary: The session counter for different multi profile modes which gets stored once per session at the beginning of the session.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.SigninUserUIPath
histogram.summary: Count the number of times each UI path is taken for signing into a new account in a Chrome OS multiprofile session. UI paths include the system tray and the user account switcher on the browser frame.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.SwitchActiveUserUIPath
histogram.summary: Count the number of times each UI path is taken for switching the active account in a Chrome OS multiprofile session. UI paths include the system tray and the keyboard shortcut.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.TeleportWindow
histogram.summary: Counts the number of window teleportations when using separated desktop mode.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.TeleportWindowType
histogram.summary: Counts the number of teleported windows by types in separated desktop mode.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.UsersPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of users simultaneously signed into a multiprofile session on Chrome OS. This is recorded upon session end.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.UsersPerSessionIncremental
histogram.summary: The number of users simultaneously signed into a multiprofile session on Chrome OS. This is recorded whenever a user gets added to the session. To get the correct count, all following counts must be subtracted. Example: If 100 single user, 20 two user and 5 three user sessions, there were 100-20-5=75 single user sessions, 100-80=20 dual user sessions and so on.

histogram.name: NaCl.Client.Helper.InitState
histogram.summary: When the browser started, what happened with the NaCl helper process?

histogram.name: NaCl.Client.Helper.StateOnFork
histogram.summary: When a NaCl application process was created, what had happened with the NaCl helper process when the browser was started?

histogram.name: NaCl.Client.OSArch
histogram.summary: The OS/Architecture of a nexe that was loaded.

histogram.name: NaCl.HttpStatusCodeClass.Manifest.InstalledApp
histogram.summary: The status code returned when trying to load a manifest inside an installed app.

histogram.name: NaCl.HttpStatusCodeClass.Manifest.NotInstalledApp
histogram.summary: The status code returned when trying to load a manifest from a source other than an installed app.

histogram.name: NaCl.HttpStatusCodeClass.Nexe.InstalledApp
histogram.summary: The status code returned when trying to load a NaCl executable inside an installed app.

histogram.name: NaCl.HttpStatusCodeClass.Nexe.NotInstalledApp
histogram.summary: The status code returned when trying to load a NaCl executable from a source other than an installed app.

histogram.name: NaCl.LoadStatus.Plugin
histogram.summary: The error code returned by NaCl's Chrome plugin.

histogram.name: NaCl.LoadStatus.Plugin.InstalledApp
histogram.summary: The error code returned by NaCl's Chrome plugin, but only for installed apps.

histogram.name: NaCl.LoadStatus.Plugin.NotInstalledApp
histogram.summary: The error code returned by NaCl's Chrome plugin, but excluding installed apps.

histogram.name: NaCl.LoadStatus.SelLdr
histogram.summary: The error code returned by NaCl's sel_ldr.

histogram.name: NaCl.LoadStatus.SelLdr.InstalledApp
histogram.summary: The error code returned by NaCl's sel_ldr, but only for installed apps.

histogram.name: NaCl.LoadStatus.SelLdr.NotInstalledApp
histogram.summary: The error code returned by NaCl's sel_ldr, but excluding installed apps.

histogram.name: NaCl.Manifest.IsDataURI
histogram.summary: Was the manifest specified as a data URI rather than a .nmf file?

histogram.name: NaCl.ManifestDownloadTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to download the manifset file for a Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.ModuleUptime.Crash
histogram.summary: The time a NaCl module ran before it crashed.

histogram.name: NaCl.ModuleUptime.Normal
histogram.summary: The time a NaCl module ran without crashing, at shutdown.

histogram.name: NaCl.NexeDownloadTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to download the main .nexe for a Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.NexeSize
histogram.summary: The size of the main .nexe file downloaded for a Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.NexeStartupTime
histogram.summary: The time it took between the Native Client plugin initialization and when proxied execution of the NaCl module begins. This is the general startup overhead of running as a NaCl module vs a trusted PPAPI plugin.

histogram.name: NaCl.NexeStartupTimePerMB
histogram.summary: The time it took between the Native Client plugin initialization and when proxied execution of the NaCl module begins. This is the general startup overhead of running as a NaCl module vs a trusted PPAPI plugin.

histogram.name: NaCl.Options.PNaCl.OptLevel
histogram.summary: The optimization level set for the initial Portable Native Client translation from bitcode to native code.

histogram.name: NaCl.OSArch
histogram.summary: The OS/Architecture of a nexe that was loaded.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClCache.IsHit
histogram.summary: Did the Portable Native Client translation cache find an executable translated from bitcode?

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClLoadTime.CompileKBPerSec
histogram.summary: The rate for compiling a Portable Native Client bitcode file to an object file in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClLoadTime.CompileTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to compile a Portable Native Client bitcode file to an object file.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClLoadTime.LinkTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to link a Portable Native Client generated object file into a Native Client executable.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClLoadTime.LoadCompiler
histogram.summary: The time it took to load and validate the Portable Native Client compiler.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClLoadTime.LoadLinker
histogram.summary: The time it took to load and validate the Portable Native Client linker.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClLoadTime.PctCompiledWhenFullyDownloaded
histogram.summary: The percentage of a Portable Native Client application that is compiled by the time the application is fully downloaded (compile and download happen in parallel).

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClLoadTime.TotalUncachedKBPerSec
histogram.summary: The rate for completely translating a Portable Native Client bitcode file into a Native Client executable and caching the result in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.PNaClLoadTime.TotalUncachedTime
histogram.summary: The total time it took to completely translate a Portable Native Client bitcode file into a Native Client executable, and cache the result.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.ShutdownTime.Total
histogram.summary: The time it took the NaCl module to shut down.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.Size.Manifest
histogram.summary: The size of the manifest file.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.Size.Nexe
histogram.summary: The size of the main .nexe file downloaded for a Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.Size.Pexe
histogram.summary: The size of the main .pexe bitcode file downloaded for a Portable Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.Size.PexeNexeSizePct
histogram.summary: The size of the main .pexe bitcode file divided by the size of the .nexe that is the result of translating the bitcode file, times 100.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.Size.PNaClTranslatedNexe
histogram.summary: The size of the main .nexe file that is the result of translating a Portable Native Client .pexe bitcode file. This reflects the amount of cache consumed.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.LoadModule
histogram.summary: The time it took to load the NaCl module into sel_ldr.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.LoadModulePerMB
histogram.summary: The time it took to load the NaCl module into sel_ldr. Normalized by the size of the .nexe, in megabytes.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.ManifestDownload
histogram.summary: The time it took to download the manifset file for a Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.NaClOverhead
histogram.summary: The time it took between the Native Client plugin initialization and when proxied execution of the NaCl module begins. This is the general startup overhead of running as a NaCl module vs a trusted PPAPI plugin.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.NaClOverheadPerMB
histogram.summary: The time it took between the Native Client plugin initialization and when proxied execution of the NaCl module begins. This is the general startup overhead of running as a NaCl module vs a trusted PPAPI plugin. Normalized by the size of the .nexe, in megabytes.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.NexeDownload
histogram.summary: The time it took to download the main .nexe for a Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.NexeDownloadPerMB
histogram.summary: The time it took to download the main .nexe for a Native Client module. Normalized by the size of the .nexe, in megabytes.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.Total
histogram.summary: The time it took between the Native Client plugin initialization and when the NaCl module is ready to be used.

histogram.name: NaCl.Perf.StartupTime.TotalPerMB
histogram.summary: The time it took between the Native Client plugin initialization and when the NaCl module is ready to be used. Normalized by the size of the .nexe, in megabytes.

histogram.name: NaCl.Startups
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 5/2011, data is duplicated by NaCl.NexeStartupTime, and normalizing to 'tab opens' is unusual.
histogram.summary: The number of times that Native Client has been started by loading a .nexe compared to the number of times that a tab has been opened.

histogram.name: NaCl.ValidationCache.Query
histogram.summary: Did a validation cache query find a previously known validation result?

histogram.name: NaCl.ValidationCache.Set
histogram.summary: Was the validation cache updated with a new validation result?

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameScheme
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The scheme of the URL for each main-frame navigation.

histogram.name: Navigation.RedirectChainSize
histogram.summary: Total length of the redirect URL strings in navigation entry. Logged when entry is committed.

histogram.name: NCN.CM.FastestRTTOn2G
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the fastest round-trip-time seen on a 2G connection, before the NetworkChangeNotifier detected a connectivity change.
This metric is recorded when the NetworkChangeNotifier detects a connectivity change. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

histogram.name: NCN.CM.FastestRTTOn3G
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the fastest round-trip-time seen on a 3G connection, before the NetworkChangeNotifier detected a connectivity change.
This metric is recorded when the NetworkChangeNotifier detects a connectivity change. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

histogram.name: NCN.ConnectionTypeChangeToIPAddressChange
histogram.summary: Time from ConnectionTypeChanged message until IPAddressChanged message.

histogram.name: NCN.DNSConfigChange
histogram.summary: Time between DNS configuration change messages.

histogram.name: NCN.GetConnectionTypeTime
histogram.summary: How long does each call to NetworkChangeNotifier::GetConnectionType() take.

histogram.name: NCN.IPAddressChange
histogram.summary: Time between IP address change messages.

histogram.name: NCN.IPAddressChangeToConnectionTypeChange
histogram.summary: Time from IPAddressChanged message until ConnectionTypeChanged message.

histogram.name: NCN.NetworkOfflineChange
histogram.summary: Time between going online until we go offline change messages, using new filtered signal.

histogram.name: NCN.NetworkOnlineChange
histogram.summary: Time between going offline until we go online change messages, using new filtered signal.

histogram.name: NCN.NetworkOperatorMCCMNC
histogram.summary: The MCC (mobile country code) and MNC (mobile network code) of the network operator when a new metrics log is created or when the network connection is changed. A value of zero means a non-mobile network or the operator code is unknown.

histogram.name: NCN.OfflineChange
histogram.summary: Time between going online until we go offline change messages.

histogram.name: NCN.OfflineDataRecv
histogram.summary: Time between when we thought we went offline and when we received some network data (a URLRequest read completed).

histogram.name: NCN.OfflineDataRecvAny5sBeforeOnline
histogram.summary: Count of how many times we received network data (a URLRequest read completed) while offline when some data was received at most five seconds before going online.

histogram.name: NCN.OfflineDataRecvUntilOnline
histogram.summary: Time between when we received the last network data (a URLRequest read completed) while offline and when we thought we went online.

histogram.name: NCN.OfflinePolls
histogram.summary: Count of how many times we polled the online/offline status before detecting an offline to online transition.

histogram.name: NCN.OnlineChange
histogram.summary: Time between going offline until we go online change messages.

histogram.name: NCN.PollingOfflineDataRecv
histogram.summary: Time between when we thought we went offline and when we received some network data (a URLRequest read completed), while polling NetworkChangeNotifier::GetConnectionType() still told us we were offline.

histogram.name: Net.AlternateProtocolUsage.200Truncated

histogram.name: Net.AutoReload.ErrorAtFirstSuccess
