histogram.name: NewTabPage.ActionAndroid
histogram.summary: Actions taken by users from the new tab page on Android. These actions may navigate away from the NTP (e.g. searching in the omnibox or opening a bookmark), but can also happen without navigating away from the NTP (e.g. opening a bookmark in a new tab).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.AppsPageDragSource
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for the source of app page drags. For any succesful drop onto an apps pane of the NTP, this logs where the drag originated.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.BookmarkActionAndroid
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated on M33 with the change to native NTP.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Actions taken by users on partner bookmarks (editing / renaming) on the NTP on Android.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.DefaultPageType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The default pane when the NTP is first opened.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.HoverTimeClicked
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram of the time, in milliseconds, users have the cursor over a most visited thumbnail before clicking.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.HoverTimeNotClicked
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram of the time, in milliseconds, users have the cursor over a most visited thumbnail before moving it away from the thumbnail without clicking.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.MobilePromo
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated on M33 with the change to native NTP.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Android: Tallies counts for how the user interacted with the NTP promo page.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.MostVisited
histogram.summary: Histogram for user clicks of the most visited thumbnails. The value is equal to the index of the thumbnail.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.MostVisitedAction
histogram.summary: Action taken by the user on the Most Visited NTP pane. If the user switches panes during this use of the NTP, this action is sometimes not recorded. Ask mpearson@ for details.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.MostVisitedTilePlacementExperiment
histogram.summary: Records anomalous events for the Most Visited Tile Placement experiment, where it is unable to operate as expected. These are recorded during New Tab Page load time, once for every NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NonVisibleScreenshots
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of screenshots that were cached for the non-visible but ranked suggestions on the Suggested NTP pane.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NonVisibleSuggestedSiteRank
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Given that the user has typed a URL, and given that that specific URL was ranked but not visible on the Suggested pane of the NTP, this is the rank that the Suggested pane had for that URL.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfExternalTileFallbacks
histogram.summary: The number of tiles for which we relied on external tiles as a fallback because a local screenshot was not available to be used as a thumbnail. External tiles are those for which the visuals are handled by the page itself, not by the iframe. Recorded before changing focus away from the NTP, be it bynavigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfExternalTiles
histogram.summary: The number of external tiles that are displayed on the NTP. External tiles are those for which the visuals are handled by the page itself, not by the iframe. Recorded before changing focus away from the NTP, be it by navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfGrayTileFallbacks
histogram.summary: The number of tiles for which we displayed a gray tile with the domain name as a fallback because a local screenshot was not available to be used as a thumbnail. Recorded before changing focus away from the NTP, be it by navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfGrayTiles
histogram.summary: The number of tiles for which no thumbnail was specified, but a domain was so we displayed a gray tile with the domain name in it. Recorded before changing focus away from the NTP, be it by navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfMouseOvers
histogram.summary: The total number of times the user hovered the mouse over Most Visited tile or title elements before changing focus away from the NTP, be it by navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfThumbnailAttempts
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of tiles for which we attempted to use a local screenshot as a thumbnail. Recorded before changing focus away from the NTP, be it by navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfThumbnailErrors
histogram.summary: The number of thumbnails for which a local screenshot was not available so we were not able to display them on the Most Visited section of the NTP. Recorded before changing focus away from the NTP, be it by navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfThumbnailTiles
histogram.summary: The number of tiles for which we attempted to use a local screenshot as a thumbnail. Recorded before changing focus away from the NTP, be it by navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfTiles
histogram.summary: The number of tiles that are displayed on the NTP, no matter if they are thumbnails, gray tiles, or external tiles. Recorded before changing focus away from the NTP, be it by navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.OtherSessionsMenu
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for usage of the menu on the NTP that allows the user to access tabs from other devices.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.PreviousSelectedPageType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The pane that had been previously selected when the user switches panes in the NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Promo.Bubble
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for NTP bubble promo activity.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Promo.Notification
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for NTP notification promo activity.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SearchURLs.Total
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SelectedPageType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The pane selected when the user switches panes in the NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SessionRestore
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for user clicks of the Recently Closed items. The value is the recency of the entry being restored (0 is most recent).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SingleSessionPageSwitches
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram to track how many times a user switched pages in a single NTP session.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestedSite
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for user clicks of the suggested site thumbnails. The value is equal to the index of the thumbnail.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestedSitesAction
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Action taken by the user on the Suggested Sites NTP pane.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestedSitesLoadTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time to load the Suggested Sites NTP pane, in milliseconds.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestedSitesViewTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent on the Suggested Sites NTP pane, in seconds.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestionsImpression
histogram.summary: Histogram for impressions on the various most visited tiles. The value is equal to the index of the thumbnail.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestionsType
histogram.summary: Indicate, for each impression of the New Tab Page, whether the suggestions were obtained from the client or server. Recorded before changing focus away from the NTP, be it by navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ThumbnailErrorRate
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 01/2014. Replaced by NewTabPage.NumberOfThumbnailAttempts and NewTabPage.NumberOfThumbnailErrors.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The percentage of errors per attempts to load image thumbnails on the New Tab Page. When an error occurs, a grey tile is shown instead of a thumbnail image. We measure the rate instead of the number of errors because multiple attempts are made to load images at different times during the NTP's lifetime. Each NTP session's error rate is logged after the user navigates to a new URL from that NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ThumbnailFallbackRate
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 01/2014. Replaced by NewTabPage.NumberOfGrayTileFallbacks and NewTabPage.NumberOfExternalFallbacks.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The percentage of times most visited tiles use the fallback thumbnail. Only requests that actually specify a fallback thumbnail are considered here. We measure the rate instead of the number of errors because multiple attempts are made to load thumbnails at different times during the NTP's lifetime. Each NTP session's error rate is logged after the user navigates to a new URL from that NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.URLState
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the status of the New Tab page URL when an NTP is opened.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.VisibleScreenshots
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of screenshots that were cached for the visible suggestions on the Suggested NTP pane.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.VisibleSuggestedSiteRank
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Given that the user has typed a URL, and given that that specific URL was visible on the Suggested pane of the NTP, this is the rank that the Suggested pane had for that URL.

histogram.name: Notifications.Actions
histogram.summary: The actions taken on notifications, recorded every time they happen. This histogram will record every single event that happens separately.

histogram.name: Notifications.PerNotificationActions
histogram.summary: The actions taken on notifications, recorded once per notification, when it is closed. This differs from the Notifications.Actions histogram in that multiple events of the same type on a single notification will only record a single UMA event.

histogram.name: ntp.searchurls.total
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: NtpHandler.AttachShownPageType
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 10/2011. No longer tracked, replaced with NewTabPage.DefaultPageType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The default pane when the NTP is first opened.

histogram.name: NtpHandler.SelectedShownPageType
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 10/2011. No longer tracked, replaced with NewTabPage.SelectedPageType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The pane selected when the user switches panes in the NTP.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.GetOAuth2AccessTokenFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of final OAuth2 access token retrieval call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.GetOAuth2AccessTokenRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed OAuth2 access token retrieval call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.ListAccountsFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of final ListAccounts call failure during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.ListAccountsRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed ListAccounts call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.MergeSessionFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of final MergeSession call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.MergeSessionRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed MergeSession call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.OAuthLoginGaiaCredFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of final OAuthLogin (with SID+LSID) call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.OAuthLoginGaiaCredRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed OAuthLogin (with SID+LSID) call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.OAuthLoginUberTokenFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of final OAuthLogin (with uber token) call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.OAuthLoginUberTokenRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed OAuthLogin (with uber token) call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.PostMergeVerification
histogram.summary: Outcome of Chrome OS GAIA cookie post-merge session verification process. It measures how often /MergeSession request collided with browser session restore process resulting in partially authenticated primary GAIA session.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.PreMergeVerification
histogram.summary: Outcome of Chrome OS GAIA cookie pre-merge session verification process. It measures how often we need to perform /MergeSession request to re-authenticated exisitng user with GAIA.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.SessionRestore
histogram.summary: Outcome of Chrome OS GAIA cookie session restore process.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.SessionRestoreTimeToFailure
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the session restore to fail.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.SessionRestoreTimeToSuccess
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the session restore to finish succeessfully.

histogram.name: OfflinePolicy.SuccessfulResourceLoadPercentage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When a page is loaded in offline mode, the percentage of resources on that page that were successfully loaded.

histogram.name: Omnibox.AggressiveHistoryURLProviderFieldTrialBeacon
histogram.obsolete: Aggressive HistoryURL provider field trial deleted in spring 2012.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: A number that indicates what omnibox ranking behavior the user is seeing as part of the OmniboxAggressiveHistoryURLProvider field trial (OmniboxAggressiveHistoryURLProvider).

histogram.name: Omnibox.CutOrCopyAllText
histogram.summary: The number of cut or copy commands on all selected text in the omnibox. Gathered on desktop platforms (Win, Mac, Linux, Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Omnibox.EnteredKeywordMode
histogram.summary: The number of times users enter keyword hint mode "Search ___ for:" and how.

histogram.name: Omnibox.FocusToEditTime
histogram.summary: The length of time between when a user focused on the omnibox and first modifies the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.FocusToOpenTime
histogram.summary: The length of time between when a user focused on the omnibox and opened an omnibox match (which could be what they typed or a suggestion).

histogram.name: Omnibox.FocusToOpenTimeAnyPopupState
histogram.summary: The length of time between when a user focused on the omnibox and opened an omnibox match (which could be what they typed or a suggestion). This is recorded regardless of whether the omnibox dropdown (a.k.a. popup) is open.

histogram.name: Omnibox.HasLegalDefaultMatchWithoutCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether there was at least one legal default match without an |inline_autocompletion|. Recorded every time AutocompleteResult::SortAndCull() is called, which could happen multiple times on each keystroke.

histogram.name: Omnibox.InputType
histogram.summary: The kind of input the user provided when using the omnibox to go somewhere. The type can be misleading. For example if the user typed 'http:/', it gets marked as a query because it cannot be opened as a URL even though the user probably wanted and selected a URL from the list of suggestions.

histogram.name: Omnibox.IsPasteAndGo
histogram.summary: Whether an omnibox interaction is a paste-and-search/paste-and-go action. (This histogram records both of these in the "True" bucket for this histogram because both of these are referred to as paste-and-go in the code.) These typically involve right-clicking in the omnibox and selecting that option from the dropdown.

histogram.name: Omnibox.IsPopupOpen
histogram.summary: Whether the omnibox popup (a.k.a. dropdown) is open at the time the user used the omnibox to go somewhere. It can be closed if, for instance, the user clicked in the omnibox and hit return to reload the same page. Also, because paste-and-search/paste-and-go actions ignore the current content of the omnibox dropdown (if it is open) when they happen, we pretend the dropdown is closed when logging these.

histogram.name: Omnibox.JustDeletedText
histogram.summary: Whether the user deleted text immediately before selecting an omnibox suggestion. This is usually the result of pressing backspace or delete.

histogram.name: Omnibox.NumEvents
histogram.summary: The number of times users used the omnibox to go somewhere.

histogram.name: Omnibox.NumTypedTerms
histogram.summary: The number of terms in the text the user entered in the omnibox when he/she used the omnibox to go somewhere. Terms are defined by splitting on whitespace. All values larger than 6 are recorded in bucket 6.

histogram.name: Omnibox.PageContext
histogram.summary: What the user was viewing when the user used the omnibox to go somewhere.

histogram.name: Omnibox.Paste
histogram.summary: The number of paste commands on the text in the omnibox. Reported every time a paste command is done.

histogram.name: Omnibox.PasteAndGo
histogram.summary: The number of paste-and-go commands on the text in the omnibox. Reported every time a paste-and-go command is done.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ProviderTime
histogram.summary: The length of time taken by the named provider"s synchronous pass.

histogram.name: Omnibox.QueryBookmarksTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time the HistoryContentProvider takes to perform a bookmark search.

histogram.name: Omnibox.QueryTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes for the omnibox to become responsive to user input after the user has typed N characters. This measures the time it takes to start all the asynchronous autocomplete providers (but not wait for them to finish).

histogram.name: Omnibox.SaveStateForTabSwitch.UserInputInProgress
histogram.summary: When a user switches tabs, whether the omnibox had an edit in progress.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SearchEngine
histogram.obsolete: Made obsolete around Chrome 32. Use Omnibox.SearchEngineType instead.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The id of search engine that was used for search in omnibox. See src/chrome/browser/search_engines/template_url_prepopulate_data.cc for more info.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SearchEngineType
histogram.summary: The type of search engine associated with a match opened from the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SearchProviderMatches
histogram.summary: The number of matches returned by SearchProvider. Emitted on every call to SearchProvider::Start(), which effectively means every key stroke in the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SelectedPosition
histogram.summary: The index of the item that the user selected in the omnibox popup (a.k.a. dropdown) list. 0 means the inline suggestion shown within the omnibox. This is also the same suggestion shown as the top item in the dropdown. The second item in the dropdown will be recorded as bucket 1. The selected position is always set to 0 when the popup is closed at the time of navigation or if the user did a paste-and-search or paste-and-go action.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.Provider
histogram.summary: The provider of the suggestion the user selected when the user used the omnibox to go somewhere.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.ProviderAndResultType
histogram.summary: The provider and result type of the suggestion the user selected when the user used the omnibox to go somewhere.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestRequest.Failure.GoogleResponseTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of a suggest request to Google until the time the request was returned with status==failed. Ignores requests that were canceled before being returned.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestRequest.Success.GoogleResponseTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of a suggest request to Google until the time the request was returned with status==success. Ignores requests that were canceled before being returned.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestRequests
histogram.summary: Counts about the number of suggest requests the omnibox sent, invalidated, and replies received.

histogram.name: Omnibox.TypedLength
histogram.summary: The length of the text the user entered in the omnibox when he/she used the omnibox to go somewhere. All values larger than 500 are recorded in bucket 500.

histogram.name: Omnibox.TypingDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time, in milliseconds, since the user first began modifying the text in the omnibox until the user used the omnibox to go somewhere. If at some point after modifying the text, the user reverted the modifications (thus seeing the current web page's URL again), then wrote in the omnibox again, this duration starts from the time of the second series of modification.

histogram.name: Omnibox.UserTextCleared
histogram.summary:
Counts the number of times that the user text is cleared. IME users are sometimes in the situation that IME was unintentionally turned on and failed to input latin alphabets (ASCII characters) or the opposite case. In that case, users may delete all the text and the user text gets cleared. This histogram helps us estimate how often this scenario happens.
Note that since we don't currently correlate "text cleared" events with IME usage, this also captures many other cases where users clear the text; though it explicitly doesn't log deleting all the permanent text as the first action of an editing sequence (see comments in OnAfterPossibleChange()).

histogram.name: Omnibox.ZeroSuggest.MostVisitedResultsCounterfactual
histogram.summary: The number of most visited suggestions returned when ZeroSuggest would have triggered. The suggestions appear when the user has focused but not modified the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ZeroSuggestRequests
histogram.summary: Counts about the number of zero suggest requests (requests for suggestions when the user has focused but not modified the omnibox) the omnibox sent, invalidated, and replies received.

histogram.name: OOBE.BootToSignInCompleted
histogram.summary: Time from boot to sign-in completed.

histogram.name: OOBE.StepCompletionTime
histogram.summary: Time spent on specific OOBE screen.

histogram.name: OriginChip.Pressed
histogram.summary: The number of clicks on the origin chip.

histogram.name: OSX.BluetoothAvailability
histogram.summary: The availability and capabilities of the Bluetooth driver on OSX devices. This metric is logged on startup.

histogram.name: OSX.CatSixtyFour
histogram.summary: The cat's flavor and how many bits there are in it.

histogram.name: OSX.ExceptionHandlerEvents
histogram.summary: Events seen by the OSX NSException swizzle.

histogram.name: OSX.SystemHotkeyMap.LoadSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether an attempt to load the system hotkeys on a Mac was successful.

histogram.name: OutdatedUpgradeBubble.NumLaterPerEnableAU
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the user clicked on the later button of the outdated upgrade bubble, before clicking on the enable updates button in the same Chrome session.

histogram.name: OutdatedUpgradeBubble.NumLaterPerReinstall
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the user clicked on the later button of the outdated upgrade bubble, before clicking on the reinstall button in the same Chrome session.

histogram.name: Overscroll.Completed
histogram.summary: Completed overscroll gestures.
histogram.details: An overscroll gesture starts when user scrolls past the edge of the web page and continues scrolling in the same direction. An overscroll gesture is completed when user stops scrolling (e.g. by lifting the fingers from the touchscreen or touchpad).

histogram.name: Overscroll.Navigated
histogram.summary: Navigations that were triggered due to completed overscroll gesture. Note that not all completed overscroll gestures trigger a navigation.

histogram.name: Overscroll.Started
histogram.summary: Overscroll gestures initiated by the user. Note that not all overcroll gestures started are completed (e.g. the overscroll gesture is aborted if user clicks or presses a key during the gesture).

histogram.name: P2P.Client.Canceled.WaitingTimeSeconds
histogram.summary: The wall-clock time spent until a lookup was canceled. This is reported every time p2p is used to find a candidate but the request was canceled.

histogram.name: P2P.Client.Found.CandidateCount
histogram.summary: The number of candidates on the LAN, i.e. the number of peers on the LAN offering at least N bytes of the requested file X. This is reported after examining responses from all peers on the LAN and picking a candidate.

histogram.name: P2P.Client.Found.ConnectionCount
histogram.summary: The number of p2p downloads of the peer that the returned URL points to. This is reported after examining responses from all peers on the LAN and picking a candidate.

histogram.name: P2P.Client.Found.WaitingTimeSeconds
histogram.summary: The wall-clock time spent waiting for the LAN-wide number of p2p downloads (i.e. the sum of p2p downloads from each peer on the LAN) to drop below the threshold. This is reported after examining responses from all peers on the LAN and picking a candidate.

histogram.name: P2P.Client.LookupResult
histogram.summary: The result of the lookup. Possible values include "Found" (if a candidate - i.e. a peer offering at least N bytes of file X - was chosen), "Not Found" (if no candidate could be found), "Vanished" (if a candidate was found but vanished while waiting in line), "Canceled" (if a candidate was found but the request was canceled while waiting in line), and "Filtered" (if it was detected that mDNS was filtered). This is reported after examining responses from all peers on the LAN when p2p is used to find a candidate.

histogram.name: P2P.Client.NumPeers
histogram.summary: The number of peers implementing p2p file sharing on the network. This is reported every time p2p is used to look up a resource on a network where mDNS is not filtered.

histogram.name: P2P.Client.Vanished.WaitingTimeSeconds
histogram.summary: The wall-clock time spent waiting for one or more candidates (i.e. peers offering at least N bytes of file X) that all vanished before the LAN-wide number of p2p downloads dropped below the threshold. This is reported every time candidates were found using p2p but then vanished.

histogram.name: P2P.Server.ClientCount
histogram.summary: The number of currently connected HTTP clients. This is reported every time a HTTP client connects.

histogram.name: P2P.Server.ContentServedInterruptedMB
histogram.summary: Number of megabytes (1,000,000 bytes) served from the device (via HTTP) where the client disconnects prematurely. This is reported every time a file is served and the client disconnects before receiving all data.

histogram.name: P2P.Server.ContentServedSuccessfullyMB
histogram.summary: Number of megabytes (1,000,000 bytes) served from the device (via HTTP). This is reported every time a file have been served successfully.

histogram.name: P2P.Server.DownloadSpeedKBps
histogram.summary: The average speed at which the download was served at, in kB/s. This is reported every time a file have been served successfully.

histogram.name: P2P.Server.FileCount
histogram.summary: The number of files available via p2p. This is reported every time a file is added or removed to the /var/cache/p2p directory.

histogram.name: P2P.Server.RangeBeginPercentage
histogram.summary: When a client resumes a download, the HTTP request includes range specifier to skip the bytes it already has. This metric conveys this as a percentage of the file size. This is reported every time a file is served, even if the request does not include a range specifier (in which case 0 is reported).

histogram.name: P2P.Server.RequestResult
histogram.summary: The result of the HTTP request. Possible values include "Response Sent" (the resource was found and the response was successfully sent), "Response Interrupted" (the resource was found but the client disconnected), "Malformed" (the request was malformed), "Not Found" (the request was for a resource that was not found), and "Index" (the request was for the '/' or '/index.html' resource). This is reported for every HTTP request handled.

histogram.name: PageActionController.ExtensionsWithPageActions
histogram.summary: The number of Extensions that have Page Actions. Measured once per startup per profile.

histogram.name: PasswordBubble.DisplayDisposition
histogram.summary: When the password management bubble opened, what state was it in?

histogram.name: PasswordGeneration.Event
histogram.summary:
Measures the frequency of various password generation events.
Note that this histogram is logged from the renderer process, and consequently the numbers should not be directly compared to the other PasswordGeneration.* histograms, which are logged from the browser process. Histograms logged in different processes are lost at different rates, which introduces systematic bias between histograms logged in the renderer process vs. those logged in the browser process.

histogram.name: PasswordGeneration.SubmissionEvent
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of submission events for generated passwords. This is similar to PasswordManager.ActionsTakenWithPsl but only tracks events which are interesting for generated passwords.

histogram.name: PasswordGeneration.UploadStarted
histogram.summary: The number of times that we try to upload a form that we believe should trigger password generation. False means that something about the form would not allow us to try upload (not an Autofillable field, uploading disabled, Autofill servers in backoff, etc.). True does not mean that the upload actually completed successfully, just that it was started.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountsPerSite
histogram.summary: The number of accounts stored per site in the password manager (one event per site)

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ActionsTaken
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Chrome 32. See PasswordManagerActionsTakenWithPsl
histogram.summary: Stats documenting how we handle every form containing a password, bucketed by the actions taken.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ActionsTakenV3
histogram.summary: Stats documenting how we handle every form containing a password, bucketed by the actions taken.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ActionsTakenWithPsl
histogram.summary: Stats documenting how we handle every form containing a password, bucketed by the actions taken.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BlacklistedSites
histogram.summary: The total number of sites that the user has blacklisted. Recorded by iterating over stored passwords once per run of Chrome.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.Enabled
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the password manager is enabled when a tab is opened. This includes prerendered tabs.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.InfoBarResponse
histogram.summary: The distribution of responses to the "Do you want Chrome to remember this password"? info bar prompt.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.NumPasswordsDeletedByBulkDelete
histogram.summary: Number of passwords deleted when the user chooses to clear passwords via the clear browsing data UI.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.NumPasswordsDeletedWhenBlacklisting
histogram.summary: When the user chooses to never remember passwords for a form, we remove all previously saved credentials for that form. This is the count of those credentials.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.NumPasswordsNotShown
histogram.summary: The password manager only shows those credentials that are considered the best match for a particular form. This stat keep track of the credentials that were not as good of a match and were suppressed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.OsPasswordStatus
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the user's OS password is blank or not at browser startup.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.OtherPossibleUsernamesUsage
histogram.summary: Breakdown of how other possible usernames are displayed. Recorded every time we autofill a password form.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ProvisionalSaveFailure
histogram.summary: Breakdown of cases where a password is submitted, but we don't even try and save it. Recorded for every password form submit.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PslDomainMatchTriggering
histogram.summary: Breakdown on trigger rate of providing a password form autofill entry based on matching stored information using the public suffix list for possible matches.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SavePasswordPromptDisappearedQuickly
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the save password prompt disappeared in less than one second. This most likely indicates that the prompt was dismissed automatically, e.g. due to a page navigation, before the user was able to respond to the infobar.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SavePasswordPromptDisplayed
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the save password prompt was displayed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SavePasswordPromptResponse
histogram.summary: Breakdown of which response the user selected from the save password prompt.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SyncingAccountState
histogram.summary: Information about the user's current sync status crossed with whether their synced password is saved.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TimesGeneratedPasswordUsed
histogram.summary: The number of times each generated password has been used to log in. Recorded by iterating over stored passwords once per run. This information is persisted and synced.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TimesPasswordUsed
histogram.summary: The number of times each saved password has been used to log in. Does not include generated passwords. Recorded by iterating over stored passwords once per run. This information is persisted and synced.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TotalAccounts
histogram.summary: The number of accounts stored in the password manager (across all sites)

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UIDismissalReason
histogram.summary: Why was the password manager's UI (bubble or infobar) closed?

histogram.name: Pepper.InterfaceUsed
histogram.summary: The number of out-of-process plugin processes that have loaded a particular PPB interface version.

histogram.name: PerformanceMonitor.AverageCPU
histogram.summary: Average CPU utilization of a process, read out at each two-minute interval. The utilization is in the 0-100% range per CPU, which is then summed up. I.e. a quadcore system fully loaded would read as 400%.

histogram.name: PerformanceMonitor.HighCPU
histogram.summary: The number of times a process has continuously stayed above a certain threshold of CPU utilization over a certain time period (currently set to two minutes).

histogram.name: Platform.AsvGroup
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS (ARM Chromebooks using Exynos 5250 only) Adaptive Support Voltage Group, recorded once per bootup. Indicates which "bin" the SoC is part of, which sets the voltage that different rails on the system will run at. The values 0-11 are valid. A value of 12 indicates an error parsing dmesg and should be investigated. See also Platform.LotIdEnum.

histogram.name: Platform.BootSectorsRead
histogram.summary: Chrome OS number of disk sectors read at boot from kernel start to login-prompt-ready.

histogram.name: Platform.BootSectorsWritten
histogram.summary: Chrome OS number of disk sectors written at boot from kernel start to login-prompt-ready.

histogram.name: Platform.CompressedSwapSize
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of allocated swap area in megabytes (before compression)

histogram.name: Platform.CpuFrequencyThermalScaling
histogram.summary: CPU frequency as percent of the baseline frequency, sampled every 30s. This may be throttled down from 100% due to power dissipation issues (too high temperature). It may also be throttled up (turbo), but the kernel does not report the actual turbo frequency, so we put such samples in the 101% bucket.

histogram.name: Platform.CpuUsage
histogram.summary: Peak total (single core) CPU usage for the last sample interval. The sample interval may vary from seconds to several minutes.

histogram.name: Platform.CrOSEvent
histogram.summary: Generic event of interest from Chrome OS. Intended mainly to help assess the frequency of rare error conditions.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.Cache_Avg
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Average size of user's Cache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.Cache_Max
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Maximum size of user's Cache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.Downloads_Avg
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Average size of user's Cache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.Downloads_Max
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Maximum size of user's Cache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.GCache_Avg
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Average size of user's GCache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.GCache_Max
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Maximum size of user's GCache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.LeastUsedAccountDays
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Days since the least frequently used account signed in. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.NumUserHomeDirectories
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of users home directories on the device. Logged once a day.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.OldestUserOnDevice
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Days since last login of the least recently user on device. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.UsersOnDevice
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of user home dirs on device. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsageCache
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: KB in use in the /cache filesystem tree. Logged once a day.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsageChronos
histogram.summary: Chrome OS KB in use in the /home/chronos filesystem tree. Logged once a day during log file cleanup.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsageData
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: KB in use in the /data filesystem tree. Logged once a day.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsageVar
histogram.summary: Chrome OS KB in use in the /var filesystem tree. Logged once a day during log file cleanup.

histogram.name: Platform.IntelMaxMicroArchitecture
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The maximum supported micro-architecture on an Intel platform. This value is logged at program start time.

histogram.name: Platform.KernelWarningHashes
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The 32-bit hash of a kernel warning. This is the hash of the "file:line" string corresponding to the location of the warning, for instance: "/mnt/host/source/src/third_party/kernel/files/drivers /gpu/drm/i915/intel_dp.c:351" (ignore spurious spaces). The hash is produced by this code: while (*string) hash = (hash << 5) + hash + *string++; Separately each warning is also collected (with its hash) via the crash reporter, but only its first occurrence in each boot session. Contact semenzato@ for further info.

histogram.name: Platform.LogicalCpuCount
histogram.summary: Number of logical processors. This includes Hyperthreaded cores.

histogram.name: Platform.LotIdEnum
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS (ARM Chromebooks using Exynos 5250 only) indication about whether we're part of a special lot ID. Special lot IDs are groups of chips that have special case handling in the kernel for the Adaptive Support Voltage code (the normal logic doesn't work). See also Platform.AsvGroup. Note that fused devices are never part of a special lot (currently) and only some unfused lots are "special".

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoActive
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of active memory as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoActiveAnon
histogram.summary: Chrome OS active anonymous memory (data segments) as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoActiveFile
histogram.summary: Chrome OS active file-backed memory (executables, ...) as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoAnonPages
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of anonymous memory as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoBuffers
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of buffer cache as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoCached
histogram.summary: Chrome OS: size of file-backed memory minus swap and buffer cache, as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoInactive
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of inactive memory as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoInactiveAnon
histogram.summary: Chrome OS inactive anonymous memory (data segments) as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoInactiveFile
histogram.summary: Chrome OS inactive file-backed memory as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoMapped
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of mapped memory as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoMemFree
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of free memory as % of total memory.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoShmem
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of shared memory in Kbytes.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoSlab
histogram.summary: Chrome OS size of slab memory in Kbytes.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoSwapUsed
histogram.summary: Chrome OS amount of swapped-out memory in Kbytes. These, and all other MEMINFO stats, are snapshotted every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoSwapUsedPercent
histogram.summary: Chrome OS amount of swapped-out memory as % of total RAM. These, and all other MEMINFO stats, are snapshotted every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.MeminfoUnevictable
histogram.summary: Chrome OS unevictable memory (ramfs, SHM_LOCKED, mlocked) in Kbytes.

histogram.name: Platform.MemoryBandwidth.ReadWrite
histogram.summary: Peak memory bandwith (read and write) usage during the last sample interval. The sample interval may vary from seconds to several minutes.

histogram.name: Platform.MemuseAnon0
histogram.summary: Chrome OS total anonymous memory (active + inactive) as % of total memory 1 minute after boot.

histogram.name: Platform.MemuseAnon1
histogram.summary: Chrome OS total anonymous memory (active + inactive) as % of total memory 5 minutes after boot.

histogram.name: Platform.MemuseAnon2
histogram.summary: Chrome OS total anonymous memory (active + inactive) as % of total memory 30 minutes after boot.

histogram.name: Platform.MemuseAnon3
histogram.summary: Chrome OS total anonymous memory (active + inactive) as % of total memory 150 minutes after boot.

histogram.name: Platform.MemuseAnon4
histogram.summary: Chrome OS total anonymous memory (active + inactive) as % of total memory 750 minutes after boot.

histogram.name: Platform.PageFaultsLong
histogram.summary: Page faults per second averaged over 30s interval, sampled continuously.

histogram.name: Platform.PageFaultsShort
histogram.summary: Page faults per second averaged over 1s interval, sampled every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.ReadSectorsLong
histogram.summary: Number of disk sectors per second read by Chrome OS in a long interval (currently 30s)

histogram.name: Platform.ReadSectorsShort
histogram.summary: Number of disk sectors per second read by Chrome OS in a short interval (currently 1s, sampled every 30s)

histogram.name: Platform.SmartTransferErrors
histogram.summary: Disk communication errors (SMART 199), sent at boot.

histogram.name: Platform.SmartUncorrectableErrors
histogram.summary: Uncorrectable disk errors (SMART 187), sent at boot.

histogram.name: Platform.SpringChargerType
histogram.summary:
USB device ID of the charger plugged into a Spring device (if any), sent once a minute. The Device ID is composed from the following 4 8-bit registers of the TSU6721 chip: ADC (07h), Device Type 3 (15h), Device Type 2 (0Bh), Device Type 1 (0Ah). Device Type 1/2/3 is a bitmap and most of bits are mutually exclusive (excepted VBUS debounce). ADC is the 5-bit value of the ID pin, but for most types (as in Device Type), there are only one or two possible ID pin connections/values. The datasheet can be found here: http://www.ti.com/lit/ds/symlink/tsu6721.pdf.
Note that different brand/models of the charger can have the same ID.

histogram.name: Platform.StatefulUsage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS stateful partition usage level.

histogram.name: Platform.Storage.Flash.BadBlocks
histogram.summary: The number of blocks marked bad in an MTD partition. This is relevant for devices with raw NAND flash, such as Chromecast. Sampled once daily, if the Chromecast is on for any significant length of time in the day.

histogram.name: Platform.SwapInLong
histogram.summary: Average pages/second swapped IN over a 30s interval, sampled every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.SwapInShort
histogram.summary: Average pages/second swapped IN over a 1s interval, sampled every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.TPM.DictionaryAttackCounter
histogram.summary: Each sample is the value of the TPM dictionary attack counter during startup. Any non-zero value is unexpected.

histogram.name: Platform.TPMForcedReboot
histogram.summary: Each sample is the number of consecutive reboots performed while attempting to clear a TPM (Trusted Platform Module) error.

histogram.name: Platform.Tps65090Retries
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Retries needed to enable a FET on tps65090 (AKA tpschrome). Tps65090 is a power management unit (PMU) used on many ARM Chromebooks. Until version ES7 was rolled into production we would sometimes run into a problem where FET1 (the FET used to switch on and off the backlight) wouldn't turn on properly. This problem was especially prevalent when the voltage was high (like when the device was plugged into the wall). Retrying by turning the FET off and on again is nearly always effective, so the kernel will retry up to 5 times (currently) and will also log the fact that it needed to retry. On newest kernels (kernel 3.8 and up) a kernel warning will be logged with WARN_ON if the FET still failed to turn on after 5 tries. Refer to the kernel warning reports to find that information. For more details about this bug refer to http://crbug.com/338657 and http://crosbug.com/p/16009. Note that we log retries on all 7 FETs even though we've only ever seen failures of FET1.

histogram.name: Platform.WriteSectorsLong
histogram.summary: Number of disk sectors per second written by Chrome OS in a long interval (currently 30s)

histogram.name: Platform.WriteSectorsShort
histogram.summary: Number of disk sectors per second written by Chrome OS in a short interval (currently 1s, sampled every 30s)

histogram.name: Platform.ZramCompressedSize
histogram.summary: Compressed swap size in megabytes. This is the actual amount of RAM used by the system to compress memory (i.e. after compression). Snapshot every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.ZramCompressionRatioPercent
histogram.summary: The ratio of compressed memory (zram) before and after compression when the denominator at least 1 MB. Ratios of interest are between 1 and 6 (typically between 2 and 3), and we express them as a percentage (between 100% and 600%). The size of memory before compression includes zero-filled pages. Values close to 100% indicate low compression effectiveness. Snapshot every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.ZramSavings
histogram.summary: RAM savings in megabytes from using memory compression. This is the difference between the RAM size before and after compression. Snapshot every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.ZramZeroPages
histogram.summary: Number of zero-filled pages that the OS is compressing. A large number suggests wasteful allocation. Snapshot every 30s.

histogram.name: Platform.ZramZeroRatioPercent
histogram.summary: The fraction of compressed memory that consists of zero-filled pages. Snapshot every 30s.

histogram.name: PLT.BeginToFirstPaint
histogram.summary: Time from "begin" to "first paint." "Begin"== "request" if user requested, and "start" otherwise. "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "First paint"== time when first paint operation was performed.

histogram.name: PLT.BeginToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.summary: Time from "big" to "first paint after load." "Begin"== "request" if user requested, and "start" otherwise. "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: PLT.CommitToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "finish." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: PLT.CommitToFinishDoc
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "finish doc." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "Finish doc" == main document loaded, before onload(). "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: PLT.CommitToFirstPaint
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "first paint." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "First paint"== time when first paint operation was performed.

histogram.name: PLT.CommitToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "first paint after load." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: PLT.FinishDocToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "finish doc" to "finish." "Finish doc"== main document loaded, before onload(). "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: PLT.FinishToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "finish " to "first paint after load." "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.summary: Time from domanLookupEnd to connectStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeDomainLookup
histogram.summary: Time from fetchStart to domainLookupStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeDomLoading
histogram.summary: Time from responseStart to domLoading based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeFetch
histogram.summary: Time from navigationStart to fetchStart based on Navigation Timing when no redirect.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeFetchRedirect
histogram.summary: Time from navigationStart to fetchStart excluding time spent on redirects based on Navigation Timing. Only page loads with redirects are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeLoadEvent
histogram.summary: Time from domContentLoadedEventEnd to loadEventStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeRequest
histogram.summary: Time from connectEnd to requestStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DomainLookup
histogram.summary: Time from domainLookupStart to domainLookupEnd based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DomContentLoaded
histogram.summary: Time from domContentLoadedEventStart to domContentLoadedEventEnd based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DomInteractive
histogram.summary: Time from domInteractive to domContentLoadEventStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DomLoading
histogram.summary: Time from domLoading to domInteractive based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_LoadEvent
histogram.summary: Time from loadEventStart to loadEventEnd based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_Redirect
histogram.summary: Time from redirectStart to redirectEnd based on Navigation Timing when redirects exist.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_Request
histogram.summary: Time from requestStart to responseStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_Response
histogram.summary: Time from responseStart to responseEnd based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.PageUsed_PrerenderLoad
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Distribution of discarded and displayed prerendered pages.

histogram.name: PLT.PerceivedLoadTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/02/2011, replaced by Prerender.RendererPLT.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Perceived load time of a page. For non-prerendered pages, this is just BeginToFinish. For displayed prerendered pages, this is the time from when the prerendered page is moved into a TabContents until finish. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded. Note that this is 0 if the loading finishes before the page is moved into a TabContents.

histogram.name: PLT.PerceivedLoadTime_PrerenderLoad
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/02/2011, replaced by Prerender.RendererPerceivedPLTMatched.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Perceived load time of a prerendered page that is displayed. This is the time from when the prerendered page is moved into a TabContents until finish. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded. Note that this is 0 if the loading finishes before the page is moved into a TabContents.

histogram.name: PLT.Prerender_TimeUntilDisplay
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/02/2011, replaced by Prerender.RendererTimeUntilDisplay.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between when the prerendering of a page starts and when the page is displayed. Prerendered pages discarded without being displayed are excluded from this count.

histogram.name: PLT.PrerenderIdleTime
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/02/2011, replaced by Prerender.RendererIdleTime.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This is the time from when a prerendered page finishes loading to when it is displayed. When a page is displayed before it finishes loading, no value is recorded in this histogram.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToCommit
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToCommit. Commit: responseStart. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToCommit_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToCommit. Commit: responseStart. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToFinish
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToFinish. Finish: loadEventEnd. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToFinish_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToFinish_SpdyProxy. Finish: loadEventEnd. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToFinishDoc. FinishDoc: loadEventStart. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToFinishDoc_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToFinishDoc_SpdyProxy. FinishDoc: loadEventStart. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_CommitToFinish
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.CommitToFinish. Commit: responseStart. Finish: loadEventEnd.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_CommitToFinish_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.CommitToFinish. Commit: responseStart. Finish: loadEventEnd. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_CommitToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.CommitToFinishDoc. Commit: responseStart. FinishDoc: loadEventStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_CommitToFinishDoc_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.CommitToFinishDoc. Commit: responseStart. FinishDoc: loadEventStart. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_FinishDocToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.FinishDocToFinish. Finish: loadEventEnd. FinishDoc: loadEventStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_FinishDocToFinish_DataReductionProxy
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.FinishDocToFinish. Finish: loadEventEnd. FinishDoc: loadEventStart. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToCommit
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and measures the time until the renderer got first byte of document. Commit: time when renderer got first byte of document. Request: navigationStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToDomContentLoaded
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and measures the time until the beginning of the DOMContentLoaded event. DOMContentLoaded: domContentLoadedEventStart. Request: navigationStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToFinish
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.RequestToFinish. Finish: loadEventEnd. Request: navigationStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToFinish_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.RequestToFinish. Finish: loadEventEnd. Request: navigationStart. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and measures the page load time until the beginning of the load event. Finish: loadEventStart. Request: navigationStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToStart
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.RequestToStart. Start: requestStart. Request: navigationStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToStart_DataReductionProxy
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.RequestToStart. Start: requestStart. Request: navigationStart. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_StartToCommit
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.StartToCommit. Start: requestStart. Commit: responseStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_StartToCommit_DataReductionProxy
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.StartToCommit. Start: requestStart. Commit: responseStart. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_StartToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.StartToFinish. Start: requestStart. Finish: loadEventEnd.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_StartToFinish_DataReductionProxy
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.StartToFinish. Start: requestStart. Finish: loadEventEnd. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.RequestToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "request" to "finish." "Request" == time when user requested document. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: PLT.RequestToStart
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "request" to "start." "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToCommit
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "start" to "commit." "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "start" to "finish." "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToFinish.NoProxy.http
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: StartToFinish times when using http and no proxy.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToFinish.NoProxy.https
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: StartToFinish times when using https and no proxy.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToFinish.Proxy.http
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: StartToFinish times when using http over a proxy.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToFinish.Proxy.https
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: StartToFinish times when using https over a proxy.

histogram.name: PLT.UserTiming_Mark
histogram.summary: This time is based on the User Timing spec and measures the time from Navigation Timing navigationStart until the point where the page called performance.mark().

histogram.name: PLT.UserTiming_MeasureDuration
histogram.summary: This time is based on the User Timing spec and reports the time between two arbitrary points defined by the page being loaded and directly matches the measurement exposed by performance.measure().

histogram.name: Plugin.AvailabilityStatus.WidevineCdm
histogram.summary: The availability status of Widevine CDM. In normal cases, this is reported per render process if EME API is used. This is not reported if EME API is not used. This could be reported multiple times per render process until PLUGIN_AVAILABLE is reported (which should be a rare case).

histogram.name: Plugin.FlashNavigateUsage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Record usage of PPB_Flash.Navigate() Pepper API.

histogram.name: Plugin.PpapiBrokerLoadErrorCode
histogram.summary: The error code of a PPAPI broker load failure.

histogram.name: Plugin.PpapiBrokerLoadResult
histogram.summary: The result from an attempt to load a PPAPI broker.

histogram.name: Plugin.PpapiPluginLoadErrorCode
histogram.summary: The error code of a PPAPI plugin load failure.

histogram.name: Plugin.PpapiPluginLoadResult
histogram.summary: The result from an attempt to load a PPAPI plugin.

histogram.name: Power.BacklightLevelOnAC
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The level of the backlight as a percentage when the user is on AC. Sampled every 30 seconds.

histogram.name: Power.BacklightLevelOnBattery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The level of the backlight as a percentage when the user is on battery. Sampled every 30 seconds.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryChargeHealth
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS battery charge health percentage. Sampled once when device starts charging.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryDischargeRate
histogram.summary: Chrome OS battery discharge rate in mW sampled every 30 seconds while the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryDischargeRateWhileSuspended
histogram.summary: Chrome OS battery discharge rate in mW while the system was suspended, sampled at resume. Only reported if the system was on battery power both before suspending and after resuming, if the energy level didn't increase while suspended (which would indicate that an AC adapter was connected), and if the system was suspended for at least a minute.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryInfoSample
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times we have read the battery status from sysfs and if it gave us sensible values.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingAtEndOfSessionOnAC
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge, sampled at the end of a user session when the device is on AC.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingAtEndOfSessionOnBattery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge, sampled at the end of a user session when the device is on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingAtStartOfSessionOnAC
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge, sampled at the start of a user session when the device is on AC.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingAtStartOfSessionOnBattery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge, sampled at the start of a user session when the device is on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingCharge
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 03/2012, no longer being generated by powerd.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge sampled when the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingWhenChargeStarts
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge, sampled when charging starts.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryTimeToEmpty
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 03/2012, no longer being generated by powerd.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining time to empty battery in minutes sampled when the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BitfixChunks
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS (Snow RO firmware 2695.90.0 only) number of 8K chunks that were fixed (memory corruption corrected) for each suspend/resume cycle. Expect 0 around 97% of the time and a non-zero value around 3% of the time.

histogram.name: Power.BitfixFixes
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS (Snow RO firmware 2695.90.0 only) number of 4-byte words that were fixed (memory corruption corrected) for each suspend/resume cycle. Expect 0 around 97% of the time and a non-zero value around 3% of the time. Would be exactly equal to Power.BitfixChunks if there were only one corrupted word in each chunk but is sometimes several times higher.

histogram.name: Power.BrightnessAdjustOnAC
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/2013. See Accel_BrightnessDown_F6 and Accel_BrightnessUp_F7 user actions instead.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of times the user has adjusted brightness up and down while running on battery power.

histogram.name: Power.BrightnessAdjustOnBattery
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 5/2013. See Accel_BrightnessDown_F6 and Accel_BrightnessUp_F7 user actions instead.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of times the user has adjusted brightness up and down while running on AC power.

histogram.name: Power.ChargerType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: External power supply type such as MAINS_CHARGER, USB_CHARGER, UNCONFIRMED_SPRING_CHARGER, SAFE_SPRING_CHARGER. A sample is reported each time a charger is connected to the device.

histogram.name: Power.ExternalBrightnessReadResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to read an external display's brightness on Chrome OS. A read attempt is made after successfully requesting the brightness (see Power.ExternalBrightnessRequestResult).

histogram.name: Power.ExternalBrightnessRequestResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The result of requesting an external display's brightness on Chrome OS. A request is sent when the user presses a brightness key and the current brightness is not already cached. A successful request is followed shortly thereafter by a read attempt (see Power.ExternalBrightnessReadResult).

histogram.name: Power.ExternalBrightnessWriteResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to change an external display's brightness on Chrome OS. A request is sent when the user presses a brightness key and the current brightness is either already cached or successfully loaded.

histogram.name: Power.ExternalDisplayOpenResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to open an I2C device to control an external display's brightness on Chrome OS. An attempt is made when a display is connected to a device that lacks an internal display.

histogram.name: Power.FirmwareResumeTimeOnAC
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time that the firmware took to resume the Chrome OS device from suspend-to-RAM state when running on AC at pre-suspend time.

histogram.name: Power.FirmwareResumeTimeOnBattery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time that the firmware took to resume the Chrome OS device from suspend-to-RAM state when running on battery at pre-suspend time.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeAfterDimOnAC
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time since the screen dimmed sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on AC.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeAfterDimOnBattery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time since the screen dimmed sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeAfterScreenOffOnAC
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time since the screen turned off sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on AC.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeAfterScreenOffOnBattery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time since the screen turned off sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeOnAC
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on AC.

histogram.name: Power.IdleTimeOnBattery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS user idle time sampled when the user becomes active again if the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.KernelResumeTimeOnAC
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time that the kernel took to resume the Chrome OS device from suspend-to-RAM state when running on AC at pre-suspend time.

histogram.name: Power.KernelResumeTimeOnBattery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time that the kernel took to resume the Chrome OS device from suspend-to-RAM state when running on battery at pre-suspend time.

histogram.name: Power.KernelSuspendTimeOnAC
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time that the kernel took to suspend-to-RAM the Chrome OS device when running on AC.

histogram.name: Power.KernelSuspendTimeOnBattery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time that the kernel took to suspend-to-RAM the Chrome OS device when running on battery.

histogram.name: Power.KeyboardBacklightLevel
histogram.summary: The level of the keyboard backlight as a percentage. Sampled every 30 seconds.

histogram.name: Power.LengthOfSession
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The length of time, in seconds, that a user spent in a single session. Values for this metric are clamped to 12 hours, so the last bucket should be considered to be including all metrics above 12 hours.

histogram.name: Power.MilliConsumptionPerHourIosOnActive
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
