histogram.name: SB2.FormatEvent
histogram.summary: Collection of boolean events for SafeBrowsingFileStore instances. Includes corruptions detected, old versions detected, and various failures detected.

histogram.name: SB2.GetHash200
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of SB2.GetHashResult STATUS_200.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of GetHash requests that returned data (valid requests).

histogram.name: SB2.GetHash204
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of SB2.GetHashResult STATUS_204.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of GetHash requests that returned empty data (false positives).

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashResult
histogram.summary: Track return status from GetHash attempts (STATUS_200, STATUS_204, NETWORK_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, BACKOFF_ERROR), whether parsing a 200 result failed (PARSE_ERROR), and dispensation of returned values (EMPTY, HIT, MISS). EMPTY means the response had no full hashes, and should contain all of the 204 responses plus all *_ERROR cases. HIT means that one of the full hashes matched. MISS means that none of the hashes matched (there was a prefix collision). (PARSE_ERROR, NETWORK_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, and BACKOFF_ERROR were added in M36.)

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashResultDownload
histogram.summary: Track return status from GetHash attempts (STATUS_200, STATUS_204, NETWORK_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, BACKOFF_ERROR), whether parsing a 200 result failed (PARSE_ERROR), and dispensation of returned values (EMPTY, HIT, MISS). EMPTY means the response had no full hashes, and should contain all of the 204 responses plus all *_ERROR cases. HIT means that one of the full hashes matched. MISS means that none of the hashes matched (there was a prefix collision). (PARSE_ERROR, NETWORK_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, and BACKOFF_ERROR were added in M36.)

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashServerMiss
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in favor of SB2.GetHashResult FULL_HASH_* and SB2.BloomFilterFalsePositives. It is unclear if this histogram ever reported useful data.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of GetHash requests returning full hashes that didn't match the URL that initiated the request.

histogram.name: SB2.HandleCorrupt
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of the number of times a database was found corrupt and reset.

histogram.name: SB2.InterstitialAction
histogram.summary: Track number of times Safe Browsing interstitials have been shown, and how many times they have been clicked through or not.

histogram.name: SB2.InterstitialActionDetails
histogram.summary: Tracks the click-through rate for specific cases of the interstitial.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeClosed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user navigating away by for example, closing the tab, clicking the browser back button or typing another URL in the address bar.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeDiagnostic
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on diagnostic page link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeExpandedSeeMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user expanding the "see more info" section of the page. (Only applies to field trial version 2 of the interstitial.)

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeLearnMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the learn more about malware link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimePrivacyPolicy
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the privacy policy link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeProceed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the proceed link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeTakeMeBack
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the big green back button.

histogram.name: SB2.Network
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time that it took to receive a response from the Google SafeBrowsing servers for a GetHash request.

histogram.name: SB2.OldDatabaseKilobytes
histogram.summary: Size of v1 database deleted from client profile.

histogram.name: SB2.OutShardShifts
histogram.summary: Indicates how sharded safe-browsing on-disk stores are. Values like 0 to 4 are reasonable.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeClosed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user navigating away by for example, closing the tab, clicking the browser back button or typing another URL in the address bar.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeExpandedSeeMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user expanding the "see more info" section of the page. (Only applies to field trial version 2 of the interstitial.)

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeLearnMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the learn more link.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeProceed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the proceed link.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeReportError
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the report error link.

histogram.name: SB2.PhishingInterstitialTimeTakeMeBack
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing phishing interstitial and the user clicking on the big green back button.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetBitsPerPrefix
histogram.summary: The size of the PrefixSet storage in bits, divided by the number of prefixes represented. Should almost always be 16.

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records how well the PrefixSet implementation matches the BloomFilter implementation.

histogram.summary: The size of the PrefixSet file in kilobytes.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetLoad
histogram.summary: Time to load the PrefixSet file.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetRestoredExcess

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetRestoredShortfall

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedDelta
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedDifference
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedPercent

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. Size of unsorted sets. To see if there is a problem with a particular size of dataset.

histogram.summary: Time to store the PrefixSet file.

histogram.summary: Tracks changes to the Safe Browsing extended reporting opt-in which is shown in the Safe Browsing interstitial.

histogram.name: SB2.SetReportingEnabled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Tracks changes to the Safe Browsing extended reporting opt-in which is shown in the Safe Browsing interstitial.

histogram.summary: The size of the Side Effect Free Whitelist SaafeBrowsing database file on disk in kilobytes, after an update has occurred.

histogram.summary: The size of the Side Effect Free Whitelist PrefixSet file in kilobytes, after an udpate has occurred.

histogram.summary: Time to load the Side Effect Free Whitelist PrefixSet file.

histogram.summary: Time to store the Side Effect Free Whitelist PrefixSet file.

histogram.summary: The instantiation status of the SideEffectFreeWhitelist.

histogram.name: SB2.StoreVersionRead
histogram.summary: Version read from the store file.

histogram.summary: The time from the receipt of the update request to the receipt of the final update chunk.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateRequestSize

histogram.name: SB2.VolunteerPrefixesRemoved
histogram.summary: Older versions of the safe-browsing code incorrectly added additional SBPrefix items when receiving full hashes. This caused errors when calculating when to send gethash requests to the server. An additional pass over the data has been added to remove the excess prefixes. This histogram tracks progress of that code for purposes of informing a decision on when to remove the additional pass. See http://crbug.com/361248 .

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.CheckDownloadStats
histogram.summary: Records a histogram of the reason why downloads are marked as being malicious or clean by the improved SafeBrowsing binary download protection.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadExtensions
histogram.summary: Records a histogram of how often users download a file with a file extension that is possibly dangerous (e.g., exe, class).

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestDuration
histogram.summary: Records the total time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to check whether the content of a download is malicious or not, including file feature extraction, whitelist checking, and server ping. This histogram only includes checks that sent a ping to the SafeBrowsing server. It does not include requests that were cancelled, but does include requests that received a bad response.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestNetError
histogram.summary: The net error code for all CheckClientDownloadRequest URLFetchers.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestNetworkDuration
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service ping. It is not recorded for requests that were cancelled.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestNetworkStats
histogram.summary: Records the results of SafeBrowsing binary download checks which caused a server ping.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestPayloadSize
histogram.summary: The size of the upload data for CheckClientDownloadRequest URLFetchers.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestResponseCode
histogram.summary: For CheckClientDownloadRequest URLFetchers with successful status, the HTTP response code that was received.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestTimeoutDuration
histogram.summary: Records the portion of the SafeBrowsing download service check starting with the point CheckClientDownloadRequest::StartTimeout() is called. It is recorded regardless if a ping was sent or not. It is not recorded for requests that were cancelled.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestTimeoutStats
histogram.summary: For SafeBrowsing binary download checks which reached the CheckClientDownloadRequest::StartTimeout() call, records the final result (once the check finishes or is cancelled).

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ExtractImageHeadersTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to extract image headers from a downloaded binary.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ExtractSignatureFeaturesTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to extract signature info from a downloaded binary. This includes both unsigned and signed binaries.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ExtractZipFeaturesTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to extract info from a downloaded zip file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.SignedBinaryDownload
histogram.summary: Records the number of signed vs. unsigned executables that are downloaded.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.SignedOrWhitelistedDownload
histogram.summary: Counter which is incremented whenever an executable is downloaded which is either signed or whose URL matches the download whitelist.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ZipFileHasArchiveButNoExecutable
histogram.summary: For each zip file analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service, records true if the zip did not contain any executables but did contain another zip file, false otherwise.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ZipFileHasExecutable
histogram.summary: For each zip file analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service, records if the zip contained an executable file.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.ClassificationStart
histogram.summary: The number of pages that we could have possibly classified (essentially the number of top page navigations by users with SBClientMalware enabled). The name is slightly misleading as it is recorded before "Preclassification" happens.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.IPBlacklistRequestNetError
histogram.summary: The net error code for all ClientMalwareRequest URLFetchers.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.IPBlacklistRequestPayloadSize
histogram.summary: The size of the upload data for ClientMalwareRequest URLFetchers.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.IPBlacklistRequestResponseCode
histogram.summary: For ClientMalwareRequest URLFetchers with successful status, the HTTP response code that was received.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.PreClassificationCheckFail
histogram.summary: Records the number of malware classifications that were skipped because a pre-classification check failed.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.SentReports
histogram.summary: Measures the success rate of sending malware reports. Sending a report can fail due to a client reaching the limit on the number of reports it can send per day or due to the report failing to be serialized.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.UnexpectedPageId
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 03/2014. That part of the code got deleted.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the page ID that completed the page load does not match the browse info page ID. We expect that number to be zero.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.CancelClassificationReason
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The counts for various reasons why an in-progress phishing classification was canceled.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.CheckNoPendingClassificationFailed
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times client-side phishing classifier expected to have no pending classifications running but that check failed.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClassificationStart
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of pages that we could have possibly classified (essentially the number of top page navigations by users with SBClientPhishing enabled). The name is slightly misleading as it is recorded before "Preclassification" happens.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClientModelStatus
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The counts for various model status codes that we get after loading a new client-side phishing model.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureChunkTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time that an individual chunk of DOM feature extraction work took.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureFrameRemoved
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times that DOM feature extraction finished early because the active WebDocument's frame was removed during traversal.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureIterations
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of iterations that the DOM feature extractor took to finish.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureResumeTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time that it took to resume DOM feature extraction for the phishing classifier. Longer times may indicate that the page DOM changed between chunks of work and the extractor had to re-traverse up to the saved position.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureTimeout
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classifications that were aborted because DOM feature extraction took too long.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.DOMFeatureTotalTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time that the DOM feature extarctor took to finish, summed across all chunks of work.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.GrabPhishingThumbnail
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent generating the thumbnail.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.IllegalFeatureValue
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of features which were omitted from phishing classification because they were added with an illegal value. This would indicate a bug.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.InitPrivateNetworksFailed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in Chrome 37, which now uses //net's internal matching.
histogram.summary: The number of times that the phishing detection service could not be initialized due to an error parsing the private IP networks. This would indicate a bug.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.InvalidWhitelistExpression
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 12/2011. Whitelist entries are no longer part of ClientPhishingResponse.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of whitelist_expression entries in a ClientPhishingResponse that could not be canonicalized.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.PreClassificationCheckFail
histogram.summary: Records the number of phishing classifications that were skipped because a pre-classification check failed.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ReportLimitSkipped
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classifications that were previously cached as being phishing but that will get re-classified (to possibly fix false positives).

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.RequestNotSerialized
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classifier pingbacks that were skipped because serializing the request protocol buffer to string failed.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.RequestSatisfiedFromCache
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times that a cached phishing classification result was used, rather than pinging the server.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ScorerCreationStatus
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the status when we create a scorer object for the client-side phishing detection classifier.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureBreakIterError
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classifications that were aborted because the term feature extractor failed to initialize an ICU break iterator.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureChunkTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time that an individual chunk of term feature extraction work took.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureIterations
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of iterations that the term feature extractor took to finish.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureTimeout
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of phishing classification that were aborted because term feature extraction took too long.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TermFeatureTotalTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time that the term feature extarctor took to finish, summed across all chunks of work.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TooManyFeatures
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times that the limit on the number of phishing classifier features for a page was reached. This may indicate a bug, or that kMaxFeatureSize is too small.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.URLFeatureTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time taken to extract URL features for the phishing classifier.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.Activations
histogram.summary: Count of times download feedback has been started, broken down by danger type.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.ActiveFeedbacks
histogram.summary: When a new download feedback request is added, records the number of download requests currently active and/or pending.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.Eligible
histogram.summary: Count of times eligible download notifications are shown. Broken down by danger type.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.Shown
histogram.obsolete: Starting with M32, replaced by SBDownloadFeedback.Eligible.
histogram.summary: Count of times download feedback button has been shown, broken down by danger type.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.SizeEligibleKB
histogram.summary: Size of downloads that were of the correct danger type, regardless if they meet the max file size check or if they are actually uploaded or not.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.SizeFailure
histogram.summary: Size of downloads that failed to be uploaded to the feedback service.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.SizeSuccess
histogram.summary: Size of downloads that were successfully uploaded to the feedback service.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.UploadResult
histogram.summary: Final result of attempt to upload binary to download feedback service.

histogram.name: SBIRS.DroppedIncident
histogram.summary: The type of incident given to the safe browsing incident reporting service but dropped as a result of not participating in safe browsing.

histogram.name: SBIRS.EnvCollectionTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to collect environmental data for a safe browsing incident report.

histogram.name: SBIRS.FindDownloadedBinaryTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to find the most recent binary download from all loaded profiles when creating a safe browsing incident report.

histogram.name: SBIRS.Incident
histogram.summary: The type of incident given to the safe browsing incident reporting service.

histogram.name: SBIRS.IncidentCount
histogram.summary: The number of incidents collated into a single safe browsing incident report before pruning.

histogram.name: SBIRS.InterIncidentTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between two successive incidents collated into the same incident report by the safe browsing incident reporting service.

histogram.name: SBIRS.PruneRatio
histogram.summary: The percentage of incidents pruned from a safe browsing incident report on account of having been previously reported.

histogram.name: SBIRS.ReportPayloadSize
histogram.summary: The size, in bytes, of a safe browsing incident report.

histogram.name: SBIRS.ReportUploadTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to upload a safe browsing incident report.

histogram.name: SBIRS.UploadResult
histogram.summary: The result of an attempted report upload by the safe browsing incident reporting service.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Advertisement_Count
histogram.summary: The number of dictionaries advertised in an HTTP GET transaction that supports SDCH. Note that only non-zero advertisements are logged.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Dictionary size loaded
histogram.summary: Each sample is the byte count for a dictionary that is loaded by Chrome. A dictionary is loaded shortly after the first Google query performed in each session, and allows future SDCH transactions to be encoded/decoded using that dictionary.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment2_Decode
histogram.summary: Duration in time from when a request was made, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of an SDCH encoded transmission made after the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment2_Holdback
histogram.summary: Duration in time from when a request was made, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment3_Decode
histogram.summary: Duration in time from the first byte of a request was received, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of an SDCH encoded transmission made after the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment3_Holdback
histogram.summary: Duration in time from the first byte of a request was received, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Decode
histogram.summary: Duration in time from when a request was made, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of an SDCH encoded transmission made after the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback
histogram.summary: Duration in time from when a request was made, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback_1st_To_2nd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 1st **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 2nd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback_1st_To_Last_a
histogram.summary: The duration between receipt of the 1st holdback (non-SDCH encoded) packet and receipt of the last packet. Only groups that are part of the holdback (i.e., could have been sdch encoded) are sampled.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback_2nd_To_3rd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 2nd **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 3rd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback_3rd_To_4th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 3rd **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 4th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback_4th_To_5th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 4th **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 5th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.FilterUseBeforeDisabling
histogram.summary: If SDCH decoding was disabled client side, this records how many URLs were processed by the SDCH filter before disabling this feature. The most common number is 1, which happens when there is one home-page tab that contains SDCH encoded data, for which there is no dictionary loaded into the Chrome process (yet), since Chrome was just restarted. Large values in this histogram are indicative of flaky decompression, that works for a while, and then is disabled. Values of 2 or 3 may appear if a user has more than one home page with a query, and restarts there browser.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_1st_To_2nd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 1st SDCH encoded packet and receipt of the 2nd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_1st_To_Last_a
histogram.summary: The duration between receipt of the 1st SDCH encoded packet and receipt of the last packet, for processing by the SDCH filter.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_2nd_To_3rd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 2nd SDCH encoded packet and receipt of the 3rd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_3rd_To_4th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 3rd SDCH encoded packet and receipt of the 4th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_4th_To_5th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 4th SDCH encoded packet and receipt of the 5th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Bytes_Processed_a
histogram.summary: (discontinued 7/29/2009, and replaced by Sdch3.Network_Decode_Bytes_Processed_b) The number of bytes processed (received over the net or from cache) by the SDCH filter chain.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Bytes_Processed_b
histogram.summary: The number of bytes processed (received over the net or from cache) by the SDCH filter chain.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Bytes_VcdiffOut_a
histogram.summary: The number of bytes emitted after decoding by the SDCH filter.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Latency_F_a
histogram.summary: The duration between putting the first byte of a request (such as a GET) on the wire, until the last by of compressed SDCH encoded content is received (with durations over 10 minutes discarded). During a planned latency experiment, some clients will receive encoded SDCH data, and other will received mere gzip'ed data (that passes through the SDCH filter unchanged).

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Packets_b
histogram.summary: An approximation to the total number of SDCH encoded packets received for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Ratio_a
histogram.summary: The ratio of the number of bytes read from the network (or cache) and fed to the filter chain (usually the gunzip filter) vs. the number of bytes emitted by the SDCH filter to be rendered. This is commonly described as the SDCH compression ratio.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_1st_To_2nd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 1st **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 2nd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_1st_To_Last_a
histogram.summary: The duration between receipt of the 1st **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the last packet, for processing by the SDCH filter.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_2nd_To_3rd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 2nd **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 3rd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_3rd_To_4th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 3rd **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 4th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_4th_To_5th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 4th **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 5th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_Latency_F_a
histogram.summary: The duration between putting the first byte of a request (such as a GET) on the wire, until the last by gzip compressed content is received and passed-through unchanged by the SDCH filter (with durations over 10 minutes discarded). During a planned latency experiment, some clients will receive encoded SDCH data, and other will received mere gzip'ed data (that passes through the SDCH filter unchanged).

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_Packets_b
histogram.summary: The total number of **NON**-SDCH encoded packets received for processing by the SDCH filter in one URL fetch. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.PartialBytesIn
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode INCOMPLETE_SDCH_CONTENT reports that the VCDIFF decoder still has internally buffered data that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were received over the net (or from the cache) and fed to the start of the filter chain (usually to the gunzip filter).

histogram.name: Sdch3.PartialVcdiffIn
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode INCOMPLETE_SDCH_CONTENT reports that the VCDIFF decoder still has internally buffered data that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were received over the net (or from the cache) and fed to VCDIFF decoder (usually after gunzipping).

histogram.name: Sdch3.PartialVcdiffOut
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode INCOMPLETE_SDCH_CONTENT reports that the VCDIFF decoder still has internally buffered data that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were output by the VCDIFF decoder (and sent toward the renderer).

histogram.name: Sdch3.ProblemCodes_3
histogram.summary: Each sample is the report of a distinct problem code.

histogram.name: Sdch3.ProblemCodes_4
histogram.summary: Each sample is the report of a distinct problem code.

histogram.name: Sdch3.UnflushedBufferSize
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode UNFLUSHED_CONTENT reports that the SDCH filter is still buffering output of the VCDIFF decoder that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were in that buffer.

histogram.name: Sdch3.UnflushedBytesIn
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode UNFLUSHED_CONTENT reports that the SDCH filter is still buffering output of the VCDIFF decoder that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were received over the net (or from the cache) and fed to the start of the filter chain (usually to the gunzip filter).

histogram.name: Sdch3.UnflushedVcdiffIn
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode UNFLUSHED_CONTENT reports that the SDCH filter is still buffering output of the VCDIFF decoder that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were received over the net (or from the cache) and fed to VCDIFF decoder (usually after gunzipping).

histogram.name: Sdch3.UnflushedVcdiffOut
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode UNFLUSHED_CONTENT reports that the SDCH filter is still buffering output of the VCDIFF decoder that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were output by the VCDIFF decoder (and sent toward the renderer).

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchOptCard
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The type of action taken in the Opt-in card.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchOptPeekCard
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The type of action taken when the Opt-in card is peeking.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPeekCard
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The type of action taken when the Search card is peeking.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchTap
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The type of tap action taken by opted-in users.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchTapUndecided
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The type of tap action taken by undecided users.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchTimeToSearch
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time between tapping on a word and performing a search.

histogram.name: Search.DefaultSearchProvider
histogram.obsolete: Made obsolete around Chrome 32. Use Search.DefaultSearchProviderType instead.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The id of the default search engine that is loaded after Chrome startup. See src/chrome/browser/search_engines/prepopulate_engines.json for more info.

histogram.name: Search.DefaultSearchProviderType
histogram.summary: The type of the default search engine that is loaded when a profile is opened or after a profile reset. Note that at least one profile is opened on startup. Due to an error, there was a period from roughly May 9 2014 to May 23 2014 during which this was not being logged.

histogram.name: Search.MigratedPrefToDictionaryValue
histogram.summary: The number of times that a user-selected DSE was migrated from separate String/List/..Value preferences to the new single DictionaryValue used in M36.

histogram.name: ServicesCustomization.LoadResult
histogram.summary: Records result of fetching and parsing OEM customization manifest. See ServicesCustomizationDocument class for more info. Used only on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.Database.OpenResult
histogram.summary: Records result of opening a database for ServiceWorkerDatabase.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.Database.ReadResult
histogram.summary: Records result of read operations in ServiceWorkerDatabase.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.Database.WriteResult
histogram.summary: Records result of write operations in ServiceWorkerDatabase.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.DiskCache.InitResult
histogram.summary: Records result of opening a disk cache for ServiceWorkerDiskCache.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.DiskCache.ReadResponseResult
histogram.summary: Records result of reading response from ServiceWorkerDiskCache.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.DiskCache.WriteResponseResult
histogram.summary: Records result of writing response into ServiceWorkerDiskCache.

histogram.name: SessionCrashed.Bubble
histogram.summary: How did the user interact with the SessionCrashed Bubble?

histogram.name: Settings.DefaultSearchProvider
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in Chrome 30. Use Search.DefaultSearchProviderType instead.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The id of the default search engine domain that is specified in user preferences when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.EnforcementGroupDeterminedFromTrial
histogram.summary: Whether the SettingsEnforcement group was successfully determined from the field trial or if it had to revert to the hardcoded default.

histogram.name: Settings.FilterOnLoadTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to run PrefHashFilter::FilterOnLoad on startup.

histogram.name: Settings.FilterSerializeDataTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to run PrefHashFilter::FilterSerializeData on the UI thread prior to writing the Preferences file to disk. Only logged when PrefHashFilter::FilterSerializeData actually had work to do.

histogram.name: Settings.GivenShowHomeButton_HomePageIsNewTabPage
histogram.summary: Whether or not the home page user preference is set to the default NTP value when a profile is loaded. This is only logged if the home button is shown.

histogram.name: Settings.HashesDictionaryTrusted
histogram.summary: Logged on profile load. Indicates whether the hashes dictionary for this profile is trusted.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageDomain
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in Chrome 30. Replaced by Settings.HomePageEngineType.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The id of the home page domain that is specified in user preferences when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageEngineType
histogram.summary: Tries to pretend the home page URL is a search URL, and records the search engine type of that URL by comparing the TLD+1 of the home page URL with those of the different known search engines. Recorded when a profile is opened, if a home page URL has been set. Note that at least one profile is opened on startup.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageIsNewTabPage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether or not the home page user preference is set to the default NTP value when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageIsNewTabPage.PulledFromSync
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The value of the home-page-is-new-tab-page pref when pulled down from sync to update an out-of-sync local pref store.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageIsNewTabPage.PushedToSync
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The value of the home-page-is-new-tab-page pref when pushed up to sync from a change made locally.

histogram.name: Settings.InitializedFromMasterPrefs
histogram.summary: Logged on first run when generating the Preferences file from master_preferences. True if serializing the generated Preferences file to disk was successful, false otherwise. Note: this event does not occur if there is no master_preferences file on first run.

histogram.name: Settings.JsonDataSizeKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the JSON settings content about to be written to disk in kilobytes. Suffixed with the name of the JSON file being written to disk.

histogram.name: Settings.MigratedHashesFromLocalState
histogram.summary: Whether, while loading a profile, any preference hashes were migrated from Local State to either Preferences or Protected Preferences.

histogram.name: Settings.PinnedTabEngineTypes
histogram.summary: Tries to pretend pinned tab URLs are search URLs, and records the search engine types of those URLs by comparing the TLD+1s of the URLs with those of the different known search engines. Recorded when a profile is opened, if there are pinned tabs. Note that at least one profile is opened on startup.

histogram.name: Settings.PinnedTabs
histogram.summary: The number of pinned tabs opened when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.ShowHomeButton
histogram.summary: Whether or not the home button is enabled in user preferences when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.ShowHomeButton.PulledFromSync
histogram.summary: The enabled state of the Home button pref when pulled down from sync to update an out-of-sync local pref store.

histogram.name: Settings.ShowHomeButton.PushedToSync
histogram.summary: The enabled state of the Home button pref when pushed up to sync from a change made locally.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageDomains
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in Chrome 30. Replaced by Settings.StartupPageEngineTypes.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The ids of startup page domains that are specified in user preferences when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageEngineTypes
histogram.summary: Tries to pretend the startup page URLs are search URLs, and records the search engine types of those URLs by comparing the TLD+1s of the URLs with those of the different known search engines. Recorded when a profile is opened, if startup page URLs have been set. Note that at least one profile is opened on startup.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageLoadSettings
histogram.summary: The startup page settings when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageLoadSettings.PulledFromSync
histogram.summary: The startup page setting when pulled down from sync to update an out-of-sync local pref store.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageLoadSettings.PushedToSync
histogram.summary: The startup page setting when pushed up to sync from a change made locally.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageLoadURLs
histogram.summary: The number of URLs to be loaded on startup when a profile is loaded, if the startup page setting is set to load URLs.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupURLsMigration
histogram.summary: The startup URLs pref migration steps.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupURLsResetTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time elapsed in milliseconds in between startup URLs pref migration. A value of 0 indicates that the last migration time was in the future due to e.g. an incorrect system time.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceChanged
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference whose value has been changed since the last time Chrome set it.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceCleared
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference whose value has been cleared since the last time Chrome set it.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceInitialized
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference whose last value isn't known. We may be just starting to track the preference, or local state may have been changed outside of Chrome. This should only happen once per pref per profile.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceMigrated
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Logs the tracked preference id when it is migrated to the new MAC algorithm. This should only happen once per pref per profile.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceMigratedLegacyDeviceId
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference whose value has not changed since the last time Chrome set it, but which was last set using a legacy device ID. Each user should report this at most once per preference id and immediately be migrated to the latest hashing model.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceReset
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference which was reset by Chrome.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferencesAlternateStoreVersion
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The version of a PrefHashStore, reported once for each alternate PrefHashStore (not associated to the default profile) from a delayed task on startup.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferencesAlternateStoreVersionUpdatedFrom
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The previous version of an alternate PrefHashStore (not associated to the default profile) that was updated from a delayed task on startup. This should match Settings.TrackedPreferencesAlternateStoreVersion fairly closely for all versions but VERSION_LATEST which should never be reported here.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferencesInitializedForUnloadedProfile
histogram.summary: Preference tracking was initialized for an unloaded profile. This should happen at most once per profile.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferencesNoEnforcementOnDomain
histogram.summary: Whether settings enforcement was cancelled for a machine joined to a domain. Reported once per session on browser startup.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceTrustedInitialized
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference which was initialized despite the absence of a MAC as either (1) the current MACs are trusted, infering that this is a newly tracked pref, or (2) its value is NULL.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceUnchanged
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference whose value has not changed since the last time Chrome set it.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceWantedReset
histogram.summary: The id of a tracked preference which Chrome would have reset had the config allowed it.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedSplitPreferenceChanged
histogram.summary: The number of items that had changed in a dictionary pref when Settings.TrackedPreferenceChanged is reported for that pref.

histogram.name: SettingsResetBubble.NumNoThanksPerReset
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the user clicked on the No Thanks button of the settings reset bubble before clicking on the Reset button in the same Chrome session.

histogram.name: SharedWorker.RendererSurviveForWorkerTime
histogram.summary: A survival time of RenderProcessHostImpl for the In-renderer Shared Worker from when FastShutdownIfPossible() is called.

histogram.name: SharedWorker.TimeToDeleted
histogram.summary: The lifetime of a SharedWorkerHost. This roughly corresponds to the lifetime of SharedWorker.

histogram.name: SharedWorker.TimeToScriptLoaded
histogram.summary: The time from the creation of SharedWorkerHost until when WorkerScriptLoaded is called.

histogram.name: SharedWorker.TimeToScriptLoadFailed
histogram.summary: The time from the creation of SharedWorkerHost until when WorkerScriptLoadFailed is called.

histogram.name: ShortcutsProvider.QueryIndexTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the ShortcutsProvider to perform a query after the user has typed N characters.

histogram.name: Signin
histogram.summary: Tracks user interactions as they sign in through a flow. The suffix of the histogram indicates what UI widget or application flow triggered the signin flow.

histogram.name: Signin.AddAccount
histogram.summary: Track when chrome successfully adds an account. Failures are not tracked.

histogram.name: Signin.OneClickConfirmation
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of the ways users interact with the confirmation dialogs of the new web based sign in to Chrome flow (accessed via the one click signin).

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.AddedToChrome
histogram.summary: After the first execution of the account reconciler, how many accounts were added to the browser's token service because they were in the cookie jar.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.AddedToCookieJar
histogram.summary: After the first execution of the account reconciler, how many accounts were added to the cookie jar because they were in the browser's token service.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.DifferentPrimaryAccounts
histogram.summary: After execution of the account reconcilor, compares the primary account in the token service to the primary GAIA account of the cookie jar.

histogram.name: Signin.SignoutProfile
histogram.summary: Track how a profile gets signed out.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.CheckCRCResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether or not the CRC was checked at the moment when the last reference to a read-only entry stream is closed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.CreationToIndex
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from the creation of the simple cache backend until the index has been loaded from disk.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.CreationToIndexFail
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from the creation of the simple cache backend until the index fails to load.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.EntryCreatedAndStream2Omitted
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether, upon creation of a new cache entry, the file for stream 2 was omitted since that stream was empty.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.EntryCreationResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For entry creation operations that were sent to the disk, the result of creation.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.EntryCreationTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time, in ms, spent creating a new entry on disk.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.EntryOpenedAndStream2Removed
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether, upon opening of an existing cache entry, stream 2 was empty and the file for that stream was therefore removed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.EntryOperationsPending
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: At the time that operations are run, the number of pending operations on a particular entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.Eviction.CacheSizeOnStart
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.Eviction.CacheSizeOnStart2
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.Eviction.EntryCount
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of entries to be erased in an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.Eviction.MaxCacheSizeOnStart
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.Eviction.MaxCacheSizeOnStart2
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The maximum allowed size of the cache at the beginning of an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.Eviction.Result
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The result of an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.Eviction.SizeOfEvicted
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.Eviction.SizeOfEvicted2
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.Eviction.SizeWhenDone
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The size of the cache after running an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.Eviction.SizeWhenDone2
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The size of the cache after running an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.Eviction.TimeToDone
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent completing an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.Eviction.TimeToSelectEntries
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent selecting entries for eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.FileDescriptorLimitHard
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The maximum limit of how many file descriptors a process can open. Emitted each time the browser is launched, if the limit could be retrieved. (This is the highest value we could raise the current limit to if we liked.)

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.FileDescriptorLimitSoft
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The current limit of how many file descriptors a process can open. Emitted each time the browser is launched, if the limit could be retrieved. (We can raise this to the maximum limit if we like, without root access.)

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.FileDescriptorLimitStatus
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The result of trying to get the file descriptor limit. Emitted each time the browser is launched.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.GlobalOpenEntryCount
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of open entries across all caches backed by the Simple Cache. An entry is opened whenever a caller asks to open it to read or write cache data, and remains open until the last caller asks to close it. Logged whenever an entry is opened or closed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.HeaderSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The size of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are written or rewritten.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.HeaderSizeChange
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: How the header size has changed in a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time a write operation occurs on the header stream. (This includes the initial write, rewrites, and other writes that we couldn't classify.)

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.HeaderSizeDecreaseAbsolute
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The absolute size decrease of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a smaller size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.HeaderSizeDecreasePercentage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The relative size decrease of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a smaller size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.HeaderSizeIncreaseAbsolute
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The absolute size increase of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a larger size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.HeaderSizeIncreasePercentage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The relative size increase of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a larger size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.IndexCorrupt
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For each index load, whether the index file was corrupt.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.IndexCreatedEntryCount
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of entries in a newly created index file.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.IndexEntriesLoaded
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of entries loaded from the index file on start.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.IndexEntriesRestored
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of entries restored from disk when there was no index or the index was corrupted.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.IndexFileStateOnLoad
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The state the index file is at when an attempt is made to load from it.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.IndexInitializationWaiters
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: At the time of index initialization, the number of enqueued jobs awaiting index initialization.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.IndexInitializeMethod
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The method used to initialize the simple cache index.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.IndexLoadTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time (as measured on the worker pool) spent loading the index file.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.IndexNumEntriesOnWrite
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of entries written to the index on a flush.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.IndexRestoreTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time (as measured on the worker pool) spent restoring the index file by iterating directory entries.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.IndexWriteInterval.Background
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The interval between index saves, for apps in the background.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.IndexWriteInterval.Foreground
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The interval between index saves, for apps in the foreground.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.IndexWriteToDiskTime.Background
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend writing the index file to disk, for apps in the background, measured starting at the beginning of the write on the callback thread, and calculated using the completion time on the worker pool.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.IndexWriteToDiskTime.Foreground
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend writing the index file to disk, for apps in the foreground, measured starting at the beginning of the write on the callback thread, and calculated using the completion time on the worker pool.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.KeyMatchedOnOpen
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For each call to OpenEntry, whether the key on disk matched the request key.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.LastClusterLossPercent
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For each file in the Simple Cache, the percentage of disk space used by the cluster loss, the unused disk space in the last 4096 byte cluster of the file.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.LastClusterSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For each file in the Simple Cache, the number of bytes in the last 4096 byte cluster when the entry is saved to disk.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.OpenEntryIndexState
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: At the time that an entry is opened, the state of that entry in the index.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.ReadIsParallelizable
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For each Read operation, whether it could have been issued in parallel of a previous Read operation.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.ReadResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The outcome of Entry::ReadData in the simple cache.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.SyncCheckEOFHasCrc
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.App.SyncCloseResult

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Http.GlobalOpenEntryCount
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of open entries across all caches backed by the Simple Cache. An entry is opened whenever a caller asks to open it to read or write cache data, and remains open until the last caller asks to close it. Logged whenever an entry is opened or closed.

histogram.summary: The number of open entries across all caches backed by the Simple Cache. An entry is opened whenever a caller asks to open it to read or write cache data, and remains open until the last caller asks to close it. Logged whenever an entry is opened or closed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.HeaderSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The size of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are written or rewritten.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.HeaderSizeChange
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: How the header size has changed in a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time a write operation occurs on the header stream. (This includes the initial write, rewrites, and other writes that we couldn't classify.)

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.HeaderSizeDecreaseAbsolute
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The absolute size decrease of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a smaller size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.HeaderSizeDecreasePercentage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The relative size decrease of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a smaller size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.HeaderSizeIncreaseAbsolute
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The absolute size increase of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a larger size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.HeaderSizeIncreasePercentage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The relative size increase of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a larger size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.IndexCorrupt
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For each index load, whether the index file was corrupt.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.IndexCreatedEntryCount
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of entries in a newly created index file.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.IndexEntriesLoaded
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of entries loaded from the index file on start.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.IndexEntriesRestored
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of entries restored from disk when there was no index or the index was corrupted.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.IndexFileStateOnLoad
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The state the index file is at when an attempt is made to load from it.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.IndexInitializationWaiters
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: At the time of index initialization, the number of enqueued jobs awaiting index initialization.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.IndexInitializeMethod
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The method used to initialize the simple cache index.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.IndexLoadTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time (as measured on the worker pool) spent loading the index file.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.IndexNumEntriesOnWrite
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of entries written to the index on a flush.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.IndexRestoreTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time (as measured on the worker pool) spent restoring the index file by iterating directory entries.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.IndexWriteInterval.Background
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The interval between index saves, for apps in the background.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.IndexWriteInterval.Foreground
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The interval between index saves, for apps in the foreground.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.IndexWriteToDiskTime.Background
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend writing the index file to disk, for apps in the background, measured starting at the beginning of the write on the callback thread, and calculated using the completion time on the worker pool.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.IndexWriteToDiskTime.Foreground
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend writing the index file to disk, for apps in the foreground, measured starting at the beginning of the write on the callback thread, and calculated using the completion time on the worker pool.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.KeyMatchedOnOpen
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For each call to OpenEntry, whether the key on disk matched the request key.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.LastClusterLossPercent
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For each file in the Simple Cache, the percentage of disk space used by the cluster loss, the unused disk space in the last 4096 byte cluster of the file.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.LastClusterSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For each file in the Simple Cache, the number of bytes in the last 4096 byte cluster when the entry is saved to disk.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.OpenEntryIndexState
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: At the time that an entry is opened, the state of that entry in the index.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.ReadIsParallelizable
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For each Read operation, whether it could have been issued in parallel of a previous Read operation.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.ReadResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The outcome of Entry::ReadData in the simple cache.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.SyncCheckEOFHasCrc
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For each EOFRecord found with a valid magic number, indicates if the record also contains a CRC.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.SyncCheckEOFResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, of checking the EOF record of a cache entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.SyncCloseResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, of closing a cache entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.SyncCreatePlatformFileError
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Media.SyncCreatePlatformFileError_WithoutIndex

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
