histogram.name: SimpleGeolocation.Request.Event
histogram.summary: Events in reqests processing of IP-based SimpleGeolocation.

histogram.name: SimpleGeolocation.Request.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: Http response codes in IP-based SimpleGeolocation.

histogram.name: SimpleGeolocation.Request.ResponseFailureTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of the first API request and the time the final (failed) response was recorded. Includes all retries.

histogram.name: SimpleGeolocation.Request.ResponseSuccessTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of the first API request and the time the final (successfull) response was recorded. Includes all retries.

histogram.name: SimpleGeolocation.Request.Result
histogram.summary: Result of SimpleGeolocationRequest.

histogram.name: SimpleGeolocation.Request.Retries
histogram.summary: Number of retries until the final response was recorded.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.AllResponses
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of all network responses received by a renderer. Each response is corresponding to one URL requested by a renderer. Incremented when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.BrowsingInstanceCount
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of all current BrowsingInstances. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CurrentRendererProcessCount
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of all renderer processes, including WebUI and extensions. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateAllSitesProcessCountEstimate
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The upper bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated all sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateAllSitesProcessCountLowerBound
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The lower bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated all sites, subject to the process limit. Happens to be the number of unique sites. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateAllSitesProcessCountNoLimit
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The predicted renderer process count if we isolated all sites and if there were no process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateAllSitesTotalProcessCountEstimate
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The predicted total process count if we isolated all sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateHttpsSitesProcessCountEstimate
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The upper bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated only HTTPS (not HTTP) sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateHttpsSitesProcessCountLowerBound
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The lower bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated only HTTPS (not HTTP) sites, subject to the process limit. Happens to be the number of isolated sites. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateHttpsSitesProcessCountNoLimit
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The predicted renderer process count if we isolated only HTTPS (not HTTP) sites and if there were no process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateHttpsSitesTotalProcessCountEstimate
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The predicted total process count if we isolated only HTTPS (not HTTP) sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.DataLength
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of bytes in the first network packet for a response with headers that imply potential illegal cross-site access. Recorded when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.Blocked
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of blocked cross-site document responses due to having HTML content type header and contents sniffed as HTML. Sampled with value of 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.Blocked.NonRenderableStatusCode
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a nonrenderable HTTP status code among blocked cross-site document responses due to their HTML contents. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.Blocked.RenderableStatusCode
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.) among blocked cross-site document responses due to their HTML contents. Sampled with a resource type (0-14) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.NoSniffBlocked.NonRenderableStatusCode
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a nonrenderable HTTP status code among blocked cross-site document responses due to having HTML content type and nosniff headers. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.NoSniffBlocked.RenderableStatusCode
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to having HTML content type and nosniff headers. Sampled with a resource type (0-14) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.NotBlocked
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of not blocked responses despite having an HTML content type header due to the failure of content sniffing. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.NotBlocked.MaybeJS
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of responses that may be parsed as JavaScript among not blocked responses. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.JSON.Blocked
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of blocked cross-site document responses due to having JSON content type header and contents sniffed as JSON. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.JSON.Blocked.NonRenderableStatusCode
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a nonrenderable HTTP status code among blocked cross-site document responses due to their JSON contents. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.JSON.Blocked.RenderableStatusCode
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to their JSON contents. Sampled with a resource type (0-14) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.JSON.NoSniffBlocked.NonRenderableStatusCode
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a nonrenderable HTTP status code among blocked cross-site document responses due to having JSON content type and nosniff headers. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.JSON.NoSniffBlocked.RenderableStatusCode
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to having JSON content type and nosniff headers. histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.JSON.NotBlocked

histogram.summary: The count of not blocked responses despite having an JSON content type header due to the failure of content sniffing. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.JSON.NotBlocked.MaybeJS
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of responses that may be parsed as JavaScript among not blocked responses with a JSON content type header. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.MimeType

histogram.summary: MIME type codes for content type header values of potentially cross-site document responses, excluding same-site or not http(s) urls. Sampled with a MIME type code (0-4) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.summary: The count of blocked cross-site document responses due to having Plain content type header and contents sniffed as JSON. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Plain.JSON.Blocked.NonRenderableStatusCode
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a nonrenderable HTTP status code among blocked cross-site document responses due to their Plain.JSON contents. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Plain.JSON.Blocked.RenderableStatusCode
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.), among blocked cross-site document responses due to their Plain.JSON contents. Sampled with a resource type (0-14) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: Stars.Goog_Related
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips with Google related urls (points to internal Google resources). Logs every time user goes to chrome://boomarks.

histogram.name: Stars.Goog_Related_20_Percent
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips with Google related urls within first 20 (points to internal Google resources). Logs every time user goes to chrome://boomarks.

histogram.name: Stars.Images_Percent
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips with images. Logs every time user goes to chrome://boomarks.

histogram.name: Stars.Images_Percent_First20
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips with images within first 20. Logs every time user goes to chrome://boomarks.

histogram.name: Stars.No_Images_Snippets
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips without images or snippets. Logs every time user goes to chrome://boomarks.

histogram.name: Stars.No_Img_No_Snippet_20_Percent
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips without images or snippets within first 20. Logs every time user goes to chrome://boomarks.

histogram.name: Startup.AppListFirstPaintColdStart
histogram.summary: Time for a newly created browser process to perform the first paint of the app launcher, when started with the --show-app-list flag and with no currently running Chrome processes.

histogram.name: Startup.AppListFirstPaintWarmStart
histogram.summary: Time for a running browser process to perform the first paint of the app launcher. Measured from the time a second Chrome process started, which sent its --show-app-list command line argument to the already-running process and will soon exit.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTime
histogram.summary: Time from browser startup to the start of the main thread's message loop.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry
histogram.summary: Time from main entry to the start of the main thread's message loop. This stat is only recorded after 7 minutes of OS uptime to try to mitigate the variance resulting from Chrome being autostarted.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry.FirstRun
histogram.summary: Time from main entry to the start of the main thread's message loop on first run. This stat is only recorded after 7 minutes of OS uptime to try to mitigate the variance resulting from Chrome being autostarted.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserOpenTabs
histogram.summary: Time taken to open the initial tab or to restore tabs from previous session.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserWindowDisplay
histogram.summary: Time from browser startup to the time the browser window initially becomes visible.

histogram.name: Startup.ChromeCast.TimeToDisplayVideo
histogram.summary: The elapsed time from the ChromeCast application launch to the first video frame displayed.

histogram.name: Startup.CreateFirstProfile
histogram.summary: How long it takes to load the original profile synchronously on the UI thread.

histogram.name: Startup.Fling.TimeToDisplayVideo
histogram.summary: The elapsed time from the Fling application launch to the first video frame displayed.

histogram.name: Startup.IsResume
histogram.summary: Whether a startup is a resume (vs a cold start).

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ExeMainToDllMain
histogram.summary: Time from the main() function in chrome.exe to chrome.dll's main().

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ProcessCreateToDllMain
histogram.summary: Time from the process creation to chrome.dll's main().

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ProcessCreateToExeMain
histogram.summary: Time from the process creation to executing the main() function in chrome.exe.

histogram.name: Startup.MobileSessionStartAction
histogram.summary: The action requested on the application startup when called from another app or the OS.

histogram.name: Startup.MobileSessionStartFromApps
histogram.summary: The calling application (if any).

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.AwakeFromNib
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of -[AppControllerMac awakeFromNib].

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.DockIconWillFinishBouncing
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of -[AppControllerMac didFinishLaunching:]. At that point, the dock icon will finish its current animation and stop bouncing.

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.PostMainMessageLoopStart
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of ChromeBrowserMainPartsMac::PostMainMessageLoopStart.

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.PostProfileInit
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of ChromeBrowserMainPartsMac::PostProfileInit.

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.PreMainMessageLoopStart
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of ChromeBrowserMainPartsMac::PreMainMessageLoopStart.

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.PreProfileInit
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of ChromeBrowserMainPartsMac::PreProfileInit.

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.WillFinishLaunching
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of -[AppControllerMac willFinishLaunching:].

histogram.name: Startup.ShowAppListColdStart
histogram.summary: Time for a newly created browser process to reach the code that starts showing the app launcher, when started with the --show-app-list flag and with no currently running Chrome processes.

histogram.name: Startup.ShowAppListWarmStart
histogram.summary: Time for a running browser process to reach the code that starts showing the app launcher. Measured from the time a second Chrome process started, which sent its --show-app-list command line argument to the already-running process and will soon exit.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupBookmarksLoad
histogram.summary: Time it takes to load bookmarks from disk. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupExtensionServiceInitAfterImport
histogram.summary: Time it takes to finish initialization of the extension service including loading built-in extensions. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupFinalProfileInit
histogram.summary: Time the final stages of profile initialization taking including initialization of profile keyed services. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupNSSInit
histogram.summary: Time it takes to load the NSS libraries and initialize it. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupPreferenceLoading
histogram.summary: Time it takes to load preferences from disk. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupProfileIODataInit
histogram.summary: Time it takes to initialize the ProfileIOData object - this includes initialization of the cookie store. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupSafeBrowsingGetDatabase
histogram.summary: Time it takes to load the safe browsing database from disk. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupSafeBrowsingServiceInitialize
histogram.summary: Time it takes to initialize the safe browsing service. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupSessionServiceCreateTabsAndWindows
histogram.summary: Time it takes for session restore to finish initiating creation of restored tabs and windows. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.WarmStartTimeFromRemoteProcessStart
histogram.summary: Time for a running browser process to start processing the command line passed in by a second Chrome process, which just sent its command line arguments to the already-running process and will soon exit. Measured from the time the second Chrome process started.

histogram.name: StartupTimeBomb.Alarm
histogram.summary: Time duration measured from the time the startup timebomb was started and when it went off.

histogram.name: Suggestions.FailedRequestErrorCode
histogram.summary: The counts of network error codes encountered by SuggestionsService when an attempt to fetch suggestions from the server fails.

histogram.name: Suggestions.FetchResponseCode
histogram.summary: The counts of HTTP response codes encountered by SuggestionsService when attempting to fetch suggestions from the server.

histogram.name: Suggestions.FetchSuccessLatency
histogram.summary: The latency of a SuggestionsService fetch that results in a success response.

histogram.name: Suggestions.LocalBlacklistSize
histogram.summary: Number of URLs present in the Suggestions local blacklist when the Suggestions service is created.

histogram.name: Suggestions.ResponseState
histogram.summary: The counts of response states (such as empty or invalid) encountered by SuggestionsService when attempting to fetch suggestions from the server.

histogram.name: Sync.AuthorizationTimeInNetwork

histogram.name: Sync.AuthServerRejectedTokenAgeLong

histogram.name: Sync.AuthServerRejectedTokenAgeShort

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillStartFailure

histogram.name: Sync.AutoNigoriOverwrites

histogram.name: Sync.BackendInitializeFirstTime
histogram.summary: Tracks sync backend initialization time during initial sync setup.

histogram.name: Sync.BackendInitializeFirstTimeSuccess
histogram.summary: Tracks sync backend initialization success rate during initial sync setup.

histogram.name: Sync.BackendInitializeRestoreState
histogram.summary: Compares sync's has_setup_completed pref against the set of types actually restored from the sync DB. Mismatches should be rare.

histogram.name: Sync.BackendInitializeRestoreSuccess
histogram.summary: Tracks sync backend initialization success rate in cases where sync was previously initialized.

histogram.name: Sync.BackendInitializeRestoreTime
histogram.summary: Tracks sync backend initialization time in cases where sync was previously initialized.

histogram.name: Sync.BadRequestCountOnSignInNeedsUpdateInfoBar

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarkAssociationTime

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarkRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of bookmark run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarkStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of bookmark association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureFailed

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime_Long.OK

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime_Long.PARTIAL_SUCCESS

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime_Long.UNRECOVERABLE_ERROR
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where configuration encounters an unrecoverable error.

histogram.name: Sync.ConflictFixCircularity
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 12/2011. No longer tracked. See crbug.com/107816.
histogram.summary: Number of times we fix a circularity sync conflict. This is not expected to be hit anymore.

histogram.name: Sync.ConflictFixRemovedDirectoriesWithContent
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 12/2011. No longer tracked. See crbug.com/107816.
histogram.summary: Number of times we fix a removed directory with content sync conflict. This is not expected to be hit anymore

histogram.name: Sync.CredentialsLost
histogram.summary: Whether or not we detected missing credentials during startup. This may be related to crbug.com/121755.

histogram.name: Sync.CryptographerPendingKeys
histogram.summary: Breakdown of sync users whose cryptographer has pending keys.

histogram.name: Sync.CryptographerReady
histogram.summary: Breakdown of sync users whose cryptographer is fully ready for encryption and decryption (initialized and no pending keys).

histogram.name: Sync.CustomEncryption
histogram.summary: Histogram that keeps track of how users encrypt their sync data. All users start off with default encryption during initial setup, while a subset of users go on to encrypt their sync data with a custom passphrase.

histogram.name: Sync.CustomPassphrase
histogram.summary: Boolean histogram for whether a custom passphrase was entered during sync setup. Samples are taken every time sync is (re)configured, and the unique userid count shows how many users entered a custom passphrase.

histogram.name: Sync.CustomSync
histogram.summary: Samples are taken every time sync is (re)configured, and the unique userid count shows how many users explicitly chose to sync this data type via the "Advanced Sync Preferences" dialog.

histogram.name: Sync.DatatypePrefRecovery
histogram.summary: Number of clients that have fixed themselves up from a datatype preference loss. Clients are not expected to have this happen more than once. This value can be compared to Sync.BackendInitializeRestoreSuccess to determine what percentage of users are still recovering.

histogram.name: Sync.DataTypeRunFailures
histogram.summary: Histogram of the run failures for the different sync datatypes. These are failures that occur after startup while the datatype is syncing. Note: Due to an enumeration reordering, pre-M23 labels are inaccurate (see sync/internal_api/public/base/model_type.h).

histogram.name: Sync.DataTypeStartFailures
histogram.summary: Histogram of the startup failures for the different sync datatypes. These are failures due to missing top level sync nodes or model association Note: Due to an enumeration reordering, pre-M23 labels are inaccurate (see sync/internal_api/public/base/model_type.h).

histogram.name: Sync.DictionaryAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during dictionary association.

histogram.name: Sync.DictionaryStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of dictionary association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.DirectoryOpenFailedMac
histogram.summary: Number of failures trying to open the sync database on mac.

histogram.name: Sync.DirectoryOpenFailedNotWinMac
histogram.summary: Number of failures trying to open the sync database on a non-windows non-mac platform.

histogram.name: Sync.DirectoryOpenFailedWin
histogram.summary: Number of failures trying to open the sync database on windows.

histogram.name: Sync.DirectoryOpenResult
histogram.summary: Tracks success of failure of sync directory initialization.

histogram.name: Sync.EncryptAllData
histogram.summary: Boolean histogram for whether the "Encrypt all synced data" radio button was selected during sync setup. Samples are taken every time sync is (re)configured, and the unique userid count shows how many users chose to encrypt their sync data.

histogram.name: Sync.EventCodes
histogram.summary: A UI event occured.

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during extension association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of extension run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionsAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during extension association.

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionSettingsAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during extension settings association.

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionSettingsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of extension settings association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of extension association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of extension association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconCacheLookupSucceeded
histogram.summary: Whether a sync favicon cache lookup succeeded or not.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconCount
histogram.summary: Number of synced favicons at initialization time.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconImagesAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during favicon images association.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconImagesStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of favicon images association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconsAvailableAtMerge
histogram.summary: Number of client that have filled their sync favicon cache and must evict old favicons vs those whose cache is not full.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconTrackingAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during favicon tracking association.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconTrackingStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of favicon tracking association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconVisitPeriod
histogram.summary: Time between updates to a synced favicon's visit time.

histogram.name: Sync.FirstBackendInitializeSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 11/2011. Was counted incorrectly. Replaced by Sync.BackendInitializeFirstTimeSuccess.
histogram.summary: Tracks sync backend initialization success rate during initial sync setup.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqApps
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for apps. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqAutofill
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for autofill entries. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqAutofillProfiles
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for autofill profiles. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqBookmarks
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for bookmarks. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqDictionary
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for dictionary. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqExtensions
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for extensions. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqFaviconImages
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for favicon images. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqFaviconTracking
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for favicon tracking. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqNigori
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for nigori. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqPasswords
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for passwords. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqPreferences
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for preferences. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqSearchEngines
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for search engines. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqSessions
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for sessions. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqSyncedNotifications
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for synced notifications. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqThemes
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for themes. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqTypedUrls
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for typed urls. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency.

histogram.name: Sync.KeystoreDecryptionFailed
histogram.summary: The reason for a failure decrypting the keystore decryptor token.

histogram.name: Sync.LocalModelOutOfSync
histogram.summary: Counts instances of out of sync local models detected during startup.

histogram.name: Sync.NigoriMigrationState
histogram.summary: Breakdown of sync's nigori node keystore migration state.

histogram.name: Sync.PartiallySyncedTypes
histogram.summary: Number of partially synced types (those with a progress marker but no initial sync ended bit) that exist at sync startup.

histogram.name: Sync.PasswordAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during password association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.PasswordRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of passwords run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.PasswordsAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during password association.

histogram.name: Sync.PasswordsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of password association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.PasswordStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of password association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.PreferenceAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during preference association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.PreferenceRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of preferences run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.PreferencesAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during preference association.

histogram.name: Sync.PreferencesStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of preference association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.PreferenceStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of preference association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.ReauthorizationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken from startup for the user to reauthorize.

histogram.name: Sync.RefreshTokenAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether OAuth2 refresh token was available at the time when ProfileSyncService was starting backend.

histogram.name: Sync.ResolveSimpleConflict
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of simple conflict resolutions.

histogram.name: Sync.RestoreBackendInitializeSucess
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 11/2011. Was counted incorrectly. Replaced by Sync.BackendInitializeRestoreSuccess.
histogram.summary: Tracks sync backend initialization success rate in cases where sync was previously initialized.

histogram.name: Sync.SearchEngineAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during search engine association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.SearchEngineRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of search engine run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.SearchEnginesAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during search engine association.

histogram.name: Sync.SearchEnginesStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of search engine association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.SearchEngineStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of search engine association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.ServiceInitialConfigureTime
histogram.summary: Time spent on first-time configure. May include time spent on retries.

histogram.name: Sync.ServiceSubsequentConfigureTime
histogram.summary: Time spent on non-first-time configure. May include time spent on retries.

histogram.name: Sync.SessionAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during session association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.SessionRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of sessions run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.SessionsAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during session association.

histogram.name: Sync.SessionsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of session association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.SessionStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of session association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.Shutdown.BackendDestroyedTime
histogram.summary: Time taken from the start of sync shutdown (in ProfileSyncService) until the backend (SyncBackendHost) is fully destroyed.

histogram.name: Sync.Shutdown.StopRegistrarTime
histogram.summary: Amount of time the UI thread waits (at shutdown) to stop the SyncBackendRegistrar.

histogram.name: Sync.Shutdown.StopSyncThreadTime
histogram.summary: Amount of time the UI thread waits (at shutdown) to stop the sync thread.

histogram.name: Sync.Startup.DeferredInitTrigger
histogram.summary: The type of event that triggered sync initialization.

histogram.name: Sync.Startup.TimeDeferred
histogram.summary: Time spent after ProfileSyncService *creation* but before SyncBackendHost initialization.

histogram.name: Sync.Startup.TimeDeferred2
histogram.summary: Time spent after ProfileSyncService *creation* but before SyncBackendHost initialization.

histogram.name: Sync.Startup.TypeTriggeringInit
histogram.summary: Data type that first requests sync initialization.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncAuthError
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times sync clients have encountered an auth error and number of times auth errors are fixed.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncedNotificationsAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during synced notifications association.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncedNotificationsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of synced notifications association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncerConflictStuck
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 12/2011. No longer tracked. See crbug.com/107816.
histogram.summary: Number of times the sync conflict resolver gets stuck. This is not expected to be hit anymore.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncErrorInfobarDisplayed
histogram.summary: Enumeration of error conditions that displays an infobar to the user.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncEverything
histogram.summary: Boolean histogram for whether the "Sync Everything" option was selected during sync setup. Samples are taken every time sync is (re)configured, and the unique userid count shows how many users chose to sync all available data types.

histogram.name: Sync.ThemeAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during theme association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.ThemeRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of theme run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.ThemesAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during theme association.

histogram.name: Sync.ThemesStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of theme association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.ThemeStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of theme association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during typed url association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlChangeProcessorErrors
histogram.summary: The percentage of history DB operations initiated by the typed URL change processor that return an error. The cumulative count for the current sync session is logged after every typed URL change.

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlModelAssociationErrors
histogram.summary: The percentage of history DB operations during model association that return an error. This is logged at the end of typed URL model association, which happens once each time sync starts up.

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of typed url run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlsAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during typed url association.

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of typed url association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of typed url association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.UnrecoverableErrors
histogram.summary: Enumeration of the different reasons for unrecoverable errors and how often they have occurred.

histogram.name: Sync.UserPerceivedAuthorizationTime
histogram.summary: Time the user spends looking at the authorization dialog.

histogram.name: Sync.UserPerceivedBookmarkAssociation
histogram.summary: Time taken during bookmark association.

histogram.name: SyncedNotifications.Actions
histogram.summary: The actions taken on synced notifications, recorded every time they happen. This histogram will record every single event that happens separately.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.ConflictResolutionPolicy
histogram.summary: Overridden conflict resolution policy of Sync FileSystem API. Recorded for each API call to override the policy.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.MetadataNumber
histogram.summary: The number of cached backing remote file metadata in the Sync FileSystem database. Recorded at the initialization phase of Sync FileSystem.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.RegisteredAppNumber
histogram.summary: The number of Chrome Apps that uses Sync FileSystem with V2 backend. Recorded at the initialization phase of Sync FileSystem.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.RegisterOriginResult
histogram.summary: The result of the registration of Chrome App to Sync FileSystem.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.RegisterOriginTime
histogram.summary: Time elapsed to register a Chrome App to SyncFilesystem. Recorded for each registration request by apps.

histogram.name: SyncFileSystem.TrackerNumber
histogram.summary: The number of the directory tree node that maps backing files to local files in the Sync FileSystem database. Recorded at the initialization phase of SyncFileSystem.

histogram.name: Tab.AgeUponRestoreFromColdStart
histogram.summary: Age (time since the last display in previous sessions) of a tab being restored due to the first tab switch after the browser cold start, recorded upon such restore. When the browser is started from cold, this metric is not recorded for the foreground, automatically restored tab, so that the metric tracks only the restores triggered by direct user decision to switch tabs.

histogram.name: Tab.BackgroundLoadStatus
histogram.summary: Mobile-specific metric: when a tab that was opened in background (via "Open link in new tab") is switched to, we record whether the eagerly loaded tab was still memory resident, or we lost the loaded page due to memory pressure.

histogram.name: Tab.EvictedTabWasActive
histogram.summary: [iOS] When switching to an evicted tab, this histogram records whether or not the tab had ever been active. For example, the tab was opened via "Open in new tab" but evicted before being viewed for the first time.

histogram.name: Tab.FormActivityCountEvictedHistogram
histogram.summary: A count of form activity (e.g. fields selected, characters typed) in a tab. Recorded only for tabs that are evicted due to memory pressure and then selected again.

histogram.name: Tab.PerceivedRestoreTime
histogram.summary: User-perceived load time for a successful tab restore, measured from the first time the user sees the tab being restored until the load completes.

histogram.name: Tab.RestoreResult
histogram.summary: When the browser restores a tab, whether the load was successful. Loads can fail for instance when there is no connectivity.

histogram.name: Tab.RestoreTime
histogram.summary: Load time for a successful tab restore.

histogram.name: Tab.RestoreUserPersistence
histogram.summary: When the browser restores a tab, whether the user waits for completion of the load or if the user gives up by switching to another tab or leaving Chrome.

histogram.name: Tab.StatusWhenDisplayed
histogram.summary: The status of a tab collected each time the tab is displayed on Android, including user switching to the tab and displays of newly created tabs, such as NTP or tabs opened to handle intents.

histogram.name: Tab.StatusWhenSwitchedBackToForeground
histogram.summary: The status of a tab collected each time the user switches to it on mobile. That does not include tabs being created at the time the user switches to them, such as NTP or tabs opened to handle intents.

histogram.name: Tab.StatusWhenSwitchedBackToForegroundDataProxyEnabled
histogram.summary: The status of a tab collected each time the user switches to it on mobile with the data reduction proxy enabled. This is populated identically, and in addition to Tab.StatusWhenSwitchedBackToForeground for any given tab switching event if the proxy is enabled.

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundAge
histogram.summary: Age (in ms) when the tab was switched to foreground.

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundLaunchedWithURL
histogram.summary: Each time a tab is brought to the foreground, this histogram indicates if chrome was launched without an URL (i.e., from the launcher), or with an URL (i.e., from another app).

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundMRURank
histogram.summary: Rank in MRU order (0 being first) when the tab was switched to foreground.

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundNumTabs
histogram.summary: Count of all tabs when a tab is switched.

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundRevisit
histogram.summary: Each time a tab is brought to the foreground, this histogram indicates if this is the first viewing of the tab since Chrome was put into foreground, or if it was a return to a tab that has already been shown in this session.

histogram.name: Tab.TimeSinceActive
histogram.summary: [iOS] When an existing tab becomes active, this histogram records the time since it was made inactive.

histogram.name: Tab.TimeSinceActiveEvicted
histogram.summary: [iOS] When an evicted tab becomes active, this histogram records the time since it was made inactive.

histogram.name: Tab.TimeSinceFormActivityEvictedHistogram
histogram.summary: Time elapsed since there was form activity (e.g. fields selected, characters typed) in a tab. Recorded only for tabs that are evicted due to memory pressure and then selected again.

histogram.name: Tabs.ForegroundTabAgeAtStartup
histogram.summary: Age (time since the last display in previous sessions) of the foreground tab being restored on the browser cold start.

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestoreApplicability
histogram.summary: Applicability of speculative tab restore, recorded every time a tab is switched. This allows to estimate the fraction of tab restores experienced on mobile that can be mitigated using speculative restore. Options higher in the enum take precedence over the lower ones (i.e. low-memory tablet will be accounted as tablet).

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestorePredictionAccuracy.SideSwipe
histogram.summary: Accuracy of the tab switch predictions made when the user begins the side swipe gesture.

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestorePredictionAccuracy.TabSwitcher
histogram.summary: Accuracy of the tab switch predictions made when the user enters the tab switcher.

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestoreTargetStatus
histogram.summary: Status of a tab recorded when the tab is targeted with speculative restore.

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestoreTimeAhead.SideSwipe
histogram.summary: Time between starting the speculative load and actual tab switch for correct speculative load predictions made when the user begins the side swipe gesture.

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestoreTimeAhead.TabSwitcher
histogram.summary: Time between starting the speculative load and actual tab switch for correct speculative load predictions made when the user enters the tab switcher.

histogram.name: TileManager.ExceededMemoryBudget
histogram.summary: Measures whether the tile manager exceeded the hard GPU memory budget (OOMed). Recorded each time the tile manager assigns GPU memory to tiles.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.Event
histogram.summary: Events in TimeZoneRequest.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: Http response codes in TimeZoneRequest.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.ResponseFailureTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of the first API request and the time the final (failed) response was recorded. Includes all retries.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.ResponseSuccessTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the sending of the first API request and the time the final (successfull) response was recorded. Includes all retries.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.Result
histogram.summary: Result of TimeZoneRequest.

histogram.name: TimeZone.TimeZoneRequest.Retries
histogram.summary: Number of retries until the final response was recorded.

histogram.name: TopSites.NumberOfApplyBlacklist
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times TopSitesImpl::ApplyBlacklist is called.

histogram.name: TopSites.NumberOfBlacklistedItems
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of items in the user Most Visited blacklist every time TopSitesImpl::ApplyBlacklist is called.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Device
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad device state.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Metrics
histogram.summary: Tracks unusual CrOS touchpad operational states (e.g. running into the noisy ground issue). This is sampled at every touchpad event.

histogram.name: Touchpad.NaturalScroll.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad natural scroll setting changes by the user.

histogram.name: Touchpad.NaturalScroll.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad natural scroll setting on startup.

histogram.name: Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting changes by the user. This replaces the old Touchpad.Sensitivity.Changed metric.

histogram.name: Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting on startup. This replaces the old Touchpad.Sensitivity.Started metric.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Sensitivity.Changed
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2013, replaced by Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Changed.
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting changes by the user.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Sensitivity.Started
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 6/2013, replaced by Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Started.
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting on startup.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapDragging.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapDragging setting changes by the user.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapDragging.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapDragging setting on startup.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapToClick.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapToClick setting changes by the user.

histogram.name: Touchpad.TapToClick.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad TapToClick setting on startup.

histogram.name: Translate.AlwaysTranslateLang
histogram.summary: The number of times the always translate option was selected in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.CaptureText
histogram.summary: The time spent capturing plain text from the DOM. This is reported by ChromeRenderViewObserver when a page is loaded completely.

histogram.name: Translate.ContentLanguage
histogram.summary: A page may provide a Content-Language HTTP header or a META tag. For each page load, measures whether the Content-Language header exists and is valid.

histogram.name: Translate.DeclineTranslate
histogram.summary: The number of times the "Nope" (don't translate) or the infobar's X button was clicked in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.DeclineTranslateCloseInfobar
histogram.summary: The number of times the translate infobar was closed by clicking the X button without the user translating the page.

histogram.name: Translate.DeclineTranslateDismissUI
histogram.summary: The number of times the translate UI was closed without translating in the way that the user doesn't deny translating explicityly, like pressing 'Nope' button. This is counted on both the infobar and the bubble UI. We are comparing this on infobar to that on bubble by A/B testing and expecting that the user will click 'Nope' button on bubble less times than infobar. We won't delete this histogram after the experiment.

histogram.name: Translate.HtmlLang
histogram.summary: A page may provide a lang attribute in html tag. For each page load, measures whether the lang attribute exists and is valid.

histogram.name: Translate.InitiationStatus
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 11/2013, and replaced by Translate.InitiationStatus.v2.
histogram.summary: The reason why Chrome decided to perform the next action (e.g., to show infobar, to translate a page without any prompting, and so on) when Chrome Translate is ready to translate a page.

histogram.name: Translate.InitiationStatus.v2
histogram.summary: The reason why Chrome decided to perform the next action (e.g., to show infobar, to translate a page without any prompting, and so on) when Chrome Translate is ready to translate a page.

histogram.name: Translate.LanguageDetectionTiming
histogram.summary: For each page load, records whether language detection occurs on time or gets deferred. If deferred language detection later completes, this is also recorded. This allows measuring the UX impact of using a non-static CLD data source.

histogram.name: Translate.LanguageVerification
histogram.summary: For each page load, measures whether the provided Content-Language header matches the language determined by CLD. Beyond directly matching or mismatching the Content-Language header, CLD can complement the Content-Language. For example, suppose the Content-Language header specifies 'zh' (general Chinese), a language code that the Translate server does not support. In this case, CLD can detect a subcode like '-TW' or '-CN', resulting in language codes 'zh-TW' and 'zh-CN', which the Translate server supports. This is referred to as "complementing a language subcode".

histogram.name: Translate.LocalesOnDisabledByPrefs
histogram.summary: Logs the user locale when the Translate feature is disabled by the user. This is recorded each time a webpage is loaded and prefs for translation is checked. This allows us to investigate the correlation between the user locale and the usage rates of the Translate.

histogram.name: Translate.ModifyOriginalLang
histogram.summary: The number of times the original language in the translate infobar has been changed.

histogram.name: Translate.ModifyTargetLang
histogram.summary: The number of times the target language in the translate infobar has been changed.

histogram.name: Translate.NeverTranslateLang
histogram.summary: The number of times the never translate option was selected in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.NeverTranslateSite
histogram.summary: The number of times the never translate site was selected in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.PageScheme
histogram.summary: Counts translation target page schemes.

histogram.name: Translate.ReportLanguageDetectionError
histogram.summary: The number of times the "report this error" of options menu is selected in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.RevertTranslation
histogram.summary: The number of times the show original button was clicked in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.ServerReportedUnsupportedLanguage
histogram.summary: The number of times the detected language is not supported by Translate Element.

histogram.name: Translate.ShowBeforeTranslateInfobar
histogram.summary: The number of times an infobar proposing to translate a page has been shown.

histogram.name: Translate.ShowErrorInfobar
histogram.summary: Chrome Translate shows an error infobar when an error happens on translation and the infobar message depends on what kind of error happens. This metric counts how often each error message is shown.

histogram.name: Translate.ShowErrorUI
histogram.summary: Chrome Translate shows an error UI (infobar or bubble) when an error happens on translation and the UI message depends on what kind of error happens. This metric counts how often each error message is shown.

histogram.name: Translate.SimilarLanguageMatch
histogram.summary: This metrics is logged whenever a page is loaded. The logged value is "Mathced" when the CLD-detected language differs from the page language code , and the two languages are such similar languages. In that case, Chrome ignore the CLD-determined language and instead uses the page language code. The page language code is decided by Content-Language and HTML lang attribute.

histogram.name: Translate.TimeToBeReady
histogram.summary: The time from injecting scripts for Chrome Translate to being ready to perform translation.

histogram.name: Translate.TimeToLoad
histogram.summary: The time from injecting scripts for Chrome Translate to the finishing loads of all depending libraries.

histogram.name: Translate.TimeToTranslate
histogram.summary: The time from starting translation to the completion.

histogram.name: Translate.Translate
histogram.summary: The number of times the translate button was clicked in the translate infobar.

histogram.name: Translate.UndisplayableLanguage
histogram.summary: Logs an undisplayable language included in the language list sent by the Translate server. The Translate server sends the list each time the user runs Chrome. This metrics tells us that there is a language which UI should support but doesn't.

histogram.name: Translate.UnsupportedLanguageAtInitiation
histogram.summary: Logs an unsupported source language detected during initiation of the Translate feature. This is reported when the language detector successfully detects the language of the webpage, but the language is not supported by the translation server because it is too minor. This metric allows us to assess how important the unsupported language is for Google translate.

histogram.name: Translate.UserActionDuration
histogram.summary: The time from a page content language being determined to user requesting Chrome Translate.

histogram.name: TryScroll.SlowScroll
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether the scroll is executed on main thread.

histogram.name: UMA.ClientIdBackupRecoveredWithAge
histogram.summary: Recorded when we are somehow missing the client ID stored in Local State yet are able to recover it from a backup location along with the backed up installation date. This report carries the age in hours of the recovered client id.

histogram.name: UMA.ClientIdMigrated
histogram.summary: Recorded when the one-time UMA client id reset was performed (and the client id of this user was migrated).

histogram.name: UMA.CollectExternalEventsTime
histogram.summary: The time to run the external metrics collection task (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: UMA.Discarded Log Events
histogram.summary: The number of events discarded at log transmission time because the event count was already too large.

histogram.name: UMA.FieldTrialsEnabledBenchmarking
histogram.summary: Log whether the --enable-benchmarking flag was set, which causes field trials to only use the default group.

histogram.name: UMA.GeneratedLowEntropySource
histogram.summary: For each attempt to generate the low entropy source, log whether or not the load required generating a new low entropy source.

histogram.name: UMA.InitSequence
histogram.summary: Logged during MetricsService initialization whether the init task or the initial log timer completed first. The expectation is the vast majority of the time, the init task should complete first. If metrics show otherwise, then it may indicate there's a bug in the MetricsService init sequence and that it should be investigated.

histogram.name: UMA.Large Accumulated Log Not Persisted
histogram.summary: Number of bytes in an excessively large log that was discarded at shutdown instead of being saved to disk to retry during next chrome run.

histogram.name: UMA.Large Rejected Log was Discarded
histogram.summary: Number of bytes in a log was was rejected by server, and then discarded.

histogram.name: UMA.LoadLogsTime
histogram.summary: The time spent to load (de-serialize) unsent logs from local state, recorded during the MetricsService startup sequence.

histogram.name: UMA.LogLoadComplete called
histogram.summary: Simple counter of the number of times LogLoadComplete was called (bug demonstration, as we're called more often than once per page load :-/ )

histogram.name: UMA.LowEntropySourceValue
histogram.summary: Distribution of the low entropy source value used for field trial randomization, recorded on startup.

histogram.name: UMA.MachineIdState
histogram.summary: Tracks if the machine ID is generated successfully and if it changes from one run to the next. The machine ID is a 24-bit hash of machine characteristics. It is expected to change if an install of Chrome is copied to multiple machines. This check happens once per browser startup.

histogram.name: UMA.MetricsIDsReset
histogram.summary: A count of the number of times the metrics ids (client id and low entropy source) have been reset due to a cloned install being detected.

histogram.name: UMA.Perf.GetData
histogram.summary: A count of successes and various failure modes related to collecting and processing performance data obtained through "perf" on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: UMA.ProtoCompressionRatio
histogram.summary: Compression ratio of the serialized protobuf that will be uploaded to the UMA server. This serialized protobuf is compressed using gzip.

histogram.name: UMA.ProtoGzipped
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of Sep, 2013. Gzipping protobufs is now the default.
histogram.summary: Was the UMA protobuf uploaded earlier compressed or not.

histogram.name: UMA.ProtoGzippedKBSaved
histogram.summary: Kilobytes saved from gzipping the protobufs before uploading them.

histogram.name: UMA.StoreLogsTime
histogram.summary: The time spent to store unsent logs to local state, which is done periodically and also during start up if there was an initial stability log.

histogram.name: UMA.Unacceptable_Log_Discarded
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of May, 2012 (i.e. Chrome 21+). Replaced by the UMA.UploadResponseStatus.XML and UMA.UploadResponseStatus.Protobuf histograms.
histogram.summary: The server returned a 400 code, and we discarded a log.
histogram.details: This tends to indicate that a syntax error is present in a log, such as would appear when a bogus XML tag is included, or the XML is not balanced and well structured.

histogram.name: UMA.UploadCreation
histogram.summary: For each attempted UMA upload, log whether the upload was successfully constructed. An upload might fail to be constructed, for example, if we try to upload before the system is fully initialized; or if serialization of the data fails.

histogram.name: UMA.UploadResponseStatus.Protobuf
histogram.summary: For each upload to the protocol buffer (v2) UMA server, log whether the upload was successful, or whether there was an error.

histogram.name: UMA.UploadResponseStatus.XML
histogram.summary: For each upload to the XML (v1) UMA server, log whether the upload was successful, or whether there was an error.

histogram.name: UMA.UsedResetVariationsFlag
histogram.summary: Log whether the --reset-variation-state flag was set before the low entropy source was requested.

histogram.name: UMA.XMLNodeDumpTime
histogram.summary: The time spent in converting the XML tree into a character buffer when closing a metrics log (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: UMA.XMLWriterDestructionTime
histogram.summary: The time spent in freeing the XML writer and tree when closing a metrics log (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.ConnectionType
histogram.summary:
The network connection type when the attempt begins. Possible values include "Unknown", "Ethernet", "Wifi", "Wimax", "Bluetooth", "Cellular", "Tethered Ethernet", "Tethered Wifi".
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.DownloadErrorCode
histogram.summary:
A more detailed description of the last Payload transfer error when downloading the payload.
This is reported when an attempt ends with the "Payload Download Error" result.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.DownloadSource
histogram.summary:
The download source used, possible values include "HTTPS Server", "HTTP Server" and "HTTP Peer".
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.DurationMinutes
histogram.summary:
The number of minutes the update attempt took including the time the device spent sleeping.
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.DurationUptimeMinutes
histogram.summary:
The number of minutes the update attempt took excluding the time the device spent sleeping.
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.InternalErrorCode
histogram.summary:
A more detailed description of the last internal error. The possible values correspond to the ErrorCode enumeration in the update_engine source code.
This is reported when an attempt ends with the InternalError result.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.Number
histogram.summary:
The attempt number which starts at 0 for the initial attempt and keeps increasing for subsequent attempts.
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.PayloadBytesDownloadedMiB
histogram.summary:
The number of payload mebibytes (1048576 bytes) actually download.
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.PayloadDownloadSpeedKBps
histogram.summary:
The payload download speed, in kilobytes per second (1000 bytes/second). This is calculated as the number of bytes downloaded divided by the duration of the attempt (excluding time spent sleeping).
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.PayloadSizeMiB
histogram.summary:
The payload size, in mebibytes (1048576 bytes).
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.PayloadType
histogram.summary:
The payload type, possible values include "Delta" (if Omaha specified to download a delta payload); and "Full" (if Omaha specified to download a full payload); and "ForcedFull" (if the client specified that it would only accept a full payload).
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.Result
histogram.summary:
The result of the update attempt.
This is reported when an update attempt ends.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.TimeSinceLastAttemptMinutes
histogram.summary:
The number of minutes since the last attempt including the time the device spent sleeping.
This is reported when an update attempt ends but only if there was a previous attempt for the same update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Attempt.TimeSinceLastAttemptUptimeMinutes
histogram.summary:
The number of minutes since the last attempt excluding the time the device spent sleeping.
This is reported when an update attempt ends but only if there was a previous attempt for the same update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Check.DownloadErrorCode
histogram.summary:
If unable to download a response from Omaha, a more detailed error code is reported in this metric.
This is reported on every update check resulting in "Download error".
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Check.Reaction
histogram.summary:
If there is an update available, this metric will track what the device does with the information. Possible values include "Applying update", "Deferring update", "Ignoring update", and "Backing off".
This is reported on update checks resulting in "Update available".
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Check.Result
histogram.summary:
The response from Omaha. Possible values include "No update available", "Update available", "Download error", "Response parsing error", and "Reboot pending".
This is reported on every update check.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Check.TimeSinceLastCheckMinutes
histogram.summary:
The number of minutes since the last check including the time the device spent sleeping.
This is reported on every update check except for the first one.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Check.TimeSinceLastCheckUptimeMinutes
histogram.summary:
The number of minutes since the last check excluding the time the device spent sleeping.
This is reported on every update check except for the first one.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Daily.OSAgeDays
histogram.summary:
The age of the OS in days, defined as the age of the /etc/lsb-release file.
This is reported on every update check but at most once a day.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.FailedUpdateCount
histogram.summary:
The number of consecutive times a device has failed to boot an update that successfully applied.
This is reported every time the firmware fails to boot the slot with the update and fell back to the slot it originally updated from.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.InstallDateProvisioningSource
histogram.summary:
The source used to provision the install-date-days value sent to Omaha with every request.
This is reported when OOBE (Out Of Box Experience) completes (M34 or later) or when upgrading to a version with install-date-days support.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.Rollback.Result
histogram.summary:
Whether rollback worked.
This is reported every time there's a rollback request.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.AttemptCount
histogram.summary:
The total number of update attempts required to update the device.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.BytesDownloadedMiB
histogram.summary:
The total number of bytes downloaded in mebibytes (1048576 bytes) using all available sources (e.g. HTTP, HTTPS, HTTP Peer).
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.BytesDownloadedMiBHttpPeer
histogram.summary:
The total number of bytes downloaded in mebibytes (1048576 bytes) using HTTP from a local peer.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.BytesDownloadedMiBHttpServer
histogram.summary:
The total number of bytes downloaded in mebibytes (1048576 bytes) using HTTP.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.BytesDownloadedMiBHttpsServer
histogram.summary:
The total number of bytes downloaded in mebibytes (1048576 bytes) using HTTPS.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.DownloadOverheadPercentage
histogram.summary:
The ratio between bytes downloaded and payload size minus 100.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.DownloadSourcesUsed
histogram.summary:
The various download sources used - this is a combination of the values "HTTPS Server", "HTTP Server" and "HTTP Peer".
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.PayloadSizeMiB
histogram.summary:
The size of the payload, in mebibytes (1048576 bytes).
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.PayloadType
histogram.summary:
The payload type ("Delta", "Full", "ForcedFull") used.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.RebootCount
histogram.summary:
The total number of reboots during the update.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.TotalDurationMinutes
histogram.summary:
The total number of minutes from when an update was detected until an update (possibly another update) was applied. This includes the time waiting for update checks and time the device spent sleeping.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.UpdatesAbandonedCount
histogram.summary:
The total number of updates that were abandoned since the last successful update.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.SuccessfulUpdate.UrlSwitchCount
histogram.summary:
The total number of times the URL was switched (from e.g. HTTPS to HTTP) because of failures.
This is reported on every successful update.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: UpdateEngine.TimeToRebootMinutes
histogram.summary:
The duration between when an update has successfully completed and the user is presented with the "reboot arrow" and when the system has booted into the new update.
This is reported every time the device is rebooted after an update has been applied.
This metric is specific to ChromeOS.

histogram.name: Uptime.ChromeExecToLoginPromptVisibleAfterLogout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when Chrome is started, and when the login prompt is again visible after a logout. This statistic is only collected when preceeded by a logout.

histogram.name: Uptime.LoginPromptSetupTimeAfterLogout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS for setting up for a login after a logout. More specifically, it is the time between when the Cryptohome is unmounted (the last step in the logout process) and when the login prompt is again visible after a logout.

histogram.name: Uptime.Logout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS when performing a logout. More specifically, it is the time between when a logout is initiated and when the Cryptohome is unmounted, signaling the last step in the logout process. This statistic is not collected when the logout is part of a restart or shutdown.

histogram.name: Uptime.LogoutToLoginPromptVisible
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between initiating a logout and the next time the login prompt is visible again. This statistic is not collected if the machine is shutdown between the logout initiation and the prompt becoming visible.

histogram.name: Uptime.LogoutToUIStopAfterLogout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when a logout is initiated and the UI has stopped (and Chrome has exited) during the logout process. This statistic is not collected if the logout is part of a restart or shutdown.

histogram.name: Uptime.ProcessesTerminatedToXTerminatedAfterLogout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when all user-associated processes (including the X server) have been terminated during the logout process. This statistic is not collected if the logout is part of a restart or shutdown.

histogram.name: Uptime.UIStopToProcessesTerminatedAfterLogout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when the UI has stopped (Chrome has exited), and when all other associated processes have been terminated during the logout process. This statistic is not collected if the logout is part of a restart or shutdown.

histogram.name: Uptime.XTerminatedToChromeExecAfterLogout
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when the X server has been terminated from a previous logout and when Chrome is started again to show the login screen.

histogram.name: UserImage.ChangeChoice
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Distribution of the default images that users choose in Change Picture dialog (Chrome OS). One sample is taken each time the user changes picture.

histogram.name: UserImage.FirstTimeChoice
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Distribution of the default images chosen on user image screen during out-of-the-box experience (Chrome OS). One sample is taken each time the user confirms the choice by clicking OK button.

histogram.name: UserImage.LoggedIn
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Distribution of the default images that existing users login with (Chrome OS). One sample is taken each time the user logs in.

histogram.name: UserImage.ProfileDownloadResult
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Profile image download result for UserManager (either on behalf of the Change Picture prefs page, OOBE or scheduled refresh after user login).

histogram.name: UserImage.ProfileDownloadTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time it took to download user's profile picture.

histogram.name: UserImage.ScreenIsShownTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time histogram of the "Choose Picture" OOBE screen display delay.

histogram.name: UserManager.LoginUserType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of users of different types that log in to the system (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: UserManager.LogoutToLoginDelay
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time between one regular user logging out and a different regular user logging in (Chrome OS). Delays above thirty minutes or which span system reboots or non-regular-user logins are not reported.

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent generating native code for functions.

histogram.name: V8.CodegenFractionCrankshaft
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total generated code which was generated using the Crankshaft optimizing compiler, after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.Compile
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: V8.CompileEval
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: V8.CompileLazy
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: V8.DeferredCodeGeneration

histogram.name: V8.ExecutableMemoryMax
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
