histogram.name: V8.GCCompactor
histogram.summary: Time spent in mark-sweep phase of GC.

histogram.name: V8.GCContext

histogram.name: V8.GCScavenger

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationCellSpace
histogram.summary: External memory fragmentation in the cell space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationCodeSpace
histogram.summary: External memory fragmentation in the code space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationLoSpace
histogram.summary: External memory fragmentation in the large object space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationMapSpace
histogram.summary: External memory fragmentation in the map space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationOldDataSpace
histogram.summary: External memory fragmentation in the old data space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationOldPointerSpace
histogram.summary: External memory fragmentation in the old pointer space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationTotal
histogram.summary: Total external memory fragmentation after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionCellSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the cell space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionCodeSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the code space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionLoSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the lo space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionMapSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the map space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionNewSpace

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionOldDataSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the old data space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionOldPointerSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the old pointer space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapSampleCellSpaceCommitted
histogram.summary: The size of committed memory in the cell space after each GC in KB.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapSampleCodeSpaceCommitted
histogram.summary: The size of committed memory in the code space after each GC in KB.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapSampleMapSpaceCommitted
histogram.summary: The size of committed memory in the map space after each GC in KB.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapSampleTotalCommitted
histogram.summary: The total size of committed memory used by V8 after each GC in KB.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapSampleTotalUsed
histogram.summary: The total size of live memory used by V8 after each GC in KB.

histogram.name: Variations.DisabledNoEntropyProvider
histogram.summary: A count of the number of times we hit the code where a field trial is disabled because no entropy provider was provided.

histogram.name: Variations.FailedRequestErrorCode
histogram.summary: The counts of network error codes encountered by VariationsService when an attempt to fetch a variations seed from the server fails.

histogram.name: Variations.FetchNotModifiedLatency
histogram.summary: The latency of a VariationsService seed fetch that results in a not modified response.

histogram.name: Variations.FetchOtherLatency
histogram.summary: The latency of a VariationsService seed fetch that results in neither a success nor not modified response.

histogram.name: Variations.FetchSuccessLatency
histogram.summary: The latency of a VariationsService seed fetch that results in a success response.

histogram.name: Variations.HeaderConstructionTime
histogram.summary: How long it took to create the X-Client-Data header.

histogram.name: Variations.Headers.ExperimentCount
histogram.summary: Records number of experiment ids in the X-Client-Data header at the time the header is constructed.

histogram.name: Variations.LoadSeedSignature
histogram.summary: The result of verifying the variations seed signature, recorded when the variations seed is stored to Local State after being retrieved from the server.

histogram.name: Variations.NetworkAvailability
histogram.summary: Whether or not the network was available when requested by the VariationsService.

histogram.name: Variations.ResourceRequestsAllowed
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the VariationsService is allowed or not allowed to make a request due to the ResourceRequestAllowedNotifier.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedDateChange
histogram.summary: Counts if a response from the variations server is the first response of the day or not. This is counted when a new valid seed or a 304 is received. The date line is computed in UTC and the times being compared are the server time from the server response and the stored server time from the last successful request.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedEmpty
histogram.summary: Records whether the variations seed in local state is empty (does not exist) on startup.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedFetchResponseCode
histogram.summary: The counts of HTTP response codes encountered by VariationsService when attempting to fetch a variations seed from the server.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedFreshness
histogram.summary: The time interval between when the Variations seed was last downloaded and when it was used.

histogram.name: Variations.ServerStudyExpiredUniformity1Percent
histogram.summary: Whether or not the 1-Percent uniformity trial from the Variations server was expired when loaded.

histogram.name: Variations.SimulateSeed.Duration
histogram.summary:
Records the time taken to perform variations seed simulation.
Recorded on every variation seed simulation, which follows a fetch.

histogram.name: Variations.SimulateSeed.KillBestEffortChanges
histogram.summary:
Records the result of variations seed simulation. Logs the number of experiment groups in the "kill best effort" category that are expected to change on a restart of the browser with the received seed.
Recorded on every variation seed simulation, which follows a fetch.

histogram.name: Variations.SimulateSeed.KillCriticalChanges
histogram.summary:
Records the result of variations seed simulation. Logs the number of experiment groups in the "kill critical" category that are expected to change on a restart of the browser with the received seed.
Recorded on every variation seed simulation, which follows a fetch.

histogram.name: Variations.SimulateSeed.NormalChanges
histogram.summary:
Records the result of variations seed simulation. Logs the number of experiment groups in the "normal" category that are expected to change on a restart of the browser with the received seed.
Recorded on every variation seed simulation, which follows a fetch.

histogram.name: Variations.StoreSeedSignature
histogram.summary: The result of verifying the variations seed signature, recorded when the variations seed is loaded from Local State.

histogram.name: Variations.TimeSinceLastFetchAttempt
histogram.summary: The time since the previous attempt to fetch the variations seed within the same session, with 0 indicating that this is the first attempt. Recorded when a variations seed fetch is attempted by the VariationsService.

histogram.name: Variations.UniformityTrialExpired
histogram.summary: A count of the number of times we hit the code where the UMA-Uniformity-Trial-1-Percent field trial is disabled as a result of the expiration check.

histogram.name: Variations.UniformityTrialGroupNotActive
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the UMA-Uniformity-Trial-1-Percent field trial was not active and which factors contributed to it.

histogram.name: Viewport.MetaTagType
histogram.summary: The viewport meta tag type seen on each page load. Only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: Viewport.OverviewZoom
histogram.summary: The screen width as a percentage of viewport width (i.e. zoom at which we can see the whole page). Only recorded on Android and for viewport meta tags with constant width.

histogram.name: VirtualKeyboard.KeyboardControlEvent
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: A count of various control events that can occur on the virtual keyboard, such as showing and hiding.

histogram.name: VirtualKeyboard.KeystrokesBetweenBackspace
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of keys typed by the virtual keyboard between each backspace. This metric provides a rough approximation of an error rate for the virtual keyboard.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.AcceptLegalDocuments
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's accept legal document API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.AuthenticateInstrument
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's authenticate instrument API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.GetFullWallet
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's get full wallet API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.GetWalletItems
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's get wallet items API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveAddress
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 7/2013, replaced by Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveToWallet.
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's save address API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveInstrument
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 7/2013, replaced by Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveToWallet.
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's save instrument API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveInstrumentAndAddress

histogram.name: Wallet.MalformedResponse
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times each Wallet API failed due to being unable to parse the response.

histogram.name: Wallet.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: HTTP response codes seen by Wallet client.

histogram.name: WebCore.Animation.CSSProperties
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times each CSS property is animated. There is no limit on the number of times each property is counted per page view -- a property that is animated multiple times during a single page view is counted each time it animates.

histogram.name: WebCore.Document.execCommand
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times each document.execCommand is executed. This doesn't count commands not supported by Blink.

histogram.name: WebCore.Editing.Commands
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times each Editor::Command::execute is called. This doesn't count commands not supported by Blink.

histogram.name: WebCore.FeatureObserver
histogram.summary: Count of how many instances of WebCore::Page use various features. Each WebCore::Page instance has a WebCore::UseCounter instance. It records and reports feature usage (e.g. via UseCounter::count() method).

histogram.name: WebCore.FeatureObserver.CSSProperties
histogram.summary: Records usage of CSS properties used on a page, either statically or dynamically, from the time the page is initialised to when it is closed or navigated away from. Each property is counted at most once per page per view.
histogram.details:
Every time a CSS property is parsed on a page, that property is recorded as having been used. The histogram is updated with this data whenever a page is closed, or a page navigation happens. Each histogram bucket corresponds to a CSS property (eg width, border-radius). The exception is the bucket numbered '1' - this counts the number of pages that CSS properties were counted on.
These numbers give the percentage of pages that use a CSS property. For example, if the 'border-radius' histogram bucket has a count of 250, and the page count bucket (i.e. bucket number 1) has a count of 1000 - this means that 1000 pages were recorded, and border-radius was used on 25% of those pages.
Internally, each WebCore::Page has a WebCore::UseCounter instance, with booleans recording use of each CSS property - one boolean per property. Upon destruction of the WebCore::Page (e.g. by the user closing the tab), or a page navigation happening, the histogram is updated. For each boolean that is set to True, the corresponding histogram bucket for that CSS property is incremented by 1. The page count bucket (i.e. bucket number 1) is always incremented by 1 on each histogram update.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.BackingStore.ConsistencyError

histogram.name: WebFont.Resource.StyleRecalcToDownloadLatency
histogram.summary: The time from when the webfont was referenced by a calculated style for the first time to the start of the font download. Recorded at most once for each FontResource object (not recorded if the font is retrieved from the memory cache).

histogram.name: WebFont.Resource.UsageType
histogram.summary: For each webfont, this records (a) if the font was 'styled', i.e. referenced by a calculated style for a RenderText before the font data was used, and (b) if the font was actually used or not, i.e. the renderer requested the font data or not. (A Font can be used without being styled, for example when drawn by a Canvas 2D Context.) This is recorded upon a download request of a webfont, or destruction of a FontResource object. Recorded at most once for each FontResource object in the renderer's memory cahce.

histogram.name: WebFont.StyleRecalcToDownloadLatency
histogram.summary: The time from when the webfont was referenced by a calculated style for the first time to the start of the font download.

histogram.name: WebFont.UsageType
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 9/2013, replaced by WebFont.Resource.UsageType.
histogram.summary: For each webfont, this records (a) if the font was 'styled', i.e. referenced by a calculated style for a RenderText before the font data was used, and (b) if the font was actually used or not, i.e. the renderer requested the font data or not. (A Font can be used without being styled, for example when drawn by a Canvas 2D Context.) This is recorded upon a download request of a webfont, or destruction of a CSSFontFaceSource object. Recorded at most once for each url() source of @font-face CSS rule.

histogram.name: WebFont.WebFontsInPage

histogram.name: WebHistory.ResponseTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time it took for the web history to reply. Recorded when the web history API call triggered by visiting chrome://history receives the data, measuring how much time it took for the server to reply.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DataChannelCounters
histogram.summary: Counters on creation, opening, and a few main attributes of data channels.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DataChannelMaxRetransmits
histogram.summary: The maximum number of retransmissions that are attempted in unreliable mode. It is set to the value used in the configuration when a RTCDataChannel is created.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DataChannelMaxRetransmitTime
histogram.summary: The length of the time window during which transmissions and retransmissions may occur in unreliable mode. It is set to the value used in the configuration when a RTCDataChannel is created.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DesktopCaptureCounters
histogram.summary: Counters on creation of DesktopCaptureDevice and the first capture call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.NumDataChannelsPerPeerConnection
histogram.summary: Number of data channels created per PeerConnection. Sample added to the histogram when the PeerConnection is destroyed. Note that this is done purely on the renderer side, so no sample will be generated when the renderer process is destroyed (as in the fast shutdown path for the renderer) before the PeerConnection is destroyed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IPMetrics
histogram.summary: Counters on IPv4 and IPv6 usage in PeerConnection. These values are logged once per PeerConnection.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IPv4Interfaces
histogram.summary: Number of IPv4 network interfaces discovered in a PeerConnection Session.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IPv6Interfaces
histogram.summary: Number of IPv6 network interfaces discovered in a PeerConnection Session.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.TimeToConnect
histogram.summary: Time to setup a peer to peer call with PeerConnection.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ReceivedAudioTrackDuration
histogram.summary: Durations of audio tracks received over a PeerConnection. The stopwatch starts when the track first becomes connected, and ends when it is disconnected or very soon thereafter.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ReceivedVideoTrackDuration
histogram.summary: Durations of video tracks received over a PeerConnection. The stopwatch starts when the track first becomes connected, and ends when it is disconnected or very soon thereafter.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ReliableDataChannelMessageSize
histogram.summary: Sizes of messages sent over reliable data channels. The size of an individual message is added to the histogram as a sample immediately when a message is sent.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ScreenCaptureTime
histogram.summary: Time for capturing one frame in screen capturing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.SentAudioTrackDuration
histogram.summary: Durations of audio tracks sent over a PeerConnection. The stopwatch starts when the track first becomes connected, and ends when it is disconnected or very soon thereafter.

histogram.name: WebRTC.SentVideoTrackDuration
histogram.summary: Durations of video tracks sent over a PeerConnection. The stopwatch starts when the track first becomes connected, and ends when it is disconnected or very soon thereafter.

histogram.name: WebRTC.UnreliableDataChannelMessageSize
histogram.summary: Sizes of messages sent over unreliable data channels. The size of an individual message is added to the histogram as a sample immediately when a message is sent.

histogram.name: WebRTC.UserMediaRequest.NoResultState
histogram.summary:
The state of a UserMediaRequest when it gets destroyed before having a result.
Note: "Explicitly Cancelled" means MediaStreamImpl::cancelUserMediaRequest was called and not necessarily that the user cancelled. Those are likely tracked as UserMediaRequest with a result of permission denied.

histogram.name: WebRTC.UserMediaRequest.Result
histogram.summary: Counters for UserMediaRequests results such as failure reasons.

histogram.name: WebRTC.webkitApiCount
histogram.summary: Counts number of calls to WebRTC APIs from JavaScript.

histogram.name: WebRTC.webkitApiCountPerSession
histogram.summary: Counts the number of calls to WebRTC APIs from JavaScript once per session. A session is a crude estimate since its implemented as the lifetime of the render process that called the WebRTC API.

histogram.name: WebRTC.webkitApiCountUniqueByOrigin
histogram.summary: Counts number of calls to WebRTC APIs from JavaScript, once per origin per renderer process.

histogram.name: WebRTC.WindowCaptureTime
histogram.summary: Time for capturing one frame in window capturing.

histogram.name: Webstore.ExtensionInstallResult
histogram.summary: The success or failure of all extension installs from the webstore. This includes those initiated by sync.

histogram.name: Win8.PageLoad

histogram.name: Windows.Tablet

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.FailedToChangeCores
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Incremented each time the TimeTicks field trial runs on a machine with multiple cores, but failed to change thread affinity. Broken down by Windows version.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.MinResolutionNanoseconds
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The smallest non-zero delta reported by subsequent calls to QueryPerformanceCounter.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.NonStopTsc
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: True if the CPU's time stamp counter ticks at a constant rate regardless of CPU frequency.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.TickedBackwards
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times the TimeTicks field trial failed because QueryPerformanceCounter ticked backwards. Broken down by Windows version.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.VersionSuccessful
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times the TimeTicks field trial succeeded. Broken down by Windows version.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.VersionTotal
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times the TimeTicks field trial ran for comparison with WinTimeTicks.VersionSuccess. Broken down by Windows version.

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.RecentTabsSubMenu
histogram.summary: The number of times each tab or window restore option in the Recent Tabs submenu is clicked.

histogram.name: ZeroSuggest.AllResults
histogram.summary: The number of results (either query or URL) from ZeroSuggest. This is set every time a successful response from ZeroSuggest is recieved, which can be every time the user focuses on the omnibox.

histogram.name: ZeroSuggest.QueryResults
histogram.summary: The number of query results returned from ZeroSuggest. This is set every time a successful response from ZeroSuggest is recieved, which can be every time the user focuses on the omnibox.

histogram.name: ZeroSuggest.URLResults
histogram.summary: The number of URL results returned from ZeroSuggest. This is set every time a successful response from ZeroSuggest is recieved, which can be every time the user focuses on the omnibox.

enum.name: AsyncDNSNameServersType
enum.summary: Type of nameservers in the DNS config.
enum.int: No nameservers configured.
All nameservers are Google Public DNS servers.
All nameservers have public IP addresses (and aren't Google Public DNS servers).
All nameservers have private IP addresses (loopback, link-local, or RFC 1918).
Nameservers are a mix of types (Google Public DNS, public, private).

enum.name: AsyncDNSParseResult
enum.summary: Results of DnsResponse::ParseToAddressList.

enum.name: AsyncDNSResolveStatus
enum.int: Succeeded with async DNS.
Succeeded with getaddrinfo after async DNS failed.
Both async DNS and getaddrinfo failed.
Same as PROC_SUCCESS except the hostname fits NetBIOS name criteria.

enum.name: AsyncDNSWatchStatus

enum.name: CookieDeletionCause
enum.summary: Reason why a cookie was removed from the cookie store
enum.int: The user explicitly requested that we delete a cookie
The value of the cookie was overwritten by a new value
The cookie expiration time passed
The cookie was evicted during garbage collection (replaced by domain_evicted/global_evicted below)
The backing store had two copies of the cookie so one was removed (i.e. problems writing the backing store database)
The cookie deletion should not be recorded because it occurred, e.g., during shutdown (the fact that these values showed up in the histogram is a bug, since fixed)
The cookie was evicted during per-domain/eTLD+1 garbage collection
The cookie was evicted during whole store garbage collection.
The cookie evicted during per-domain/eTLD+1 garbage collection, and would have been evicted by the global garbage collection process (because they hadn't been accessed recently enough).
The cookie evicted during per-domain/eTLD+1 garbage collection, and would not have been evicted by global metrics as well (because they had been accessed recently enough to save).
The cookie deletion occurred because the server overwrote it with an already expired cookie (this is a common idiom for server deletions of cookies).

enum.name: NetworkDhcpClientStatus
enum.int: The DHCP client will attempt to identify the default gateway using a unicast ARP to the gateway's MAC address. This may help speed up the re-connection process.
The DHCP client will attempt to ARP for the IP address that it was supplied. This indicates that the client is unsure whether the address it was assigned is valid.
The DHCP client has successfully acquired an IP address.
The DHCP client has inititated a DHCP DISCOVER, a broadcast request for any server to provide it with an address.
The DHCP client has received more than one offer in response to its DHCP DISCOVER request.
The DHCP client has received an offer in response to its DHCP DISCOVER which is the same as an address it previously failed to validate via an "Arp Self" test.
The DHCP client has received an offer in response to its DHCP DISCOVER which is either an all-zeros or all-ones IP address, and therefore invalid.
The DHCP client has received a response to its DHCP DISCOVER which is not actually a DHCP OFFER.
The DHCP client has issued a DHCP INFORM message for an IP address it has self-assigned.
The DHCP client is intializing its internal state.
The DHCP client has received a DHCP NAK and will defer processing this response for a receive interval.
The DHCP client is performing the second level "rebind" lease renewal stage, and has presumably failed the first level "renew" stage.
The DHCP client is attempting to re-acquire a lease on a network where it had previously been connected at some time in the past.
The DHCP client is releasing its current lease to its assigned IP address.
The DHCP client is performing a first level renewal of its current lease.
The DHCP client is performing a DHCP REQUEST for a lease it has been offered.

enum.name: SSLNonAttackCauses

int.label: WWW_SUBDOMAIN_MATCH: Difference between the URL and the DNS is www

enum.int: This cause is recorded if the ssl error is CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID and the hostname differs from one of the DNS names in the certificate (CN or SANs) only by the presence or absence of the single-label prefix "www". This case is not recored if the host name is not a known TLD.

int.label: SUBDOMAIN_MATCH: The URL is a subdomain of the DNS

enum.int: This cause is recorded if the ssl error is CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID and the difference between the URL and the DNS name is not "www". This case is not recorded if the host name is not a known TLD.

int.label: SUBDOMAIN_INVERSE_MATCH: The DNS is a subdomian of the URL

enum.int: This cause is recorded if the ssl error is CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID and the difference between the DNS name and the URL is not "www". This case is not recorded if the host name is not a known TLD.

int.label: SUBDOMAIN_OUTSIDE_WILDCARD: The URL is outside the scope of the wildcard certificate

enum.int: This cause is recorded only if the ssl error is CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID, we have received a wildcard certificate and the scope of a wildcard certificate is too narrow for the hostname. This case is not recorded if the host name is not a known TLD.

int.label: HOST_NAME_NOT_KNOWN_TLD: The host name is not a known TLD

enum.int: This cause is recorded only for CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID errors.

int.label: LIKELY_MULTI_TENANT_HOSTING: The certificate is a shared certificate

enum.int: This cause is recorded only for CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID errors. It is possible that this error overlaps with others but it is not likely because of the heuristics which decide as to what constitutes a shared certificate. In cases of overlap, we emit to only one bucket.

Built-in touchpad not detected at boot time on a device with built-in touchpad (touchpad failure at boot time)
Built-in touchpad detected at boot time on a device with built-in touchpad
Built-in touchpad not detected at resume time on a device with built-in touchpad (touchpad failure at resume time)
Built-in touchpad detected at resume time on a device with built-in touchpad

enum.name: TouchpadProblemType

The touchpad noise events (e.g. abrupt cursor jumps) caused by the noisy ground.

fp05cc03e1

histogram_suffixes.name: CertificateTypeBRValidity
histogram_suffixes.obsolete: Deprecated as of 8/2013. This histogram only considered the leaf certificate expiry date as a proxy for whether a certificate was in-scope for the BRs, but did not consider the issuance date. As some CAs have issued long-lived certs prior to the BRs, this disproportionately reported those certs as being subject to the BRs, but non-compliant, when in reality they're not subject.

suffix.name: BR
suffix.label: The *leaf* certificate of the chain expires after 2013-12-31, meaning that it should be in scope for the Baseline Requirement's key size requirements

suffix.name: NonBR
suffix.label: The *leaf* certificate of the chain expires on or before 2013-12-31

suffix.name: BR
suffix.label: The *leaf* certificate of the chain expires after 2013-12-31 and was issued on or after 2012-07-01, as judged by the notBefore, meaning that it should be in scope for the Baseline Requirement's key size requirements

suffix.name: NonBR
suffix.label: The *leaf* certificate of the chain expires on or before 2013-12-31 or was issued before 2012-07-01

suffix.name: ReadSuccess
suffix.label: success rate of reading a certificate from the disk cache

suffix.name: ReadFailure
suffix.label: failure rate of reading a certificate from the disk cache

suffix.name: WriteSuccess
suffix.label: success rate of writing a certificate to the disk cache

suffix.name: WriteFailure
suffix.label: failure rate of writing a certificate to the disk cache

suffix.name: DataReductionProxy
suffix.label: Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

suffix.name: ChromeProxy
suffix.label: for each carrier, number of tamperings detected on Chrome-Proxy header

suffix.name: ContentLength
suffix.label: for each carrier, total number of responses whose Content-Length header has been tampered with

suffix.name: ContentLength_CSS
suffix.label: for each carrier, number of CSS responses whose Content-Length header has been tampered with

suffix.name: ContentLength_Image
suffix.label: for each carrier, number of image responses whose Content-Length header has been tampered with

suffix.name: ContentLength_JS
suffix.label: for each carrier, number of JavaScript responses whose Content-Length header has been tampered with

suffix.name: ContentLength_Other
suffix.label: for each carrier, number of other type responses whose Content-Length header has been tampered with

suffix.name: OtherHeaders
suffix.label: for each carrier, number of tamperings detected on a list of headers

suffix.name: Via
suffix.label: for each carrier, number of tamperings detected on Via header

suffix.name: Via_Missing
suffix.label: for each carrier, number of responses whose data reduction proxy's Via header is missing

suffix.name: LocalBypassRules
suffix.label: Bypass due to client-side bypass rules

suffix.name: ShortAudioVideo
suffix.label: Audio/Video bypass due to short bypass

suffix.name: MissingViaHeader4xx
suffix.label: Bypass due to a 4xx missing via header

suffix.name: MissingViaHeaderOther
suffix.label: Bypass due to other missing via header

suffix.name: Malformed407
suffix.label: Bypass due to 407 response from proxy without a challenge

suffix.name: Status500HttpInternalServerError
suffix.label: Bypass due to internal server error

suffix.name: Status502HttpBadGateway
suffix.label: Bypass because the request URI was too long

suffix.name: NetworkErrorProxyConnectionFailed
suffix.label: Bypass due to failed proxy connection

suffix.name: NetworkErrorProxyCertificateInvalid
suffix.label: Bypass due to invalid proxy certificate

suffix.name: NetworkErrorOther
suffix.label: Bypass due to any network error

suffix.name: PacedPacket
suffix.label: In this histogram results are only shown if at least two packets were ACKed in the Startup Test. Packets are sent at equal intervals. The interval is selected to match the bandwidth discovered during the StartPacket test.

suffix.name: StartPacket
suffix.label: Packets are sent as rapidly as possible, just after successfully sending an UMA upload. Each packet was numbered, as was its ACK sent back by Google. If no packets (of the 21) were ever ACKed, then the port is assumed to be blocked, and no data is recorded in this histogram.

suffix.name: Sent21
suffix.label: This histogram shows the number of echo responses received from the first

suffix.name: Sent21.AckReceivedForNthPacket
suffix.label: Each packet was numbered, as was its ACK sent back by Google. This histogram records, for each packet number, how often we received an ACK for that packet.

suffix.name: Sent21.GotAnAck
suffix.label: The histogram shows if we ever got an ACK for a packet in our series of 21.

suffix.name: Sent21.443
suffix.label: This histogram shows the difference between the time when we have received 1st byte from the server and the last time when we have received data from the server on port 443.

suffix.name: Sent21.6121
suffix.label: This histogram shows the difference between the time when we have received 1st byte from the server and the last time when we have received data from the server on port 6121.

suffix.name: 443.100B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.1200B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.500B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 6121.100B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.1200B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.500B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: Sent21.Success.RTT
suffix.label: The histogram shows the RTT for

suffix.name: Sent21.PacketsSent
suffix.label: This histogram records how many packets (out of 21 attempted) were sent to the server via UDP.

suffix.name: Send6.SeriesAcked
suffix.label: Chrome sends 6 UDP packets in a row to test to see if there is a probabalistic dependency in packet loss for consecutive packets. We record a bit vector of packets received, where the least significant bit is a 1 if the first packet was received, etc. For example, if all packets other than packet 2 and 4 are responded to, then we'd have a sample (in binary) of 110101B, or 53.

suffix.name: 443.100B
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.500B
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.1200B
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 6121.100B
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.500B
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.1200B
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 443.100B
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.100B.NoProxy
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 443 with no proxy.

suffix.name: 443.500B
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.500B.NoProxy
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 443 with no proxy.

suffix.name: 443.1200B
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.1200B.NoProxy
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 443 with no proxy.

suffix.name: 6121.100B
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.100B.NoProxy
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 6121 with no proxy.

suffix.name: 6121.500B
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.500B.NoProxy
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 6121 with no proxy.

suffix.name: 6121.1200B
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.1200B.NoProxy
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 6121 with no proxy.

suffix.name: NATBind.Sent2
suffix.label: Two packets were sent spreading over a random period, to test if the NAT dropped the binding. Afterwords, an extra (short) packet was sent with renewed NAT binding to test whether the network that was used to deliver the first packet is still connected. Results are only shown in this histogram if at least ten packets were received in the StartPacket test.

suffix.name: NonPacedPacket
suffix.label: 21 Packets were sent as rapidly as possible. Results are only shown in this histogram if at least two packets were received in the StartPacket Test.

suffix.name: PacedPacket
suffix.label: 21 Packets were sent at equal intervals, which were selected to match the bandwidth discovered during the StartPacket test. Results are only shown in this histogram if at least two packets were received in the StartPacket Test.

suffix.name: StartPacket
suffix.label: 21 Packets were sent as rapidly as possible, just after the client successfully sent a UMA upload. Each packet was numbered when it was sent by Google.

suffix.name: Bind.Failure
suffix.label: Only when the second packet never arrived (we wait for 10 extra seconds) and the first and the extra (short) packets arrived did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

suffix.name: Bind.Success
suffix.label: Only when all three packets including the extra (short) packet arrived did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

suffix.name: Connectivity.Failure
suffix.label: Only when the extra (short) packet (with renewed NAT binding) never arrived (we wait for 10 extra seconds) did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

suffix.name: Connectivity.Success
suffix.label: Only when the extra (short) packet arrived did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

suffix.name: SendToLastRecvDelay
suffix.label: This histogram records the time duration (in milliseconds) between the client sending the request and the receiving of the second packet sent from the server, excluding the idle time between sendings of the first two packets. Results are only shown if the first two packets are both received.

suffix.name: First6.SeriesRecv
suffix.label: This histogram records a bit vector of the first 6 packets sent, where the least significant bit is a 1 if the first packet was received, etc. For example, if all packets other than packet 2 and 4 are received, then we'd have a sample (in binary) of 110101B, or 53.

suffix.name: Sent21
suffix.label: This histogram shows the number of packets received from the first

suffix.name: Sent21.GotAPacket
suffix.label: The histogram shows if we ever got at least one packet in our series of 21.

suffix.name: Sent21.PacketDelay
suffix.label: The histogram shows the average inter-arrival time between every two consecutive packets we receive in our series of 21 multiplied by 20 (so this is essentially the time duration between the first and the last received packets).

suffix.name: Sent21.PacketsRecv
suffix.label: The histogram shows how many packets we receive in our series of 21.

suffix.name: Sent21.RecvNthPacket
suffix.label: Each packet was numbered when it was sent by Google. This histogram records, for each packet number, how often we received that packet.

suffix.name: Sent21.SendToLastRecvDelay
suffix.label: This histogram records the time duration between the client sending the request and the receiving of the last packet sent from the server, excluding the total pacing time requested by the client. Results are only shown if at least two packets are received.

suffix.name: Sent21.Success.RTT
suffix.label: The histogram shows the RTT for the

suffix.name: 100Percent_1MinSeen_A
suffix.label: Progressive scan @ all previously seen frequencies (A).

suffix.name: 100Percent_1MinSeen_B
suffix.label: Progressive scan @ all previously seen frequencies (B).

suffix.name: Applied
suffix.label: change has been accepted by user

suffix.name: Discarded
suffix.label: change has been reverted by user

suffix.name: Restored
suffix.label: search provider restored by Protector before showing the bubble

suffix.name: Timeout
suffix.label: change has been ignored by user (timed out)

suffix.name: SelectPort
suffix.label: An effort was mode to (try to) consistently connect using the same source port for the given server IP/port.

suffix.name: RandomPort
suffix.label: The operating system randomly selected a source port for the connection.

suffix.name: ForHTTP
suffix.label: Only insecure HTTP connections are counted.

suffix.name: ForHTTPS
suffix.label: Only secure HTTPS connections are counted.

suffix.name: Fast
suffix.label: Fast start by skipping normal chrome.dll startup.

suffix.name: Char
suffix.label: The Char event occurs on textual keyboard input.

suffix.name: GestureDoubleTap
suffix.label: A GestureDoubleTap occurs when the user double taps on a touchscreen.

suffix.name: GestureFlingCancel
suffix.label: A GestureFlingCancel is sent to the renderer to cancel any active flings.

suffix.name: GestureFlingStart
suffix.label: A GestureFlingStart is sent when the user quickly flicks on a touchscreen.

suffix.name: GestureLongPress
suffix.label: A GestureLongPress is sent when the user taps down and holds their finger on a touchscreen.

suffix.name: GestureLongTap
suffix.label: A GestureLongTap is sent when the user taps down on a touchscreen, holds their finger for a while, then releases.

suffix.name: GesturePinchBegin
suffix.label: A GesturePinchBegin is sent when a user starts a pinch zoom motion on a touchscreen.

suffix.name: GesturePinchEnd
suffix.label: A GesturePinchEnd is sent when the user releases their fingers from the touchscreen after performing a pinch zoom motion.

suffix.name: GesturePinchUpdate
suffix.label: GesturePinchUpdate events are sent while the user is performing a pinch zoom motion on a touch screen. GesturePinchUpdate events are sent as the user changes the distance between their fingers.

suffix.name: GestureScrollBegin
suffix.label: A GestureScrollBegin is sent at the beginning of a gesture scroll on a touchscreen.

suffix.name: GestureScrollEnd
suffix.label: A GestureScrollEnd is sent when the user releases their finger after a gesture scroll on a touchscreen.

suffix.name: GestureScrollUpdate
suffix.label: GestureScrollUpdate events are sent as the user drags their finger along the touchscreen during a gesture scroll.

suffix.name: GestureScrollUpdateWithoutPropagation
suffix.label: GestureScrollUpdateWithoutPropagation events are scroll updates that shouldn't bubble, generated by a gesture fling.

suffix.name: GestureShowPress
suffix.label: A GestureShowPress event is sent when the user presses down on the touchscreen but before a GestureTapDown.

suffix.name: GestureTap
suffix.label: A GestureTap is sent when the user presses down and releases on a touchscreen.

suffix.name: GestureTapUnconfirmed
suffix.label: A GestureTapUnconfirmed is sent when the user taps the touchscreen but, due to a delay, the GestureTap isn't sent yet.

suffix.name: GestureTapCancel
suffix.label: A GestureTapCancel is sent to cancel a pending GestureTap event. For example, if the user taps down but drags their finger instead of releasing it.

suffix.name: GestureTapDown
suffix.label: A GestureTapDown is sent when the user presses on the touchscreen in what could potentially be a full GestureTap event.

suffix.name: GestureTwoFingerTap
suffix.label: A GestureTwoFingerTap is sent when the user presses down a releases on a touchscreen with two fingers.

suffix.name: KeyDown
suffix.label: A KeyDown event is sent when a keyboard key is pressed down.

suffix.name: KeyUp
suffix.label: A KeyUp event is sent when a depressed keyboard key is released.

suffix.name: MouseDown
suffix.label: A MouseDown event is sent when the user click down a mouse button.

suffix.name: MouseEnter
suffix.label: A MouseEnter event is sent when the mouse cursor enters the renderer area.

suffix.name: MouseLeave
suffix.label: A MouseLeave event is sent when the mouse cursor leaves the renderer area.

suffix.name: MouseMove
suffix.label: A MouseMove event is sent when the mouse cursor moves within the renderer area.

suffix.name: MouseUp
suffix.label: A MouseUp event is sent when a depressed mouse button is released.

suffix.name: MouseWheel
suffix.label: A MouseWheel event is sent when the user scrolls using the mouse wheel within the renderer area.

suffix.name: RawKeyDown
suffix.label: A RawKeyDown event is a wrapper around a native key event.

suffix.name: TouchCancel
suffix.label: A TouchCancel is used to cancel an existing touch point. For example, if the user drags a finger outside the bounds of the renderer.

suffix.name: TouchEnd
suffix.label: A TouchEnd is send when the user lifts a finger from the touchscreen.

suffix.name: TouchMove
suffix.label: A TouchMove is sent when the user moves a finger along the touchscreen.

suffix.name: TouchStart
suffix.label: A TouchStart is sent when the user first touches a finger to the touchscreen.

suffix.name: Fast
suffix.label: Fast start by skipping normal chrome.dll startup.

suffix.name: AndroidAccountConsistencyFirstRunActions
suffix.label: Signin Flow shown on android after Account Consistency flag was enabled.

suffix.name: FirstRun
suffix.label: First execution of the reconciler after the profile was loaded or the new_profile_management flag was toggled.

suffix.name: SubsequentRun
suffix.label: Execution of the reconciler triggered by some other change of state.

suffix.name: SSLForProxies
suffix.label: SSLClientSocket wrapping the TCPClient socket eventually used for connection to a proxy

suffix.name: SSLforHTTPSProxy
suffix.label: SSLClientSocket wrapping the TCPClient socket eventually used for connection to an HTTPS proxy

suffix.name: TCP
suffix.label: plain, no proxy, no SSL socket

suffix.name: TCPforHTTPProxy
suffix.label: TCPClientSocket eventually used for connection to an HTTP proxy

suffix.name: TCPforHTTPSProxy
suffix.label: TCPClientSocket eventually used for connection to an HTTPS proxy

suffix.name: TCPforSOCKS
suffix.label: TCPClientSocket eventually used for connection to a SOCKS proxy

suffix.name: cwndMin16
suffix.label: using dynamic cwnd policy no lower than 16

suffix.name: cwndMin10
suffix.label: using dynamic cwnd policy no lower than 10

suffix.name: npn_with_http
suffix.label: with NPN negotiated but using HTTP instead of SPDY

suffix.name: npn_with_spdy
suffix.label: with NPN negotiated and using SPDY

suffix.name: ThreadNowDuration
suffix.label: Duration is in thread CPU time.

suffix.name: others
suffix.label: Fonts other than Roboto and Open Sans

suffix.name: Disabled
suffix.label: Neither extra webstore link is visible

suffix.name: FooterLink
suffix.label: Link in bottom right of footer
